Attentive waiters and they definitely crank people out fast, they got mouthes to feed! When you're done, hop over to the Purikura and get super nerdy in the photo booths. Gotta love that kitschy Japanese pics and it's a great way to document the day you probably had some of the best ramen ever.
author: Shayan S.

description:
Delicious! The chicken paitan is fantastically rich and hearty. I would strongly advise showing up 30 mins (at least!) before they open, as the wait is no joke. 

If you do end up on the waitlist, you can get a call notification when your table is ready, which is nice as you can browse the nearby shops.
author: Jacqueline O.

description:
I got the Marufuku Ramen DX, everything from the bouillon to the noodles and accompagnements were perfectly balanced. The cured pork brings a contrast to the pork belly both in taste and texture. It's a happy experience for the tummy, the eyes and the soul! 
Itadakimasu! Bon Appétit!
author: Matt V.

description: There's always a wait unless you're there at opening but the food is so good. It's worth arriving when you're not hungry, put your name down and wander around for a bit. By the time it's your turn to be seated you'll be hungry enough for your bowl of ramen.
author: Ana G.

description: The wait time is insanely long but for good reason. This is literally the best tasting food/ramen I have ever had! Make sure to add your name to the waitlist before you even get there, lots to see while waiting in various shops. This is a must do while in SF, I will forever be dreaming of this ramen!!!
author: Taylor W.

description: Ordered the Tonkatsu ramen and Chasu rice. The noodles were good in a creamy rich broth, with slices of pork belly and a perfectly poached egg. I like that they asked for your spice level preference. I really enjoyed the Chasu rice. Meat was so tender and nicely flavored the rice. Great price at $4 per bowl. Size of rice bowl is not big but perfect for me. Service was friendly and efficient. We got there at 10:50am and were included in the group that got seated when they opened at 11:30am. Had tried the night before to get in, and it was a 2 hour wait so we gave up. Not sure I would wait 2 hours next time, that's a long time. Recommend signing in on yelp ahead of time.
author: Nancy P.

description:
I have very mixed feelings about the ramen here. 

First off, the wait was... ahhaha.... the worst. It was very annoying because we waited more than an hour and we discovered that they had skipped over us and seated the people after us before us!!! Bummer. Super irritating because we were hangry too. LOL

So we get in. We sit. I think we all got the Hakata Tonkotsu ramen, and we did not have to wait long at all for the ramen to come out. Let's dive into the details of the ramen, shall we? 

The soup. Yes, dear lord, probably one of the best broths in ramen I've ever had. And the noodles were cooked to perfection!! I am a fan of snappy thin ramen noodles, not the thicker kind, so I'm a little biased. However, those were the only two elements of the ramen that I truly enjoyed. The meat was very sweet, and I felt like it clashed with the savory umami flavor of the soup. The quality of the meat was very, very good though. And the egg was also weirdly sweet, which I also did not like. It is also important to note that I do not care to mix salty and sweet flavors, so if you do like that kind of thing you will probably like the meat and egg. 

However, I was bummed since those two things are crucial to ramen, and I didn't like either of them. Hence minus one star for each. Other than that, service was good, wait time for the food was fast, and the price was pretty good.
author: Kaitlin F.

description: After seeing this was the top of the list for ramen in San Francisco, we had to go. After reserving our spot, in the hour wait, on the yelp app, I can say that this was the best ramen I've ever had. We ordered the japanese fried chicken, a salad, the basic chicken ramen and two of the deluxe pork belly ramen. The ramen and the japanese fried chicken were the highlights. This was definitely worth the wait.
author: Zen W.

description: Ramen broth here is delicious. Very creamy and rich. Noodles are on the thinner side, but very tasty as well. I'd eat here more often if the wait wasn't at least 2+ hours every single time.
author: irene f.

description: The broth is delicious. Not the best ramen I've ever had, but definitely above average compared to other ramen places in SF. Get the tonkotsu ramen. I had so much broth left over I ordered an extra side of noodles. 2 for the price of one! After we left, we went straight downstairs for some matcha ice cream.
author: Jen P.

description:
Chicken Paitan 
The smell of grilled mungbean sprouts  I always wondered what this smell was in Chinese restaurants, maybe stir-frying with coriannder? but no, it was mungbean sprouts
We had 2 Tonkotsu + a side order of Chicken Paitan for $6 
The chicken paitan was like a Cantonese roast meat it was delicious!! The size of American chicken...  I had this yesterday and could have this again today.
I usually do kaedama or sides, but here I was so stuffed that I couldn't entirely finish the soup (which usually never happens). I felt more stuffed because of the fattyness  Nice big American portions.
Last words. Relive the chicken paitan.
author: Julie B.

description:
HANDS. DOWN. This is my FAAAAVORITE ramen place in SF. Totally gives me Japan withdrawals. ;~; 

This place gets so addicting. Hence the typical hour waits. Make sure to place your name on the waiting list, then you can walk around the cute Japantown plaza to kill some time.

They serve Hakata style ramen here (aka tonkotsu + thin ramen noodles, just the type of noodles I like, I love them!). Their thin noodles are similar kind to Ichiran and Ippudo. 

I've tried a good portion of their menu: Hakata Tonkotsu, Hakata DX, Chicken Paitan DX, Chicken Karrage, Takoyaki, and Geso Fry. 

Their soup base is so on point. They have a range from no spicy all the way to ultra spicy so there's definitely one that'll suite your taste buds best. Personally, I always get the ultra spicy, it just hits me at the right spot. I find it rare for Japanese ramen restaurants to actually follow through with their spicy level since usually their hottest options are just an illusion after you taste it (of course, aside from Ramen Yamadaya's hell and death ramen, I don't mess). 

Main difference between Hakata's Tonkotsu (default go-to) and their DX is their pork belly vs. the braised pork. Just in the preference of meat. Don't let the bowl deceive you. It's actually a bowl of bottomless noodles. Had a friend where he got deceived by the eyes and ordered extra noodles (the Kaedama- Hakata style), he suffered after, so order at your own risk! Oh and did I mention their soft boiled eggs are THE BEST?! I don't know what they do to them whether it's marinated or shipped over but they're bomb. 

For the Chicken Paitan DX, even though it's limited per day, personally I would skip it and just stick with the regular Chicken Paitan. The only difference is you're paying for that extra grilled chicken on the side for that extra $4, anddddd I thought the chicken was alrightttt, nothing too special. 

Chicken Karrage.. juicy, comes with a light amount of bite size fried chickens along with a wedge of lemon and Japanese mayonnaise. Standard. 

Takoyaki.. fresh, HOT, and of course, an octopus filled center. One of the better Takoyaki's I've had. 

Andddd lastly, the Geso Fry... aka the fried squid legs. Don't let the description disgust you, imo I enjoy this side dish the most. It's something different and it has a nice chew to it. Comes with the same pairing as the Karrage, highly recommend it if you want to venture out!
author: Aly C.

description: My friend and I came here for lunch during the cherry blossom festival and it was great! We put our name on the list and were 28th in line and it was a 1.5 hour wait but they have a waitlist system so that you can put your name down and then roam around rather than standing in line. They text you when you're supposed to come back to the restaurant. The ramen was amazing! They have 5 spice levels and thy are very accommodating on individual requests for each order (if you want to remove or add specific ingredients). The hot sake was good too!
author: Piyali B.

description: Ask for the fresh garlic when you are feeling under the weather. It works! But it's super intense. My favorite ramen place in SF.
author: Camille L.

description:
So far, one of the better ramen spots in San Francisco. I don't go out and hunt for the best ramen restaurants but if people tell me there's a decent place to try, I'm curious. 

The broth here is actually kinda good. The noodles are a little different but cooked pretty well, nice chew to them. 

Come early to line up so you won't have to wait for tables to clear. They get busy even on weekdays.
author: Gordon L.

description: Some of the best Ramen that I have ever had!  Worth the wait!  Everything is amazing.  Broth is simmered for over 20 hours and the noodles are fantastic.  Highly recommend ordering and additional side of noodles with your order!
author: Bill S.

description: BEST FOOD EVAAARRR!! It was just amazing and my whole family just loved all the crispy chicken and slurpy noodles and steamy stuffed buns! Just delicious, and we can't wait to go back!!!
author: Amanda Q.

description: In the ever quest for good ramen, Marufuku is the standard to beat. The bar is set high here. Worth the wait, a must stop for ramen if you're ever in Japantown.
author: Dan C.

description:
It's all in the broth and the egg!

Sure I'm missing the noodle and the meat, but what I find sets Marufuku apart from other Ramen restaurants are the aforementioned things. The soup is rich but not so creamy that you tire of the flavor before you get to the bottom of your bowl. And about that egg - there's a milky consistency to the yolk from being partially cooked, and the way it softly spills into the soup is just lovely.

The wait is long and not for the timid and weak! Put your name down on the wait list and expect to twiddle your thumbs for a while.
author: Cici T.

description:
Over-rated would best describe this place. 

Waited in line for over 30 minutes and was treated to mediocrity. 

The soup base was nothing special. The ramen noodles was average.
author: Ken T.

description: Best Ramen place in Japantown. The bowl looks small but it's really filling. The broth is really good. I feel like it was almost the perfect ramen. Decent price too. The ramen I had was the pork belly for 10.99. I think it's best to go on dates here. Then best part will be Good Belly crepes!!! :) I went here for lunch. It's gets pretty busy. I prefer to try to come 30 mins early of course.
author: Julia D.

description:
During college I couldn't imagine standing in line for and paying more than a few bucks for ramen.  I mean, top ramen with an egg dropped into it on the stovetop, or drained of the liquid and topped with oyster sauce; that was the cheap and satisfying meal of my late teens to early early 20s!  

I've had Marufuku Ramen on my list since they opened and finally got to try them out last month.  Little did we know that the Fillmore Street Festival was going on, but after a few times of circling around we found a parking spot about two blocks up.  We entered the Plaza and saw the long line already, despite them opening up just about 7-10 minutes prior.  We put our name on the list and after about 5 minutes was able to ask someone how long the wait was, she told us maybe about 20 minutes or so.  We weren't hungry yet and nothing else tickled our fancy, so we waited.  We were seated about 30 minutes afterwards.  The space is fairly small, with mainly seating for two, and I only saw like two four seaters.  

I already knew I was going to get the Paitan DX ramen ($14.99) if it was still available (menu states limited to 15 servings) and he got the Hakata Tonkatsu ($10.99).  I clearly specified no bean sprouts since they are raw and pregnant ladies are advised not to eat raw sprouts.  I totally think that the 15 maximum of the Hakata DX made during a lunch or dinner seating is a bunch of bologna, because I saw a lot of tables with it and again, I wasn't seated until about 40 minutes after opening.  So there was no way that 15 people didn't order it by the time I got seated in this small ish restaurant (by the time all were seated we were like 10 or 11 down the list).

The chicken leg on the sizzling platter was served within a few minutes of ordering.  And of course came on a bed of bean sprouts.  I can understand this though, since they premake the chicken to serve it out to the masses.  It smelled wonderful and I couldn't wait to indulge in it.  About 7 minutes later or so, our bowls of ramen came out.  Mine was filled with braised pork belly, a soft boiled egg (which I gave hubs), ginger slivers, kikurage mushrooms, green onions, corn, chicken cha su.  His was filled with green onions, a soft boiled egg, kikurage mushrooms, green onions and simmered pork belly.  Hakata style is rich and creamy broth and served with thinner noodles.  So people should definitely take that into consideration before dining here since I don't think that's fair that some slam Marufuku because of that.  

Let's start with the chicken leg.  It was a huge hunk of moist seasoned meat.  Some of the flavors from the bean sprouts does infuse into the meat, so be forewarned.  Now on to my ramen, so I'm loving the rich paitan broth, the noodles and the doneness of the mushrooms.  The pork belly was super tender and flavorful too.  But then I'm getting more into my bowl and I see a crap load of bean sprouts despite the waitress repeating back our order to us, and stating no bean sprouts back to me.  This was very disappointing, again, because these are uncooked bean sprouts, and it's not like the broth is hot enough like shabu broth to cook the sprouts.  Not sure if she didn't write it down or the cooks just didn't pay attention or didn't care.  But I know that they wouldn't pre-make the bowls of ramen like they did for the chicken.  Since the noodles are thin too, the bean sprouts easily got intertwined with noodles, which made it difficult to take out all of the bean sprouts and put them aside.  I tried his broth as well, which was different (aside from being pork based) than other tonkatsu broths we've had; while not bad, it wasn't as strong as mine, and I preferred mine, which I think he did as well.  The eggs which he enjoyed were oozing out the runny yolk when eaten, even though he ate it towards the end.  The ramen wasn't a total salt bomb either.  So all in all, I think it may just be the best ramen in the city, so I can see why people would wait for it.  They know how to do ramen right and are prepped to make as quick of a turn around as needed.  

So pluses - The ramen!  They give you a lot of items in your bowl too for the money.  $15 for the huge chicken leg side and a full bowl of ramen (with braised pork belly) is a good deal.  Nice decor, and it's clean.  You can choose your spicy level and at no extra charge.  

Minuses - I guess they don't listen when you ask for what seems to be a simple modification, especially when you say you can't eat something.  What if I had been deathly allergic?  Also,  the wait!  I would definitely come back but not wait more than about 30 minutes to dine here.  I mean, Japantown has a ton of great other places too, so why would you want to wait an hour plus for a bowl of ramen?
author: Cat C.

description:
Move over Mensho, Move Over Nojo, Move Over (whatever Ramen Place you think is the best in SF), Marufuku is one of the best new ramen spots in sf and is giving a big Mara Fuk UUUUU to other Ramen competitors with their bold flavors and amazing portions. 

Hate me for saying this, but their brother and pork/chicken portein is one of the best I have had! My friend and I shared the Hakata Tonkotsu and the Chicken Paitan Dx. Their broth is thick, but not too creamy and it is very very flavorful! You can really taste the sultriness of the broth! And their ramen is packed with toppings that you would usually get as extras at another ramen place. I highly suggest coming early so you can try the Dx version (they only have 15 for every dinner service) because they give you a whole chicken piece in addition to the protein you already have in your ramen. And don't even get me started about their egg! The egg is also perfectly cooked. The only thing that i was indifferent towards was their noodles. The noodles are good, but wish they were thicker and had more substance to it. 

Like many hot restaurants in SF especially restaurants in Japantown, there is always a line here, but it is definitely worth it. The servers are also really down to earth and don't rush you like other places. Hands down, this is top 3 of ramen joints in SF and wouldn't be surprised if they raise their prices because the portions are so big for the price you pay! So I suggest you hurry and try this while it is decently priced!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description:
My new favorite ramen shop. They let you put your name down on an ipad and text/call when your table is ready. This helps increase business in the surrounding areas. 

Ramen is delicious, thin noodles and comes out within 5-10 minutes, and they're kid friendly.
author: Y L.

description:
When you first come to this restaurant, be aware that it's located inside this Japanese shopping center aka the mall. It's in the second floor in the same area as Konikuya bookstore (sorry I can't spell at the moment). If you have to eat here, you'll need to learn how to endure a heavy long wait. First come, first serve. It took about 1-2 hours to finally get seated especially on a weekend and due to its rising popularity. If you get early enough, maybe the wait can be shorter. So what happens is you sign your name on the name list for the worker to call out your name and your number of party. If you miss out, the worker will put an astrik star next to your name on the list and be sure to see them if you see that star, so you can still get your spot and they will still take you in. If you don't like waiting hours straight for a spot, you can feel free to shop around nearby to kill time before it's your turn to get an eating spot at the restaurant. Luckily, they have a menu outside on the clear door for customers to look at while waiting or deciding to eat there. It already helped me decide what to order in an instant. Finally, they seated me in. Inside was quite beautiful. Like an modern Japanese style. It's so cute! I'm screaming with joy and happy hunger! :D 

For the food I ordered, I ordered the Hakata DX Ramen. You have the choice for any of the ramens about how spicy you want for your ramen. No mild, mild, med spicy, really spicy, etc. I went with mild. I also ordered the Calpico as my drink. It was quite tasty. It didn't take them too long to get the ramen out. Which is good, because boy, am I sooo hungry! It was beautifully presented with a seaweed sticking out of the ramen. One bite and you will be sent to ramen heaven. This was pure bliss. The braised pork belly was super delicious that I couldn't stop nibbling on it. Soft, full of flavor, and done nicely. It was the star of the dish. Besides that, everything else seem to go along very well. The broth was really good as well. It even got me sipping on it haha. Omg. It was one of the best ramens I tasted in SF. It was totally worth the long wait!!!
author: Lynh N.

description:
First time trying marufuku--was visiting SF and found this place bc of the good yelp reviews! 

The wait was long on a Sunday afternoon during lunch and when we were finally seated after like 4( mins, we found out that they did not have any vegetarian options :( boo! 

My friend ended up just ordering edamame and I ordered the tonkotsu and the karage chicken. Both were very yummy but honestly was not worth the wait.

Probably won't be back again but 'twas a good experience. 

P.S. only street parking obvi
author: Tammy F.

description:
mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm ramen.

Seriously, damn good ramen.
author: Jeff M.

description:
I'm not a huge fan of Asian food I prefer Mexican but I thought I would give this a try since I had a friend visiting from out of state. Had a little trouble finding it before realizing it's in the Japan Center. The line was ridiculously long for good reason. We were able to check in through an iPad that would alert us when we were next so we shopped and got drinks in the mean time. I ordered the Ramen and it was soooo delicious and full of different flavors and textures. I will definitely be coming back here


** I had hakata deluxe medium spicy I would highly recommend**
author: S J.

description: Came here while I was in J town shopping for groceries and I was so happy to find this place! I was 10 minutes late after it opened and there was already a line and waited for about 20 ish minutes. Their Tonkotsu ramen broth was very flavorful and savory and not overly greasy/too much fat which is a big plus to me as I find some good Tonkotsu broth was too fatty. Portion size was very good with plenty of noodles and broth with a whole soft egg. Noodles are thin and without too much chewy texture which I enjoy. I also ordered the octopus ball (takoyaki) which was good. Gem in J town for a bowl of delicious ramen. Will definitely come back!
author: Lena H.

description: I was introduced to this place from a friend. The service was quick and friendly. The portion size were big and worth the money. Great place for small parties. The prices for the dishes were very reasonable. The location is great because it's inside a center and there's parking! Yay for people who drive into the city!
author: Pa H.

description: Best Ramen in SF! Everytime I come here I get the same exact thing! THE DELUXE TONKATSU RAMEN! Oh, the fried chicken appetizer is delicious as well!
author: Manuel V.

description:
There's been a lot of hype for Marufuku so I finally took the chance to come here and I would definitely say that most of the hype is accurate.

First of all, I'm warning you that the wait is LONG. This place opens at 5:30 and I started lining up at 5pm. We were one of the first people in line but by the time we got to opening, the line was at least 50 people (probably more). At least service moves fast but be prepared to wait 30min-1hour.

I got the Tonkotsu DX which is just the regular Tonkotsu with the addition of corn, seaweed and braised pork belly. I have to say, this is now one of my favorite ramen joints in SF. The soup was well seasoned without being too salty (which is probably my #1 problem with a lot of ramen places) and the portion size was much more balanced.A lot of places will give you what looks like a large portion except its 90% noodles. Marufuku's noodles to everything else ratio was much more balanced.

Overall, I'd say this place is definitely worth a visit. Especially if you're not in a huge rush!
author: Cassie Z.

description:
I'm obsessed with their tonkotsu ramen. Most flavorful and delicious broth I've ever had. The meat is DELICIOUS and every part of the dish comes together for perfection.

Very well-priced for a large amount of food.

Well worth the inevitable long wait on weekends!
author: Alexis R.

description: Very good and authentic Ramen. Plate was a bit small and the noodles a bit thin, it was flavorful and satisfying. I ate the Tonkotsu Deluxe XT with extra Chashu and medium spice. This is now my 3rd favorite Ramen house in San Francisco for sure.
author: Hiram M.

description:
This place really is great, but I wouldn't come back because I don't think is worth the 1.5 hour wait.

When I came here, I knew there would be a line so we put our name down and then walked around the area. The wait-list is really convenient they they will call/text you so you don't have to wait mindlessly in front of the restaurant.

The ramen itself was so flavorful, well-balanced and rich. We also got a Kakuni Bowl that helped fill us up. If the line happens to be short, we would come back. But since it's so good, we don't anticipate that happening.
author: Sally P.

description:
As per usual, the lines are long. I think that is the WORST thing about this place.  

Onto the positives:
The meat in this ramen (Chasu and Pork Belly) is absolutely INCREDIBLE. I have never tasted anything better in ramen and I am just floored by how delicious it was. The broth is rich with lots of flavor, the noodles aren't my favorite (they're on the thinner side) but that's a preference. The noodles are still good so I'm not knocking it down for that. The service is really quick, you'll get your food within 10 minutes of ordering which is incredible.

Honestly, for broth and the meat, this is probably my favorite ramen spot in the city now.
author: Adrianna L.

description: Got here 10 minutes before opening time on a Friday night and there was already a long line outside the door. Marafuku seems to be the current #1 place for ramen, so I had to try this place out. I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen and was not dissapointed. The noodles were hand-made and super thin, the brothwas flavorful, and the egg on the bottom was boiled to perfection. The only thing was that the pork belly in my bowl was a bit chewy, but I may have just gotten an unlucky piece. The only thing I regret is not trying out the Chicken DX bowl instead as I saw customers next to me get a gigantic whole chicken leg with their ramen and devoured it with joy. Next time, I'll definitely try out the Chicken DX ramen!
author: Victoria T.

description:
Yelp reviews don't lie--the ramen here is bomb and I love that pork broth so much I'd come back again and again just to have it. 

I've had this place bookmarked for weeks and finally was able to get here on a weekday before they open to avoid the lines. Upon opening, we were seated pretty quickly and they were very accommodating of us having a toddler. We were given a huge booth with a high chair and plenty of time to look through the menu.

Service was on point. They were very helpful in answering our questions about the menu which was small but had good variety of appetizers, rice dishes and ramen. I ordered the standard pork broth ramen super spicy. My husband ordered the chicken ramen but got the DX which comes with all the toppings AND a side of chicken leg. There are only 15 orders of this per day so get here when they open if that's what you want to eat! My pork ramen broth was seriously spicy and did not disappoint. I was sniffling and sweating but could not stop eating because it was so good. Noodles were thinner than your standard ramen noodle but perfectly al dente and delicious. My husband's chicken ramen was good but flavor was not as rich compared to the pork. He got a huge side of chicken leg (thigh and drumstick) which came on a sizzling pan on top of bean sprouts. My one critique is that the meat, both pork chasu and chicken leg, were too sweet. There was way too much sugar used in the marinade so the flavor wasn't quite balanced with everything else. 

Overall, food was amazingly delicious and I would come back again.
author: Betty R.

description:
This is such a cute and cozy ramen shop! Interior was really nice and comfortable. But now on to what really matters. The ramen!

I don't remember which bowl I got, but regardless, it was so tasty! The broth was well balanced and went well with the chewiness of the noodles. The perfect slurp. That aside I was not a huge fan or the toppings. I ordered braised pork as an extra topping, expecting it to be crispy like at other joints, but it wasn't very crispy since it was sitting in my ramen (I'm used to it being skewered on the side). Still really delicious :) 

Oh I forgot! They have spice levels- I got ultra spicy but I couldn't feel the burn which was disappointing. However, I'm sure it is spicy to those who don't eat spicy often
author: July K.

description:
Delicious food, great service . Definitely worth the wait. 

Plus, I truly believe that any place that serves good water deserves 5 stars.
author: Elizabeth P.

description:
Alright, before anything, I'll have to say that their reservation/wait-list system is really THE BEST experience I've ever encountered in terms of how efficient and effective it is. Maybe you've encountered better experience or maybe it's because I've been waiting in line my whole life for anything nowadays...Regardless, it was a positive experience.

Even BEFORE you get to the restaurant, you can wait-list yourself on Yelp and know how many parties are ahead of you. When it's closer to your turn, they'll give you a call to let you know your table is ready; that way, you can just come in and not waste the whole day waiting. 

Now....to the food part. I think their thin noodles really reminds me of Ippudo and I loved it. Nevertheless, I think their broth was way too salty for my taste! Darn! When I first took a sip of the broth and noodles, it was soooo amazing only to find myself already drinking a whole cup of water after a few bites. Not only that, it gets really intense as you keep on eating and I never can really finish my bowl because it was just too salty. I ordered the Hakata Tonkatsu both times I was here. The one piece Tonkatsu they give is quite small and the egg that was in it became overcooked since it was buried all the way on the bottom so technically you're just eating a hard boiled egg. I'm not sure if that was the purpose or if they are trying to go for the runny egg experience because the yolks were not that runny. I also got a Chashu Bowl, which in my opinion is OKAY. Nothing significant about the bowl except again, way too salty. 

Overall, I think maybe I have a much blander palate than most people, but I didn't think the ramen was too spectacular.
author: Anna L.

description:
Came here again recently for dinner during the work week because I was craving ramen.  Arrived around 5:30 and was able to be seated immediately.  This time I tried the chicken paitan (chicken leg on the side) with medium spicy broth.

The broth was not very spicy (and in my last experience the spicy level was too spicy).  The chicken leg didn't have much flavor and was dry.  
Overall this experience was better than most ramen spots in SF but 3 stars overall.  The plus is the noodles which I still loved and their lightning fast service.  I was seated and got my food within 5-10 minutes.  They have nailed down their ability to turn tables over quickly.

Next time I'll stick to ramen with some pork belly in it!
author: Siv L.

description:
WHAT WAS ORDERED: Hakata DX | $15.99

WAIT TIME: 1.5 hours

SERVICE: great service! Nice, friendly, busy people.

CLEANLINESS: tables were cleaned quickly, as the wait was super long.

TASTE: Best Ramen I've Ever Had!!! The broth was thick and creamy and had a soft bowl egg that was cooked perfectly. The pork was nice and sweet, to cut the saltiness of the broth. The noodle were not your "usual" ramen noodles, they were thin and delicious. 
 
WORTH THE PRICE?: absolutely! Everything was delicious! 

RECOMMENDATIONS: get the hakata DX if you're hungry and if you don't eat pork get the chicken option.

WILL I COME BACK?: heck yes! My husband and I dream of this ramen.

TIPS AND NOTES: be ready to wait. The restaurant is extremely small. But on the bright side your food is served fast, I truly think it's because the menu is small and to the point.
author: Zuri C.

description:
Came here about 20 minutes before it opened for dinner on a weekday and there were about 20 people in line already. Once the restaurant opened, we had to wait about 10-15 minutes before we got a table which wasn't bad. 

We started off with chicken karage. It was very juicy and tender, just like what chicken karage should be. 

I ordered the Chicken Paitan DX ramen. The grilled chicken and broth was good. But the chicken chashu was very dry. Also, I didn't like how the noddles were thin. My boyfriend got the Hakata Tonkotsu. He enjoyed it, no complaints on his end. 

If I'm ever craving ramen in japantown, I'll probably go to Ramen Yamadaya instead because they have more options, they taste just as good as the ones here, and they have thicker noodles.
author: Michelle T.

description:
Overview: Marufuku Ramen is a small-medium ramen-focused restaurant in the 2nd story of the Japantown mall that serves excellent ramen in a classy environment for affordable prices with no options for reservations and typical waits of 30-90 minutes.

The Food: Perfectly cooked egg with semi-solid interior, great portions of chicken or pork (I would recommend the deluxe pork as the chicken is kind of simple), extraordinary perfect chew on the ramen noodles, and a broth that is full of umami flavor without being too salty. $2.50 extra for an extra helping of noodles on the side which I recommend. As of Aug, 2017, standard bowls are $12 and upgraded bowls are $16 (gives a bit of extra meat and toppings). 

The Establishment: Very clean, well decorated, climate controlled, and spacious. Can accommodate large parties but is very suitable for couples.

The Service: We had poor service just one time because I think two waiters weren't sure who was responsible for our table. It was perfectly fine as our food was brought out very quickly. In addition, they were very kind in accommodating our 1 year old and even brought her a plastic bowl, a cup of water, and a spoon. On subsequent returns, service has been excellent, very respectful and courteous.

Conclusions: At this point in time, Marufuku Ramen is the best value ramen restaurant in the city and if it wasn't for the painful wait, I would come to this place weekly.
author: Andrew H.

description: My current favorite place for Ramen in SF. You can taste the bone in a good way in the broth. You can tell they took their time to cook their ramens here.
author: Dao C.

description:
I give this place a 4.5.

At first when we arrived, we were shown to a tablet, where we signed up on the waiting list. We were the 51st party. "oh no! this is going to take forever" we thought. inside, it looked pretty small, but gave a nice vibe.we walked around looking at the other choices but then decided that we would wait, walking around the center. When it was our turn, a friendly waitress showed us to our table. Our party was of 8 people, so we sat at the booth. The menu was pretty limited, but everything ything looked good. We ordered, everyone with different specifications, but the waitress patiently kept up and the  food arrived rather quickly.

Even though we had recently eaten, all my friends and I DEVOURED the ramen. It was a nice portion, not too big or small. It was a great experience and I would totally return another day.
author: Livia R.

description: Ramen is ok. I like Mensho Tokyo a lot more for their broth and atmosphere. Think Marufuku is a bit hyped :))
author: Jie X.

description:
Pretty good place.
Like that you don't have to physically stay in line (you can stay in line through the yelp app).
Ambiance was good. Service was quick. Food was also good.

The broth was really good.

[I got the Tonkotsu for ~$12-13.]

Also, a warning: their bill generation software had a bug when I was there. If you split the bill, the tip amount is not based on the new split amount but rather the original sum. Ended up losing $2 because I was too lazy to do the math. So a 2 start for ripping people off, even though I have no evidence to say this was deliberate.
author: Subrat M.

description:
Great stuff. Beautiful ramen soup and chicken.

Opt for yelp nowait to avoid standing in queue. Also don't forget to order that delicious calpico drink to quench your thirst
author: Asmita V.

description:
Arrived early enough to stand in line for forty minutes prior to opening. 4th in line...I'm usually not willing to wait in a line that meanders across the mall so we usually pass this one up. Menu states that only 15 chicken Paiton DX will be served per day. Im pretty sure they served a lot more than that while we were there. Really wanted to try this paiton DX but was disappointed.
Firstly, great service and atmosphere in an attractive ramen shop. Food arrived very quickly and was piping hot. Awesome so far!
Tore into that beautiful roasted chicken and bam. There was a very familiar funky flavor that takes me back to those Chinese bbq flavors from the typical buffet bar. Wow, so disappointed. Nicely roasted chicken yet? A simple salt and pepper roasted chicken would have been much tastier. Moving on to the Chicken paiton ramen. Never had it before and it was definitely different. Very beautiful bowl of ramen for sure. Well done. My only gripes were at medium spice, it was hot. Not hot enough to make the top of my head sweat but hot enough to make me have to suck down water several times to put out the heat. Again the service just kept filling that water glass. Awesome! The sliced chicken was not very good either. Cool and dry when it arrived so I buried it into the hot broth for help. Noodles were delicious and plentiful.
To conclude, I cannot recommend this ramen if one has to stand in a line that reaches the other side of the mall. It is good enough to try if you can get in in a reasonable time frame or just aren't really hungry when you line up. There are other fine ramen shops nearby that serve up quality bowls without all the hoopla.
author: Bob B.

description: This was a fun experience. The wait is craaaaazy long, and we almost lost our table cuz they give you a 5 minute window to get back to the restaurant. Once we got seated the vibe was pretty dope, we ordered quickly and got different spicy levels on the Hakata DX. The bowls the ramen was served in were really stylin - totally goes with the vibe of the spot. The broth was dank (good dank) - full of flavor and delicious aromas and the meat and egg were cooked perfectly. Unfortunately the four stars is because the bowls were too narrow to see all the ingredients. I couldn't find my egg until half way through the bowl and it was slightly more cooked than I would have hoped. Could be my bad - but between the wait, feeling rushed through the experience, and the awkward bowl shapes that's where I'm at. Worth a try if you have helllllllllla time to burn in Japan Center.
author: Ibs A.

description: The Ramen is pretty close to what you get in Japan.   I've been in Japan Center a 1/2 a dozen times now & I'm coming back to this & one other place. The rest, no thinks.
author: Leung T.

description:
If I have ever been close to dying of hunger this may have been the time I came the closest to it - not saying I'm dying of hunger (I still have a generous amount of plump leftover from yoona cerca 2005 (does anyone remember chubbies, I loved chubbies)) (i fully close all braces, rule I learned in CS, thank u prof marathon maxwell) but DAMN I was hungry.

Broth - tastes like a healthy heart attack (mad rich and creamy but no tasty video style milk cream or cheese or some shit lik that) 

noodles - if my mother had attempted to make Italian food she would make these exact noodles (almost like angel hair made out of rice flour, straight and thin as F), so whERE are THE thic ass noodle kinks????


Out
author: Yoona C.

description: Best ramen I've had outside Japan with good and fast service. Recommend getting there 30 mins prior to opening and waiting in line as the wait can be much longer if you show up later.
author: K W.

description: I ate Hakata Tonkotsu Ramen today. When you order a ramen there, you can choose a degree of a hot flavor. I'm not good at very spicy flavor, so I chose mild. It was not hot and fine. Ramen was yummy, and it has one soft-boiled egg. It was also fine. About the restaurant, staffs are friendly, and their recommendation is nice. Restaurant is clean and neat. When you go there at lunch time, you should go there about at 11:30 because they have many customers around noon.
author: Yumiko H.

description: The BEST ramen I have ever had. My family and I went for dinner. They're super busy so I recommend getting there at least 30 to 45 minutes before they open to get a table. Definitely worth the wait (if you have to wait for a table).
author: Charlotte B.

description:
I waited in line for a whole hour to eat here - and it I have to say, it was worth it. The broth was absolute perfection - as were the four pieces of perfectly braised pork belly (generous portions). My complaint (if any) is that I would've liked a higher ramen to broth ratio but that's a personal preference. 
The feedback that I do have though is that they should improve their system of seating/taking names for reservations. This current system is inefficient and results in inflated wait-times.
author: Sam M.

description:
It was the first time my wife and I ate there. We were attracted by the long line (40 people) before it opened for dinner, and we thought it must be good.   We ordered the Tonkotsu and Paitan ramen.   After the first bite, taste the soup again, I asked my wife what she thinks.  She said only okay.   Then I told her my review, and I said I don't understand why there's such a long line.   It is not bad, well very salty though, everything including the appetizers, but the taste just does not justified the long line.   

BOTTOM LINE: only try it IF THERE IS NO LINE!
author: Matthew H.

description: The food was a big difference from oakland. This place is a lot saltier and wait was crazy long. Never waited for noodle for such a looooong period of time just to be disappointed. The oakland location is much better and friendlier
author: Nikki H.

description:
Got here 10 mins after they opened for dinner on a Tuesday and were seated immediately.

Hakata DX: The pork belly was packed with an explosion of marinated flavors. The noodles had the perfect amount of bite. Not too chewy and not too soft. Just right. The noodles reminded me of the egg noodles in Wonton Soup. The rich, creamy both married all the ingredients in the bowl together in complete harmony. The broth also helped cut the intense flavor of the pork belly. This was a delicious bowl of ramen. 

Takoyaki: I felt that there could have been more octopus pieces in this delectable appetizer. I prefer the outer layer to be a bit more crispy. Still a tasty treat.

Service: Good friendly service. Food arrived in a timely manner, although the grilled chicken which comes with the Chicken Paitan DX came before the appetizers and the ramen.
author: D V.

description: Takes a while to get seated, but there is a reason for that.This place is great for a big bowl of noodles.They have excellent service . I had the red bowl with double everything.Nice atmosphere nice people and killer food.
author: Tim B.

description:
While this place isn't a 5 Stars in taste to my own taste buds, I can definitely say that this place is 5 Stars in taste. It's just not my taste, but that doesn't mean this place deserves less than 5 Stars. Their ramen definitely was hakata ramen and was very good.

I got the hakata dx spicy. The broth at first sip was full of flavor and very good. The braised pork was excellent and cooked exceptionally well. The soft boiled egg? Perfectly cooked soft boiled. However, my egg was hidden in the soup. I kid you not, I didn't get to the egg until I was about 2/3 done with the bowl. The noodles? A little bit too thin for me and had a subtle rice flavored taste to it. Service? No complaints here.

In short:

Broth: 4.5/5
Braised Pork: 4.25/5
Ramen noodles: 4/5
Service: 5/5
author: Alvin D.

description: I ate here over the weekend and wow. The place opens at 11:30 and we got there at 11 which was good because by 11:30 there was a line all the way to the other side of the building. We were the third party in line, seated promptly and immediately served water and asked if we knew what we wanted to order. Being our first time here, we didn't know what we wanted to order. However, by the time they say the party next to us, we ordered. We both got the Hakata Tonkatsu, my boyfriend got the spicy and I got the medium with added corn. We also got the Chicken Karaage appetizer. By the time we ordered, they had seated every table in the restaurant in less than 10 minutes. The chicken karaage came out in minutes... the service is super fast. It was good but the pieces were really big. I rather have more little pieces than less big pieces. Also there was barely any mayo for dressing. The ramen came out a few minutes later and it was very delicious. The broth was very flavorful but not very spicy so I added a little more chili powder. The powder didn't change the flavor of the broth, but added a back of your throat spicy kick. The noodles are skinny noodles, which I don't really like.. I prefer fat noodles but it was still delicious. They give you a whole egg, though I wish my egg could have been more soft boiled and runny. But the meat- oh my god- the simmered pork belly was delicious!!! The meat was super soft and and tore apart easily. It literally melted in my mouth and was super delicious. Would come back just for the pork belly. They placed our check on our table before we were done. They were really cranking people out of there! Otherwise, super delicious and fast service!
author: Kathy H.

description:
I am obsessed with this place and their chicken Paitan. Also the staff are amazing. The first Time I went there, I was with an elder Black woman with a walker. I let them know that I wasn't sure if she would be able to stand for very long, as the wait at that point was 30 minutes. They found her a chair she could sit in while we waited, and then worked some magic so that our wait only ended up being about five minutes, before they were able to put us at a table with enough space around it to accommodate her walker staying with her. I will always have a warm place in my heart for the staff for treating us with the respect that I would wish every restaurant would have for an elder, especially a disabled elder. 

Beyond that, the food is just incredible. The menu is simple and I have been ecstatic about my meal every time. I have dined in 3 times and ordered takeout twice. 

The only changes I would like to see are that they include a vegetarian option so I could bring my veg friends, and that they would use gluten-free tamari instead of traditional soy sauce. My partner and I are both GF and so we replace the noodles with rice and seem to do ok with the regular soy sauce but I know this is not necessarily true for people who are more sensitive than we are.

Still, if I could give this place more than five stars, I would.
author: Amanda C.

description: The best ramen I've ever had. I grew up in the San Gabriel Valley in SoCal (aka asian food central) so I didn't have very high expectations for this place, but wow. I had the Hakata Deluxe (~$17) and it's a little pricey but everything is great quality and totally worth the extra cash. We came at peak lunch rush and ended up waiting 90 min but it's so worth the wait!
author: Sarah C.

description: The most positive comment I can make is that he ambiance was nice. It is at an ideal location right in Jtown. However, to my disappointment, the food was just ok, the servicing sizes are small, and the customer service is subpar.
author: Tammie C.

description:
I loooovvvee this ramen spot, been here five times already and unfortunately the only reason why I'm giving them 4 stars is because of the treatment we received while eating as paying customers.

We wanted to order sake bombs and our waitress told us we could not. So we ordered our food, which was amazing. We then see the table behind us order sake bombs so we decide to order it from a different waitress. When we finally received our drinks, we prepped the sake bombs and the tall Hispanic lady told us we were not allowed to do sake bombs. I don't understand why and I told her that the table behind us did it so why couldn't we? The lady we originally ordered our sake bombs from told us it was okay while the Hispanic lady told us that the management does not allow it but no where on their menu does it says "no sake bombs". My group wasn't even loud but the other table who ordered sake bombs were.

I do love their ramen. But the fact that they told us we couldn't do sake bombs but we see the table behind us do it, that's just ridiculous.

Will be back for ramen though.
author: Lisa K.

description:
Figured everyone will be flooding to Ipuddo, the wait would be less in Marufuku and I was right! Got to the resto 10 mins. before and got seated 5 mins. after it opened! 

Ordered the chicken karaage, Hakata DX medium spice and the Chicken Paitan DX medium spice (1 of the limited 15 servings).  

The goods: lovely creamy sweet milky savory broth.  Perfect soft boiled egg with jellied yolk that's not oftenly found in a lot of ramen shops.  Loved the ingredients (came with corns, nori, red ginger, kikurage mushrooms, bean sprouts and green onions).  Chicken was juicy and tender.

The bads: pork belly almost all fats and thin slices.  The marinate they used to braise the chicken and egg was a bit on the sweet side.  Medium spice tasted like mild.

Albeit a few imperfections, Marufuku ranks high on my list because what count is the broth and noodles and their tonkotsu broth is the best I've had.  Misoya still has the best char-siu.
author: Shirley H.

description: This place is legit. I'm a huge tonkotsu ramen fan. My favorite is Ippudo (the ones in Japan, haven't been to the shitshow downtown yet), and this place is great. Firm noodles, rich, deep broth.  Usually a long line, good to get on the waitlist via the app.
author: Kevin S.

description:
Best ramen in sf！The
 restaurant is on second floor inside the building. Takes me time to find it and finally realize it's upstairs. The ramen was soooooo gorgeous！But have been waiting for more than one hour on Saturday.
author: Zingyuk P.

description: We came to wait in line at 11:20am, when the restaurant opens at 11:30am. We had to wait about 20 minutes for a table because we were just shy of making the cut off for the first people to eat. Not bad because they take your cell phone number and text you when your table is ready. I recommend getting there at noon if you can't get in first thing. It's worth the wait. I like the chicken ramen with mild spice. I also loved the fried calamari. Yum! Great, fast service. Delicious food. You can't go wrong here. The food is lovely.
author: Doreen E.

description: I've been to Japan twice now.... And I have to say that was probably the best ramen I've had since. I got there 20 min before they opened and there was already a line of about 20 parties ahead of me. The doors opened and the people who weren't seated yet signed in on a tablet that connects with yelp so you know your place in the queue. It wasn't so bad since the restaurants in the mall so my husband and I window shopped for a while till we were called to come back. Service was fast. The food came out before we even got our waters. So good. I had the extra spicy tonkatsu. In my opinion not as spicy as I thought it would be but it had a slow burn. It's was delicious! Highly recommend going early... Before the restaurant opens!
author: Young-Ju O.

description: The tonkotsu ramen is delicious and makes a great brunch. The takoyaki have more octopus meat than other restaurants and the service is quick and friendly.
author: Tyler H.

description: amazing ramen!!! finished the whole bowl even tho i ate an appetizer first. had the pork belly deluxe, and the broth was rich and hot. would go again to try the chicken leg one!
author: Alex C.

description:
First off head to JapanTown - enter the Japan Center building and go up to the second floor. We waited about 40 minutes for lunch on Sunday after arriving at 12:30.

Sign-in upon arrival and then don't go far. They will call your name three times loudly and then move on to the next group.

Be prepared for a super flavorful broth, nontraditional noodles and a curated menu. I went with medium spicy and it was slightly but not too much nose runny and I drained the entire bowl. Service is fast and your water glasses stays full. Worth the trip and the other spots in the same building have cute paper and collectible items and dessert.
author: Elisabeth B.

description: First off, the wait list for the place is stupid.  Not because it's long, but because they message you saying your table is ready, you go up to the front and then they just tell you to wait again. If the list isn't going to be used properly, what's the point of it? However, the ramen is super good! The braised pork belly is amazing, and the broth on the tonkatsu ramen is super flavorful. If you get it in anything hotter than mild spice, the spice seems to hide the flavor a bit.
author: Mariah And Myles ..

description: So far the best ramen I've had in the Bay Area! The broth of the Hakata Tongkotsu Ramen has perfect consistency (not too thick/rich and not too thin) and the flavor is perfectly balanced. I also ordered the Buta Kakuni on the side, and it was also good, if I had more room in mu tummy, I would've ordered the Kakuni Rice Bowl!
author: Tini M.

description: I love this ramen place. I was super hungry and went there on a whim. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of their ramen. I would definitely go back again.
author: J S.

description:
This is easily the best ramen in SF. I had the Hakata Tonkatsu Ramen which I found very satisfying. The broth was very rich and umami and the simple ingredients very complementary to each other. I didn't feel like the deluxe version was necessary.

Be advised, that the lines for this ramen shop are -extraordinarily- long. I waited an hour before I got to eat :| Thankfully, they have a kiosk where you can add your name to the list and it's integrated with the yelp app so you can see how close you are. They don't have bar seating so you'll just have to wait... In the meanwhile, go for a browse at the Japanese shops.
author: Drew W.

description:
One of the most enjoyable ramen spots in the Bay I've had thus far. 

It's located inside Japan center and wasn't too difficult to find. I went for dinner on a Friday night so the wait was about an hour long, which we anticipated after reading how popular it has been. Its location is convenient because even though we had to wait around a while, it went by quickly because we were able to walk around the stores near the restaurant. 

Once we were seated the service was exceptionally fast. 

Both my friend and I ordered the mild Hakata Tonkotsu ramen. It was mouth-watering good. The noodles are thin and cooked just enough for an almost al dente style noodle. The noodles are a perfect match for the consistency of the broth. The broth is very flavorful and delicious. 

We also ordered chicken kaarage and it was probably one of the best I've had. 

Just writing this review makes me want to go back again.
author: Melissa C.

description:
*** In Short ***

Yet another welcome addition to SF's burgeoning collection of ramen shops.

*** In Depth ***

My favorite thing about staying in the city during long weekends? With everyone out traveling about, the waits at popular brunch/lunch spots halves, if not more! So, cue the recent Memorial Day weekend: showed up with a friend around 1pm and waited 15-20 minutes. Amazing.

As for the food itself? Like many other ramen joints, they offer an assortment of appetizers and rice bowls, as well as the obvious ramen itself, for which they offer both tonkotsu and toripaitan, in regular and DX (deluxe?) versions, that have more meaty options. The noodles themselves are hakata style thin noodles, so eater beware if that's not your jam.

Their tonkotsu broth is fantastic and definitely worth getting, while their toripaitan is much richer and more flavorful than Nojo's and Hinodeya's, but not as much as Mensho's (which is still my personal favorite in this category), so take that as you will when ordering. The DX version of the toripaitan, limited to 15 servings a day, comes with a side of grilled chicken thigh: almost like a Japanese take on the five spice chicken pho ga that some Vietnamese places do.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - A decently sized venue with a variety of seating, including both accessible pull-out seating, and less accessible bench seating. If you need an accessible table, you may have to wait just a bit longer than you would otherwise have to if you didn't need one.

Bathroom - Didn't try them.
author: Johnny W.

description:
Expect to wait in line when you visit this place (but it does move fast!) There's a sign in sheet on the door, and it is easy enough to browse the mall for a bit.  

This place is tiny but has such a nice Japanese atmosphere. The tables in the middle are so cute! 

I had the hakata tonkatsu medium spicy (which was a nice, true medium spice). I like the customizability but I've seen more offered at other places in terms of salt and noodle texture.  

The broth here was sheer perfection! Super rich and umami. There were so many levels to the flavor. Usually ramen leaves me with this over salted feeling, but the salt level was perfect! There was also a perfect (but hidden, I had to dig for it) egg with that see through yolk (how do they get it like that??). All in all, great ramen at a decent price.
author: Ria D.

description:
Visiting Ramen shops in SF has become a recent hobby. This Ramen restaurant did not disappoint , located in the middle of Japan Town.... The quality was exceptional! The broth is the best I've had in SF to date and I've been here for 2.5 years.

Only downside is the wait. We ended up waiting 1.5 hours to be seated after putting our name on the wait list. 51 parties were ahead of us at the time. However, they do make waiting manageable. Once you put your name on the list, you can be notify via text of your status in the queue.
author: Sheralyn F.

description: Great experience! Lucky that we only wait for 20 mins to get seated. We ordered the noodles and the small rice bowels and both of them taste amazing! Unfortunately that their chicken leg sold out and we could not try it. I hate craving for water after eating and marifuku did a amazing job that the food is very rich and flavor but no MSG!!!! No wonder it gets 4.5 starts on Yelp! Worthy to try if no need to wait in line for too long
author: Xbo Z.

description:
All the 5-star reviews don't lie!  I came here around 12 on a Saturday and there was a wait - to be expected for any good restaurants nowadays.  The good news is that the wait actually isn't that long.  The lines moves because the food comes out fast and waitresses are very efficient in clearing out tables.  There are benches right outside the restaurant and plus, a Japanese bookstore nearby to kill time while you wait.  We waited for about 20-25 minutes for a table of 3, smack in the middle of weekend lunch rush. Not bad! 

We both ordered the Hakata and the Hakata DX version (more expensive) to understand what's the difference.  The 2 bowls are almost identical except that the DX has 2-3 chunks of braised pork belly, in addition to the sliced pork belly.  The braised pork belly chunks are super tender!  They literally melt in your mouth.  I would highly recommend it.  Their soup broth is serious business!!!  It's one of the best I've tasted -even better than Dojo Ramen in San Mateo, in my opinion.  The soft egg was done to perfection.  Their noodles are the thin, not the springy kind you normally see.  I prefer the springy kind personally but the thin noodles tasted great nonetheless.  

Before we ordered, we saw other tables with their bowls coming out - and the bowls look small. So we ordered the Chicken karage as appetizer.  The Chicken karage was served with a spicy mayo dip and was also done very well.  We let the small bowls fooled us in terms of size.  The bowls may look small but they really give you a lot of noodles and ingredients and the bowl filled me up! The soup was so yummy that I drank almost all of it (which is very rare for me).  

Overall, fantastic ramen place. I love it!  Just need to make it out to J-town more often!
author: Jannie Q.

description: Loved loved loved it! Whoever came up with the check in system through yelp is a genius!! Checked in through yelp around and it tells you how many parties are in front of you and what time you should arrive by! You can also keep checking yourself! We got a phone call telling us to head over.. it is in a mall so not a free standing building. Kind of small but they were busy!! They were on top of it though .. we got seated right away ordered and got our food immediately... The chicken ramen was sooo delicious! Came down from Las Vegas and read reviews, didn't disappoint!
author: Lizeth V.

description: Oh HELL NO!! A line that long for ok Noodles is crazy! NO restaurant is worth waiting! That is really,  really nuts where the line is that long! There are many, many other places that are better than this place!
author: Rod W.

description: Good ramen, nice ambience. Got to check in the line on yelp. Queue tends to be long. Overall very nice place. Would recommend
author: Cameron R.

description:
Very good quality. The chicken noddle is delicious. And the popcorn checked is very tasty. The squirrel is ok. Not recommend. 

Will definitely come back!!!!!!
author: Minnie W.

description: Very quality, interesting ramen with a great vibe. The pork and 5 minute egg were some of the best I've had in my long career of ramen eating. Portions were solid, but its a tad expensive. Recommend getting reservation through Yelp and getting to Japantown to wander around when there's about 10 tables left to be seated
author: Austin R.

description:
Had an awesome experience here with some friends! 

Food was 4/5. Docking one star for the very limited menu but I will give it that they've completely mastered the ramen that they do serve. My party got the "Hakata DX". The broth came out steaming and was incredibly flavorful. The egg had the most amazing flavor to it and as someone who's not a big fan of pork, I can say that the meat tasted absolutely delicious. 

We also got the squid legs and for the price and the amount given it's definitely an amazing and worthwhile value! 

Service was 5/5. They promptly took our order and had our food out really quickly. We constantly had servers checking on us and asking if we needed water, but not so much so that it felt like they were there too often. 

Ambience 5/5. Very quaint little shop, somewhat minimalist but I definitely appreciated the atmosphere that was created in such a small space. 

I can definitely see why people might have issues with the wait as the place is bigger than it looks but still small. We were lucky to have already been at Japantown before opening and just barely made it in for the first set of people. 

A place well worth trying but if you're planning to come on a weekend make sure to come early!
author: Leia M.

description:
3.5 stars

Good ramen but not the best and the wait is a nightmare!! Good thing is if they call you when you're not here, they will put a star next to your name and if you show up, you will be next in line! Once we were finally seated after waiting 1.5h+ plus, we quickly ordered some hot sake and I opted for the hakata dx. The broth is rich and flavorful. Ramen noodles are the thin type which is not my fav but they were cooked well. The braised pork belly was very tender but it had a sweet taste to it which surprised me a bit and I'm still undecided on how I feel about it. Egg was good and cooked well but I wish they halved it for me (something less pleasurable about biting into a whole egg). Friendly service, extremely quick. I'm really glad we finally worked up the patience to wait and eat here but not my fav ramen (plus my other ramen eccentricities as stated above) and can't really justify this long of a wait again.
author: Yin H.

description: This place is awesome. There's a really long wait so be prepared to hangout for a while before you eat. Luckily, there's a lot to do in the Japantown mall. I usually get two bowls of ramen because it's so good here. Also, I recommend getting the beer they have as well.
author: Klay A.

description: Best ramen of my life! Absolutely worth the wait.  Service is pleasant and fast once you get in.
author: Carolyn F.

description:
Pleasantly surprised about this yummy bowl of noodles. 

It's a simple menu with very few choices. I think there are only four choices. Because the menu is so small and specialized, they've really perfected what they do. The noodles are thinner than normal and their broth is rich and extremely savory with lots of umami! 

I ordered the chicken ramen, not the one with the leg, just the regular one. It came with two pieces of chicken breast and I added bamboo shoots and corn. It was really yummy. I liked that the noodles had a firm texture. The soup base wasn't too salty and it was really rich. Surprisingly, the chicken wasn't dry at all. You have to dig for the soft-boiled egg, but it's there and it's so delicious!!! I usually don't care for eggs too much, but this was really yummy. 

The wait can be a challenge but I think that it's worth it. I didn't have to wait too long and people are ordering a bowls of noodles.
author: Tina Y.

description:
Taste: 4.5/5
Service: 5/5
Ambience: 5/5
Price: 4/5
30 min wait after arriving at 5:30PM

So delicious!!! We were a group of six and order the Hakata Tonkotsu and the Chicken Paitan DX all around with Sapporo to wash it down. The Hakata Tonkotsu pork based broth was to die for, I slurped and sipped every last drop. The shimmered pork belly was seasoned and marinated well and was incredibly tender.
author: Ava Elizabeth T.

description: Great Ramen place to eat on a really cold day.. Would love to try out the rest of the menu if I have a chance, highly recommend their great quality of food that they provide. Give them a chance! Great service comes along with it as well-
author: Mark H.

description:
Best Ramen in SF for sure! I had the chicken ramen, and my husband had the deluxe pork ramen. Both soup base taste amazing, it's the exact flavor we wanted! 

Chicken soup base is lighter compare to the DX Pork ramen, and The DX Pork Ramen soup base has a bit of sweet corn and soy sauce flavor. Both soup base are actually not oily to us, which I was pretty surprised. 

There are two slices of meat on top of the soup, they are perfect tenderness for both the chicken ramen and DX pork ramen. 

The whole boiled egg was hidden under the ramen. They cooked perfectly so the egg yolk stay liquid but the egg white was fully cooked and marinated fully with the soup base. 

The thin noodle is our favorite! Originally the thin noodle ramen comes from Tokyo for serving quick lunch ramen to business man. The noodle created to be thinner to give easy digest for business man rushes to eat their meal. The thin noodle actually taste much more sophisticated to me compare to the thicker noodle,  because it's harder to control the thin noodle hardness when cooking and this place won't let you down!

The portion of the ramen was just right. We didn't waste any part of it. The whole egg definitely adds the fullness. 

The waiting time was 30 minutes. We went on Friday night at 8:50pm right before their closing time. The waitlist is on the glass of their entrance door, sign up time ends at 9PM. 

The atmosphere of the place was lovely. The interior feels authentic, and the lighting wasn't too bright or too dim. It's a great dating place! The tables are little too close to other tables, so I feel like people can constantly hear our conversation BUT Ramen is what connects people together so I actually don't mind! 

Love the experience here, and I'll definitely introduce to my friends! I'll definitely be back :-)
author: Karen C.

description: Tonight we decided to try what's supposed to be one of the best ramen in town and came here! Besides waiting for longer than hour, this juicy creamy Broth ended up being really amazing! tonkotsu pork ramen here are really amazing and food is ready quick. Definitely a place to get back!
author: Irina P.

description:
We were craving ramen and decided to give this place a try. We got there and had to wait about 30mins. If its busy stay close because they call your name (which if it's loud like it was today you won't hear them call you) and they go through the list quickly, people lose their spots. 
They took our orders and the food came out quickly, so not much of a wait once seated. 
The ramen was delicious, we ordered the Hakata Tonkotsu. Very filling and a good portion. Not that pricey, it was $11.99 for the bowl. 
The service was fair, they won't come to you unless you eye them down and ask for their service.  They seem to want to get you in and out as quickly as possible. 
I would recommend trying this restaurant at least once.
author: Alexis G.

description: I waited an hour to be seated. The ramen was pretty good but not worth the wait in my opinion. The place is tiny so it makes sense that there's such a long wait list. Personally i wouldn't come back. There's other ramen places without such a long wait
author: VeryCherryBerry N.

description:
I haven't been to every ramen restaurant in SF, but this is my favorite so far! It's the most flavorful broth I've had! I don't know they do it, but there's so much flavor! I had the Hakata DX which is a little pricier but it has a good amount of meat, noodles, and it's super filling.

Everyone says be prepared to wait. I was lucky and only had to wait 15 minutes! (It was 8 on a Wednesday.) I definitely recommend coming solo or in a group of 2 for faster seating. 

I like spicy but not so much that it overpowers taste. I ordered medium spicy, and it was perfect. By the end, it was a bit hot but still tolerable. 

My only complaint would be that the noodles were so tangled, they were harder to eat. Other than that, I loved everything. Will definitely be back!
author: Melissa W.

description:
My new favorite ramen place in SF!!! My go-to order is the Hakata Tonkotsu with corn. The broth is next level. Super rich and creamy. The flavorful pork melts in your mouth. 

The lines are really long on the weekend, so just be prepared to wait 30-60 min. You can just put your name down and then walk around the area, so it's not too bad. And if they skip over your name, you can let them know and they will accommodate you asap. The service is extremely attentive and fast once you are seated. I have definitely felt rushed, but I completely understand why. They are just trying to get the next party seated since there are so many people waiting.
author: Heidi Q.

description:
Ordered the Hakata DX no spicy, Chicken Paitan DX mild (got the last one, since they only make 15 servings), takoyaki, and extra noodle. 

Service was amazing, everything came within 5 minutes after we ordered!! 

Hakata DX was good. Chicken Paitan DX soup was better, with the small kick of spice. The chicken that came with it was very very tender and perfectly sweet! 

Takoyaki was average, I've tasted better ones from other restaurants in Japantown.
author: Megan L.

description:
I've been to Japanese town in LA, hand's down way better here in SF. Maybe I'll fly back just for this place! 
45 minute wait but would do it all over again!
author: Aaron D.

description: Used the Yelp Waitlist option for Marufuku Ramen so we were seated once we arrived which was very convenient. Service was great, they took our orders quickly and our food came out quickly. I ordered an edamame for $4 and a Hakata Tonkotsu no spicy for $11.99. My friends ordered mild and medium Hakata Tonkotsu. Edamame not worth $4 in my opinion. The portion size for Hakata Tonkotsu was good (I wasn't too full or still hungry after the edamame and ramen). They add ginger in the ramen which I've personally never had. I didn't like it but I could probably ask them to make the ramen without ginger if I come again. My friends said the mild and medium Hakata Tonkotsu was not spicy, so if you're looking for spicy ramen, maybe go for spicy or ultra spicy? The noodles are thinner than the ramen noodles I usually have but I liked the thin noodles. Overall, not spectacular but not a bad ramen spot.
author: Michelle L.

description: Located on the 2nd floor in the mall. Definite worth the wait. My girlfriend and I usually come here half an hour before it opens. It would probably be the shortest wait time you would have to wait to get in. This ramen place is all about the broth. It is so freaking good. We have tried pretty much all of the different ramens here and each one of them is good on its own. My go to is the tonkatsu with extra cha-shu on the side. My girlfriend likes the Paitan DX, you get the ramen and chicken on the side. The chicken itself is very flavorful. Pairs really well with the ramen. My favorite part is the ramen, they have the thin noodles that perfectly goes with their delicious broth. This is my place to go for Ramen.
author: Alex G.

description: Very delicious soup, don't be surprise, you have to pay their health care insurance on the your bill:(
author: Bob J.

description:
Best Ramen I've ever had. My roommate cried tears of joy because it was so darn delicious. I have to warn that the line is ridiculously long. We waited about an hour or so for a party of 2. 

We decided to share everything so that we could try as much as we could.

For appetizer we got the Chicken Karrage, it was delicious and perfectly crispy and tender. As well as the Mentaiko Bowl, it was a lot spicer than anticipated but nevertheless delicious. 

For ramen, we ordered the Chicken Paitan, just the regular, but we regretted not trying the DX cuz that chicken looked AMAAZING. So when it comes to soup, I'm not the person to drink the broth... but let me tell you I drank this whole bowl clean.
author: Houyee C.

description:
The geso fried squid legs were delicious and crispy and not overly chewy, came with a tasty dipping sauce + lemon.

The ramen is amazing and the broth has so much flavor. I got the medium spice and it is a little spicy but I like a bit of kick. The pork is tender and melt in your mouth with great flavor. This might just be the best ramen in San Francisco! Love it.
author: Ellie R.

description: Their Hakata Dx (deluxe, which is the equivalent to their Hakata Tonkotsu ramen but with braised pork belly, instead of regular pork belly, and corn) had the tastiest ramen broth I've ever had. What a wonderful rich, broth flavor! It's been 3 hours since I had this yummy broth and I'm still craving it. It's located across from Sophie's Crepes and we were there at 1pm on a Sunday. The wait was 2 hours for 6 ppl. Perhaps the wait would be shorter for a smaller group of 2? I thought the wait was worth it, though. I will definitely be coming back!
author: P C.

description: I like it. Will come again with friends. Best time to start lining up is 40 minutes before opening. There is also a waiting line if you use the Yelp app.
author: Elise W.

description: Noticed the line of people waiting while wasting time is Japan Center. Better than a five star review? Our party of four went the next night. We arrived 20 minutes before they opened and still had 15 in front of us. This should be good!  It was. Great service and great food delivered quickly, reasonably priced and tasty. Worth the wait.
author: Jim M.

description: The line was very long because the place is small, but it's nice to be able to walk around the complex while you're waiting. And the food was amazing! The broth was very light, the noodles were bouncey, and the service was great!
author: Kristine C.

description:
The pork belly is luscious, delicious, and melts in your mouth... not in a gross ice cream way but a tender, delicate way. I got the hakata tonkotsu (mild; they have 5 spice levels including no spice at all) bc I wasn't sure if I could handle spicy... which was pretty time with a tiny kick. For the price and easy accessibility, it was great! 

The green onions, the broth, the ramen noodles, and mushrooms were all on point. And don't forget a large soft-boiled egg buried deep- probably hidden beneath the noodles! There was a decent amount of pork belly. Also, I have a thing about TOO much pork fat but it was actually the perfect amount for me. The chicken karaage rice bowl was also a nice appetizer, but you honestly don't need it because you will be stuffed by the seemingly small, but rather filling bowl of ramen! 

location: since it's in the middle of the Japantown plaza, parking is either metered or the nearby parking structure. I personally like to park a few blocks away and walk for free 2-hour  in the residential area. 

There are general bathrooms (not in the restaurant) in the plaza on the bottom floor. And, the main problem is that they don't have a lot of 2 seater tables. Therefore, my dining partner and I ended up waiting 45 min after arriving at 11:45 and were promptly seated at a 4 person table. Thankfully there's plenty to entertain with a Japanese book/manga store as well as stationary store nearby! I want to come back to try the chicken paitan!
author: Kimberly Y.

description: Filled with disappointment and regretful calories. Come if you like tasteless super mutant chicken paitan. Never been so disproportionately disappointed by a ramen place with hype lines.
author: Anthony W.

description: First time going here since I am originally from SoCal but they did not disappoint. Hands down the best ramen I've ever had. Their Hakata Ramen was worth the wait. We ended up getting there a little before opening so the wait was only about 30 minutes which wasn't too bad but it was definitely worth it. Service was pretty good too even though they are short staffed and very busy.
author: Robyn O.

description: The wait is worth it! I've been anticipating delicious ramen. It's been a couple years from having good ramen (i.e Iwakuni, Tokyo, and Yokosuka in Japan) I love the chicken karaage, pork buns, hakata ramen, and the beer. I'd come back again, even if it's an hour and a half drive from me.
author: Rox A.

description:
The service was HORRIBLE. First off, there was already a long line so my friends and I assume that we just had to wait in line to get in. INSTEAD, there was a sign in sheet where it was hidden because it was hanging on the door, so who the heck can see that? 
Basically, my friends and I waited 30 minutes and had 3 parties before us until we sit down and next thing you know, one of the worker comes out and walks to the back of the line and asked people to sign in. Wait, but don't you go to the front and ask your way down and see if everyone signed in?! Urgh, so stupid. So instead of waiting for the 3 parties before us, we had to wait for 10 parties... 
I would give no stars, but obviously I can't so I'll give two stars since the food was delicious.
author: Tina D.

description: Seemed okay. Spices were kind of all over the place. Seems like they try to do too much. Can't complain though. Perhaps I wasn't in the right mindset.
author: Adidas W.

description: This is now my favorite ramen shop in my neighborhood and chicken ramen DX (including the grilled thigh) is my favorite ramen order whenever I am here.  This place is always busy so come early. There's no advance reservation, but their self sign-in system will text a message to your phone when your number is up.
