The restaurant is nicely laid out and clean. Service is polite and quick, which I like. Their appetizers are very good, especially the chicken karaage and fried squid.  The broth for both chicken and pork ramens are flavorful. Ask for "spicy".  Most of the tables are small, accommodating 2 to 4 customers at a time, so will be difficult to arrange for a large gathering.  This was what I ordered last night. Chicken Ramen DX.
author: Duke D.

description: Best ramen I've had! The broth was nice and rich; very salty, but in a good way! My favorite was of course the meat; the simmered pork belly has so much flavor and it's very tender. Would definitely come here again! It also seems to be a popular spot in the Japantown mall because a lot of people were waiting in line today.
author: Nicole S.

description: This restaurant served the best ramen I have ever had. Their water is very refreshing, as it is served with cucumber, mint, and lime. The edamame was fresh, and the ramen's broth was full of flavor!
author: Chelsea C.

description: This might be the best ramen in San Francisco. I usually get the Hakata DX along with the chashu buns as an appetizer. Their chashu is real pork filling with pieces of meat that has the perfect amount of fat. The ramen is just hands down the best! Broth is great and ramen is flavorful from the meats.
author: Kevin R.

description:
One of the best, if not the best, ramen I've ever had! I had the chicken paitan. The noodles were al dente. Just right in texture. Firm with a nice chewy texture. The broth was rich without being overly saturated. Some establishments go overboard with the seasoning which can leave you with a thirsty aftertaste afterwards. Not so with this one.
Lines can be long getting in so I'd suggest getting your place right as they open.
author: Michael G.

description: This is the best ramen ever....  There was a line  before they opened.  That was a great sign.
author: Antonio S.

description: One of the best ramens in San Francisco! My friends and I waited at least 1 hour on a Saturday night. So try to get there early or else be prepare to wait! The restaurant is small, but service is extremely friendly and fast. Shout out to the server, who kept refilling our waters. I really like their cute ramen bowl and hipster interior/ tables (in the middle of the restaurant). Their chicken karaage was so freaking good and tender. Definitely get it if you're into appetizers. I ordered their tonkotsu ramen and it was bomb dot com. The only thing I regretted was ordering "average" spicy. Holy moly, it was too spicy for me, but it was the good kind of spicy. Nevertheless, I devoured everything and enjoyed everything about this place. I will definitely be coming back soon.
author: John N.

description: Since this place has a such a long wait, I arrived 10 minutes before they opened and I kid you not, I still had to wait 45 minutes. But it was worth the wait. The service was attentive and quick. The food came out at a reasonable time. I ordered the tontkatsu ramen and the broth was super rich. My taste palette blew away on that first bite. People may say this place is overrated, but it's definitely a must try if it's going to be your first time. The pork belly here was moist that it just melts in your mouth. But definitely prepare to wait no matter what time you arrive.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
OMG, I swear I'm back in Japan! Actual authentic ramen here in San Francisco. I'm in heaven! 

My only minor criticism would be the noodles inside the ramen, which look like American noodles rather than homemade thick ramen noodles, but the taste of the EXCELLENT broth made up for the noodles.

Try the Hakata Tonkotsu DX, medium spicy, with BRAISED pork belly, it's super savory!!!

Oh yeah, I almost forgot. This restaurant has the most kickass waitlist electronic system I've ever seen. I signed in for the waitlist (which is integrated with Yelp.com on the backend), walked away to the local Japanese grocery shop to do some grocery shopping while I waited, came back to the restaurant, waited one more hour while comfortably watching YouTube on my phone on the Wi-Fi, and then was seated in the appropriate order. I knew the whole time I was there what place in line I was with the helpful text messaging post. The automated system also does a call to you 5 minutes before you're to be seated. Excellent,  excellent electronic system!!! I wish all restaurants had a system like this!!!
author: Prie L.

description: Amazing in every way! We waited for a while but we didn't mind it at all! We were seated at their closing time but they served us without hurry and with excellence. Loved it!
author: Alison A.

description:
Best Hakata-style (thin and hard noodles) tonkotsu (pork bone broth) ramen in SF! The pork was insanely good, and the egg was masterfully done.

You could just tell there is a bunch of passion happening in the kitchen, and the lines are always long.

Special mention for the takoyaki - hand made and amazing. Soft on the inside, and crisp on the outside. Reminded me of simple takoyaki from Tokyo. いいね。外はカリカリ、中はトロトロ！(⁎⁍⁍⁎)

The location is not the best, but this is still a 5 star ramen place no matter what.
author: Grayson K.

description: Long wait, about 1-2 hours minimum. The ramen broth was very good, had some sandy texture at the end though. The ramen noodle itself was different that what i anticipated, it's a very very thin noodle, versus the traditional medium thickness noodle. Overall, still worth the experience!
author: Kathleen Q.

description:
Probably the best ramen I've had in SF so far, but not as good as the best places I've tried in NYC and Boston.

I do agree with some of the other reviewers that the broth was a bit too sweet, which is a strange thing for ramen. I made sure to get the spicy version, which helped offset it a bit, but just be aware that this broth is sugary. Otherwise, the broth was nice in that it was rich without feeling overly greasy as can be the case at a lot of ramen spots.

This was my first time having noodles this thin, and i actually really enjoyed the texture because the noodles were pretty al dente and held together well despite their thinness. Solid variety of toppings; I especially liked the pickled ginger (normal for sushi, not really for ramen), as it added a nice contrast to the richness of everything else.
author: Harry X.

description: Man this place is a must try but you must go early because it was a Sunday and there was about 20 people ahead of me and the restaurant wasn't even open yet. The bowl of Ramen was perfect, the sizzling chicken was tender and flavorful but nothing like I must come to this place just for this. Salad I've had better at other Japanese places and the chicken karnage over rice was just what I expected.
author: Kevin S.

description:
Very good ramen! Went at 12pm in a weekday and it didn't take long to get seated with three adults and one child. There's a clipboard on the door you need to just write your name down and wait to be called.

Very open and lots of seating for big or small groups which is convenient, very clean and modern!

I got the Hakata Tonkotsu with the medium level spicy. It wasn't too spicy but was good for those who enjoy a little heat but enough to still taste the flavor of the broth. The noodles were not cooked all the way through when the bowl first arrived, but after a couple minutes the broth cooked them down. The broth was creamy and you could taste the pork. The simmered pork belly was tender and delicious, it melts in your mouth and not over cooked. The fresh ginger was great, and I love ginger but sometimes it was overpowering. The soft boiled egg tasted AMAZING, I've never had an egg in ramen like this, maybe it was brined in the pork broth but it was so good! The ramen overall was a little too salty, even though it was good you definitely need a lot of water to go with it.

The service was great we had someone come for our order right when we were seated, but we weren't ready yet, and then two other people separately came over to take our order. At first I thought they might be trying to get us in and out, since there was a line, but once we got our food they weren't pushy at all. We took our time and they were great at water refills and checking on us. We had a 2 year old with us and they were very accommodating with extra bowl and little fork and spoon for him without having to ask.
author: Angelina S.

description:
Although the ambience & meal were extremely enjoyable...

The waiting staff really did rush my group. When first opening the doors for dinner a gentle welcome & inviting energy would've been preferred.
author: Adrianna B.

description: Definitely recommend going 15-30 minutes before they open. Most of the time there's already a Long line before the store opens. If this is your first time and you're eating with friends, I would recommend for one person to order the chicken paitan deluxe. The side of chicken is delicious and a must try! Besides that the hakata ramen is great too! Ultra spicy is just nice and not too spicy.
author: Ma L.

description: So goooood! We got the vegetarian ramen. The broth is delicious, the noodles are firm and chewy, and the toppings are fresh. The soft boiled egg was cooked perfectly. Would recommend adding one more topping like mushrooms if you get this. If you like spicy, medium doesn't cut it. Get hot!
author: Alex H.

description:
Ordered the premium ramen which was the ramen XD. It has the braised pork which is the fatty kind of pork. Personally, I thought the regular one was actually better - it had the simmered pork. The braised pork was fatty and salty. Each ramen had a bunch of topping such as seaweed, corn, the mushrooms, etc. Overall, I really liked the broth. It was creamy and flavorful. The noodles were on the thinner side. Again, personally I like the thicker ramen noodles. The dish was good and is super filling. Only 1 out of us 4 girls finished our ramen. We also had hot sake, a pitcher of beer (good for one glass for each of us), and 2 appetizers (karage chicken and takoyaki). Tons of food for us girls! Appetizers were both good too btw. The restaurant closed at 9:30 and we got there around 8:45 and put our names on the list. Got seated in 15-20 mins and they were nice enough to serve us. 

TIP #1: this place is located on the second floor next to the "pika pika" picture place! 
TIP #2: Bathroom is located across from the location of the restaurant on the same side where Sophie's crepes is located
author: Mariel Ashley S.

description: The real deal. Best ramen I've had in a while. Was a solo diner and they seated me at a table with another solo diner. Struck up a great conversation. Tip-Use the waitlist on Yelp. Usually a line.
author: Steve T.

description: Wait time was a little over an hour on a Saturday night for a group of five.    We were able to walk around the plaza while waiting to be seated as they use yelp to put your name down for a reservation.  All five of us ordered the Hakata Dx and it did not disappoint.  The meat and broth were both highlights.  The braised pork belly was very tender and the broth accompanied it very well.  The portion of noodles they give is also the perfect amount.  I love noodles especially ramen and the portion was perfect, with space for dessert after!
author: Briana L.

description:
-Put your name/number down on the tablet
-check your status on yelp
-go across the street on Geary to social hall to grab pre meal drinks 
-ramen is amazing and definitely the best in the city
author: Derrick W.

description:
Best ramen in SF in my opinion.
Okay the wait is a bit long sometimes (once we waited 2 hours, there were 47 parties before us), but it's worth it.

We've tried all the ramen on the (short) menu, all are delicious. And the fact that you don't have 15 different choices is a huge plus - less is better!
author: Michel P.

description:
I was here about a month ago. Including tips, I wrote $47 on the receipt. They ended up charging me $50 on my credit card. SUCH A SCAM!

The portion was small, and the grill chicken thigh that came with the ramen was dry and blend. Overall, the food was okay and overpriced.
author: Lolol H.

description:
Really enjoyed Marufuku ramen! The interior was very nice and clean, and the waiters and waitresses were all very attentive and fast. We only waited about 15 minutes so definitely was worth it!

I preferred the Hakata ramen over the chicken, the borth was just more of what I like. The chicken ramen was delicious too! I liked how the deluxe came with chicken on the side. Will say that the food was slightly salty for my taste and that the thin noodles were not my favorite. Loved that the broth was very hot, and that they gave a whole egg in each bowl - oh my the egg was perfectly runny. Decent amount of meat for the portions. One thing to note is that "spicy" was not very spicy at all.
author: Ariana F.

description:
Hands down one of the best bowls of ramen I've had in a while. I think this might be my new favorite!! 

I ordered the Hakata Tonkotsu ($11) in medium spicy. The food came out in minutes and when I took my first sip of the broth, my eyes literally widened like O_O... because it was SO GOOD!!!! I can't begin to explain how I savored every bit of this bowl: the broth, the noodles, the egg, and the pork belly!! It's like someone analyzed my taste buds and made the ultimate bowl of ramen.

The only downside is, with every good ramen restaurant in the city, comes a long wait. There's a clipboard on the door for you to put your name and party size down. I came on a Saturday at 6pm and waited a little over an hour for a party of 2. Not bad but the crowd outside seemed to double around 7-8pm. A great way to pass the time is visiting the huge bookstore next door, or all the other little cute shops in the area.

Really looking forward to coming back!
author: Bing L.

description: Since last time stop at Japanese town found there is a new ramen spot, and went to try it out. But the ramen itself is not really chewiness, it's way too soft, and hard tell which one is which, we actually ordered two types ramen, but it looks and tastes soooo similar. But in general like the interior design.
author: Faye L.

description: Delicious ramen. Good portions. Fast services. Only negative is you better get there early cause the lines grow long very quickly.
author: Evelyn G.

description:
This place is legit. Simple menu with straight forward ramen options just like it is in Japan. Don't come here for vegan or vegetarian ramen, but a well done classic pork or chicken ramen....definite yes. Noodles, broth, ingredients and service are all fantastic. 

Tip: Line can be long so come early or make sure you accommodate wait time in your hunger level.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Great ramen, been back many times. A bit spoiled from having lived in Asia and had many rounds of truly excellent tonkatsu ramen, but Marafuku is extremely solid.

Only thing that's not really to my taste is the corn - I guess next time I'll just see if they can serve it without. 

The experience, esp being in Japantown, makes you feel to a large degree like you're really there.
author: W N.

description: Best ramen I have had in USA. Price also very reasonable especially given that it is in SF.
author: Xiao W.

description: We waited over an hour. But, this place is worth it! This was the best Ramon I have ever had in my life.  This was one of the best restaurants we experienced the whole week.  It's fun shopping around while you wait. A word of advise. Register on the waiting list on yelp !
author: Tim B.

description:
Best ramen ever! Soup is excellent! Personally like the chicken favor soup.  Noodles is thinner than other ramen restaurants. More tender. Very different. 
Add to the waiting list before arrival is strongly recommended.
author: H C.

description: So I'm visiting  from nyc and I wanted some authentic  ramen soup.  The food was excellent. However  the place was so small and when I arrived  at 6pm there  was a 101 people on their  waiting  list. It was a 2 hour wait.  Again the food was excellent. I ordered  mine to go.
author: Cherise N.

description:
Went to Marufuku to catch up with some friends after work on a Tuesday night. My friends had gotten there earlier than me, so they added themselves to the queue (started out as #25). They had a nice system through the Yelp app. It allowed us to check our places in line. 

We got our table a little over an hour later. We almost got seated in the traditonal-looking middle area with the light up seats, but we had three people, so we weren't able to sit there, so we sat at a regular table to the side. Restaurant was bright, clean and modern. 

Service was good and efficient. They're pretty quick about serving and refillling water whenever we were low. And our food came out pretty quickly. 

Decided to go with the Hakata Tonkatsu and the Hakata DX, as well as a side of Chicken Karage. Went with mild, although I didn't really taste any spiciness. So, I would probably go up another spice level if I were to come back. The ramen broth here was meatier, and the chashu sweeter than other ramen places I've had. I liked that the noodles were nice and thin with the right amount of firmness for thin noodles. The soft boiled egg was nice, better than Ippudo in Berkeley which literally gave me a regular boiled egg, that I had to get as an add-on too! But, it couldn't beat the smoky soft boiled egg at Waraku, the ramen place outside the Japantown mall area. The ramen also came with a good amount of bean sprouts! The Hakata DX came with corn, seaweed, and braised pork, on top of what was already in the Tokatsu. The braised pork was really tender. Seaweed was nice and crisp. Corn wasn't sweet enough, maybe because they're no longer in season. The chicken karage was surprisingly good. I was expecting the typical chicken karage, but the flavour was different in a good way. It was lighter, and went really well with the mayo dip that came with it. The chicken was tender. 

Good overall, but maybe I'm not a huge fan of the Hakata styled ramen. It's not my favorite ramen place in the bay area, especially with the wait.
author: Christine L.

description:
TLDR: Long waits, but some of the best ramen you can get in SF!

Oh god is this place awesome. The hakata DX is this delightfully rich tonkotsu ramen that somehow feels light at the same time. It also comes with a tasty softboiled egg and hearty slab of braised pork belly. You can dial the spiciness all the way up to ultra spicy (it's not that spicy though). The ramen also comes in this hand sculpted clay bowl that makes you feel like you're eating ramen out of a deep oyster shell!

Don't miss Marufuku if you catch yourself hungry in Japantown!
author: Henry Z.

description: Second time dining here and I loved it! Quick and fast service and quality food at reasonable prices by SF standards. Ordered the hakata tonkotsu (different from the hakata DX, which comes with corn, seaweed, and thicker pork but at a higher price point). It was delicious! Creamy and juicy; smell the broth that rocks the body that rocks the party
author: David Y.

description:
4.5/5! Dare I say this is the best ramen noodle I've ever had. Even better than daikokuya in La Japantown. I ordered the pork broth tonkatsu - spicy level. The broth is made of the most rich & flavorful Wonders that the world of noodles has to offer. The pork meat melts in your mouth, as it should. The noodle is on the thin side but I didn't even care because the rest of the Ramen was so good. The bowl only comes in one size @ $11.99 but it's one of those deep Bowls so it's not too bad; enough for one person. 
We came about half an hour before they opened & the line was already forming. I would suggest come 45 minutes to an hour before the restaurant opens to line-up to make sure that you get in with the first group that is served. We were literally the first of the second group but Fortunately, the wait wasn't too long - about 20 min wait. Also, the ramen came up pretty quick too so that was definitely a bonus. 
The inside is definitely small & cramped, so do not come with a very big party unless you don't mind getting split up. I think the max table that I saw held about four to six people. Service was good & they did their job; nothing to complain about there. 
Overall, I would definitely recommend if you like Ramen or looking to try Ramen for the first time. Anyone would enjoy & appreciate this place I believe. I am definitely coming back & I'm saddened that I have only just now found out about it. Highly highly recommend!
author: Hu L.

description: Yum yum yum! Handmade noodles, delicious broth, and tender charsu. Definitely recommend, but be prepared to wait. Luckily there's a lot to do in the area and they call when your table is e
author: Lex D.

description: The hype is real. Best ramen Ive had in my life so far. I got the tonkatsu with added sweetcorn. Very creamy dank broth with alot of depth.
author: Nagger M.

description: Love coming here for Ramen. The line is long but you can check-in and spend some time wandering Japan town or even take Pika Pika next door!
author: J C.

description: Ate here twice. Had a tonkatsu ramen medium level spiciness. It was milder than i thought but broth was really good. Make sure to line up at least 30 min before it opens!
author: Patricia L.

description:
I hate waiting in lines, but Marafuku's ramen might be worth waiting for.

Loved both the hakata tonkotsu and the chicken paitan. It's SOO hard to choose between them, so luckily I have a bf who will let me take slurps from his bowl. I actually preferred the pork in the hakata tonkotsu, but I might try the DX next time (with braised pork belly instead).

The space is super small, but the food literally arrives within 5 minutes of ordering and the staff is super friendly. I like that they have a friendly app to tell you how many parties are in front of you!
author: Vivian H.

description: Truly great. I was worried because of the lines, but it actually went really quick and the food was amazing!
author: Amanda H.

description: After two hours of waiting, we finally had their signature pork ramens. The soup is too salty for me, the noodles is so so, definitely not comparable to the ones we had in Japan. Not worthy for the long wait.
author: Su Y.

description: I'm glad there's good ramen in the East Bay. The broth is excellent, the noodles are cooked to perfection
author: Ta C.

description: Waited forever for this place..to be seated ..had 52 people ahead of us.. but man it was worth it..and the food was quick did not take long either..
author: Vien L.

description:
Huh??? I don't get all the hype. After waiting nearly an hour for a table I expected a good bowl of ramen, especially since this place has stellar reviews. But what I got (the hakata tonkotsu) was wonton noodles with some ramen ingredients. The noodles were thin, the type used in Chinese wonton noodle soup. There was no real texture or chewiness to the ramen. I can't even tell if it's al dente which is what I look for in ramen due to the thin noodles. The ramen had no seaweed but had some ginger slices on it, blah! I removed them. And my "soft-boiled egg" was a hard-boiled egg. It was an entire egg which is great, but the inside was nearly fully cooked and had no runniness at all.  The good things about the ramen was the rich tasty broth and nice thin slices of braised pork belly. And the portion was pretty filling due to the full-sized egg.

Overall, edible but not memorable.

Oh, and we ran out of water and they never came by to refill it.

To top it off, the suggested tips on the receipt is deceptive. They calculated a 15% tip off a $30 meal which included tax and their health fee as $5 and some change. How?! Do yourself a favor and do your own math when paying.

Low 3 star.

Their online menu prices are outdated.
author: Ali F.

description:
Yesss! 5 stars. Totally worth the wait. Small bites and ramen were all amazing. There's enough broth for an extra side of noodles which we got. The spicy level broth which was just the right amount of heat. Prices are very reasonable considering the level of quality and service.
My new favorite.
author: Solomon S.

description: If you love ramen, then you MUST try this place. It was the best Ramen my fiancé and I ever had. It's going to be hard going back to our normal spot after having this. Trust me, it's definitely worth the wait!
author: Dustin W.

description: Arrived at 7:30pm on a Wednesday and waited around an hour to be seated. The service was quick and efficient. The Hakata DX spicy was a good amount of spice but not too overwhelming. The broth was very flavorful and the bowl was packed with traditional ramen toppings like braised pork belly, corn, egg (delicious), sprouts, nori, etc. The hakata-style noodles were the right amount of chewiness and were tasty as well.
author: Dani T.

description: You could have to wait for 45 mins before you get a table. Specially on weekends. Its better to get on the wait list online using yelp. But even a wait of 45 mins is worth it. Undoubtedly the best Ramen in town. Vegetarian one is simply amazing and we can choose how much spicy we would like it to be. Service is good and the space could be crowded but the food will make you overlook these nitty gritty things! Would recommend it to everyone! Its the "Cant afford to miss Ramen place"
author: Maragatham K.

description:
Expect a little wait for lunch but the food was worth it. The broth unlike many other great ramen joints was meaty but less salty than normal. The cha siu and belly were both well done. 

The place is hard to find just by maps as to not in the building directory and is on the second floor of the mall, just run up the stairs.
author: Ian C.

description: Since moving back to SF, my BF and I have been on the hunt for our new favorite ramen spot and Marafuku has been the winner so far. I've been to Marafuku 2-3 times now and it's been consistently good. A bit of a wait to get seated (45mins-1hr on average), typical of most good restaurants in SF, but worth the wait IMO. I've tried the HAKATA TONKOTSU which comes with simmered pork belly, soft boiled egg, green onion, kikurage mushroom and bean sprouts. for $4 more you can get BRAISED pork belly (that's really the only difference). The hakata is delicious, the bowl is a modest portion but don't be fooled it's very filling. The pork belly is tender and has great flavor, the noodles were the perfect chewy texture. I have also tried the CHICKEN KARAAGE which I thought was pretty good, but not the best karaage I've ever had. I've tried Mensho and Marafuku wins in that contest, I will need to try Hinodeya (the other hyped ramen in the neighborhood) before we make the final decision, but so far Marafuku has a warm spot in our hearts.
author: Elaine N.

description:
Can again on a saturday night and the wait was much longer this time , 40 minutes on a saturday night. Staff is friendly but a bit inattentive since they were so busy! Tried the pork belly rice this time in addition to the ramen. 

The rice was just ok-really was just rice w a (kind of) dry piece of meat on top. However ramen is still amazing and worth the wait!
author: Doreen C.

description: Wooow....Crispy pork belly...This was really good. It was something different for a dinner meat choice. I purchased a large chunk of pork belly that I make bacon with and I cut a piece from that to make this recipe. I will definitely make this again.
author: Macleod R.

description: Be prepared for a long wait but the food is amazing. I've only tried the pork tonkatsu but I will continue ordering it because it is just that good. We had a couple apps, nothing too memorable but they were good. I think we have the Karaage most of the time. It comes with a mayo or aioli dip on the side. Pretty good and not too pricey.
author: Natalie A.

description:
Creamy, creamy Paitan. Had mine with extra bamboo shoots. Very satisfying. 

Luckily the line was short for our quick lunch, but it's often packed.
author: Jonah G.

description: Best Ramen in the city. Always a long line but worth the wait as line goes very quick. Try the Chicken DX if you can!
author: Rabia H.

description: Best ramen I've ever had.. I'm from Vancouver which is home to plenty of authentic ramen places but the broth here was by far the best. So much flavour in the broth! I tried both the pork and the chicken ramen. I prefer the pork as it has a stronger flavour but both were delicious. The service is also very quick and efficient. I came before the restaurant opened and there were already 40+ people ahead of me in line! They do try to get you in and out though which makes sense with the lineups. Definitely worth it!
author: Cynthia C.

description: I've been living in the Bay Area for about two years now and this is hands down the most flavorful ramen I have ever had. The wait is about 2 hours if you don't get there early, but there is a lot to look at in the Japan center and it is most definitely worth the wait. Once you're seated the food is served almost immediately. Have gone a few times and am never disappointed.
author: Jasmine O.

description: It was delicious...I am very picky when it comes to ramen and I would absolutely go back again...one of my stops for sure the next time I am in San Fran
author: Kim M.

description: We order fried squid and three different types of ramen. The chicken deluxe one comes with the best roast chucked I've had in a while. Fried squid also very tender. And hot sake not bad either. Worth the 50 minute wait
author: Alicia Xiaorong Z.

description: Since i shared a hakata dx and the chicken paitan dx with my friend, i was able to sample all of their menu in one sitting. In conclusion, that chicken paitan ramen was something else entirely. The broth and the smell of grilled beansprouts hits your nose immediately. My god, i wish there was an equally good chicken paitan option in LA. As far as tonkotsu goes, i personally have tried enough bowls of tonkotsu than i can count using both my fingers and toes. It was definitely a good bowl of tonkotsu ramen living up to the hakata style name. However it was just that, there are places in LA that goes beyond that level such as tsujita. For the bay area though, maybe this is the best.
author: Ji T.

description: Me and my wife really enjoyed eating here. Everything is 5 Stars. The service, food, atmosphere. I like how you can add your name on the list, check your place on yelp (mine didn't work at the time), and browse around Japan Town until you get a text saying you're table is almost ready. Once we got seated, the waitress was on top of everything. Me and my wife ordered Takoyaki for an appetizer and we both got the Hakata DX, here being medium and mines being mild. The Takoyaki balls was really good and didn't taste like it was from the sea. It was crunchy outside and soft inside. Kinda like eating a mashed potato ball. The Hakata DX was superb! My broth had just enough spice to enjoy it and the wife's medium was delicious as well. Now that meat in our bowls, holy crap. If I had no teeth and I just bit the meat with gums only, it would pull apart easily! The taste of the meat reminds me of Filipino Pork Adobo. This is now one of my top ramen spots in the Bay Area. I'm definitely going to be a returning customer.
author: Maikell B.

description: While we admittedly haven't made our way to all of the popular ramen spots in the city, this place has been our absolute favorite so far. Definitely recommend getting there 30ish minutes before they open so you don't have to wait too long once they start seating people. I'd recommend skipping the starters to save room for the ramen. Not that the starters are bad at all - the ramen is just that good.
author: Brittany K.

description:
When a friend who knew that I love ramen had heard that I was visiting San Francisco, she recommended a few of the city's best ramen shops to me. This one, she said, had upwards to a two hour wait but because it's in a mall you could line up indoors instead of out on the street like several other hyped ramen joints.

I decided to give it a shot and went there for dinner tonight. Arriving around 4:25 and seeing no line, I made the mistake of ducking into the bookstore next door for a bit. When I came out around 4:35, the line was already down to the other end of the building. There must have been at least 50 people ahead of me. Instead of getting seated in the first wave, I had to wait until the second and ended up waiting a total of about an hour.

The wait was very definitely worth it. I managed to get one of the 15 Chicken Paitan Deluxe they serve per day. The combination of the grilled chicken in that sweet sauce and the ramen in that broth with just the right weight managed to hit every single comfort food desire that I had. It felt like eating an entire church potluck at the same time, but without any of the guilt.

And a side note: I very much appreciate the pace of the experience. I am in the shove ramen in your face as quickly as possible school of ramen eating, which I suppose many people, especially those with children, aren't. This place has that. Everything's quick but without rush, and the servers move with polite urgency. It is not a place to hang out and chat forever, and some people probably won't like that but to me it's what a ramen shop should be.

I have to admit that I was very skeptical at first, but it was worth the wait. Of course, I only had a one hour wait and more than half of it was spent inside the tea store and stationary store next door. If I had to stand in line for over an hour? This may not have been worth the experience. Or it may have. After all, I'm so impressed with it that I actually wrote a Yelp review for the first time in over a year.
author: Echo L.

description: The RAMEN was worth 1.5 hours wait!!! Broth was soo milky and you can choose your level of spicyness. Make sure you sign in on their ipad to put your name on the list.
author: Cherry R.

description:
Omg NOW my favorite ramen place! We ordered 2 of their yelp-recommended Hakata DX ramen and their takoyaki appetizer and everything was so sooo tasty!! We also added extra bean sprouts and bamboo shoots, but honestly the ramen itself is already pretty packed with goodies that you wouldn't really need to add anything anymore. 
The ramen already has corn, green onion, ginger, a HUGE portion of sweetly marinated pork belly, a few thin slices of fatty chasu pork and 1 WHOLE soft boiled egg!...idk if it's seasoned already but it's the tastiest soft boiled egg I've ever had. It's warm, sweet and creamy. Idk if all SF ramen places give out a whole egg, but that was a huge plus. It came in (what looks like) a small bowl BUT, in reality, the portion is actually a good size!
The takoyaki was super tasty as well. I believe there was creamy mashed potato inside? Not sure, but super good.
If I had to mention a "con", I would say maybe the wait...but it's expected with any place that's this popular and highly rated. We waited about an hour to get seated, BUT the fact that this place is inside a mall and other entertainment all around it, it's not that bad of a wait.
author: Cat C.

description:
I tried calling them, but never able to get someone to pick up the phone call. 

I tired coming multiple times, but their wait list is always long, more than 1 hr. Weekends or weekdays. 

Sick of it. 

I am sure I can live without it.
author: Willie G.

description:
My friend wanted ramen and I've been eyeing this place for awhile, so we met up for dinner on a Friday evening. We came before the rush and was seated in about 5 minutes at 6:30pm. For a starter, we tried the Geso Fry ($6.50) per recommendation by the server. The geso fry (fried squid legs) were crunchy and chewy. It went great with the mayonnaise, but they definitely could've provided a lot more for dipping; it was literally just a squeeze.

For my ramen, I opted for the Chicken Paitan DX (I realized DX meant Deluxe) ($14.99). If you're going for deluxe, get the chicken one. Otherwise, I'd probably go for the Hakata Tonkotsu next time because it didn't seem as worth to get the deluxe for the tonkotsu, which my friend ordered. They only serve 15 servings of the Chicken Paitan DX, so be sure to get there early enough for it! This order came with the ramen along with a huge piece of chicken leg cooked in soy sauce on a bed of beansprouts. The chicken was flavorful and plentiful, so definitely made this meal worth it. As for the ramen, my favorite part was the option to make the ramen as spicy as you wanted from none, mild, medium, spicy, and even ultra spicy! Another thing I loved about their ramen here is the soft-boiled egg that they have hidden inside the bowl. Mine came out perfectly and I always love a perfect soft-boiled egg.

Here's a new yummy ramen spot in town. Everything came out quickly and tasted great with a simple menu.
author: Cindy Z.

description:
If you're thinking about trying Marufuku, do it.
If you're scared of the wait time, don't be. There's a very obvious reason the line is out the door even before the restaurant opens! 

[To put it simply] 
The ramen here is damn delicious. I've tried a good many different ramen shops all over the Bay Area, and Marufuku has proven itself a worthy contender amongst the rest. 

[The details]
I tried the Tonkotsu Hakata Deluxe. First off, the presentation is beautiful. I'm definitely one of those people who eats with their eyes, so I appreciate attention to detail before I dig in. The ramen itself did not disappoint either! The best part for me was the thin angel hair-like noodles. The only other place I can recall using a similar style of noodles was back in Portland, with the remainder here in the Bay ranging from medium to very thick. The soup was also wonderful, definitely one of my top picks for tonkotsu! 

We also ordered takoyaki and chicken karaage. The takoyaki looked great too, but I didn't have a chance to try it. The karaage was delicious, and everyone fully enjoyed it. We also enjoyed a salad, which I must say is one of the damn prettiest salads I've ever seen. 

If you've ever tried decent ramen in the Bay, you're probably familiar with the long lines and wait times. Don't be intimidated and don't give up! This place is NEW and POPULAR, so of COURSE there's gonna be a wait. If you can't be patient enough to wait to enjoy a decent bowl of ramen, then I pray for your tastebuds.
author: Katie F.

description: If you are going to go to Marufuku get there early. My wife and I went on a Friday and showed up at 5 pm and we're not able to get in for the first seating at 5:30. Fortunately we only had to wait 20 minutes longer, because we were next in line, but it was worth the wait. The ramen was top notch. I gave Marufuku 4 stars, because the waiting staff was friendly, but never brought out the karaage chicken we ordered.
author: Billy T.

description:
We loved the food the first time we went there.
So I went back the other day.
There was already a line at 4:45 for dinner opens at 5.
Customers were seated quickly and they also rushed to take orders quickly.
They gave me a check even before I finished. 
Really???
Good food with Bizarre service! So 3 stars
author: Allison L.

description: Highly recommended! Wonderful service and great food! The foods great but don't good on weekend Super busy I waited over a hour for a table.
author: Jessie D.

description: I'm judging the ramen ~ it's the best in the city.. Great addition to this part of Geary/ Leavenworth corridor.
author: okie r.

description:
Straight fire

But honestly it is very very good ramen. Worth every penny- these guys know what they're doing. The Hakata is dope. The Paitan DX is like a honey glazed chicken of awesomemess. Enjoy
author: Bobby M.

description: This place was definitely worth the hype. Their ramen was delicious. My mom is veg so she ordered the veg ramen which is not on the menu and absolutely loved it.
author: Sweska B.

description: We've traveled up and down Japan and can say that Marufuku is among the best ramen we've had. Anywhere. You'd be hard-pressed to find a better shop anywhere in the Bay Area.
author: Scott D.

description: The ramen here is really good. I definitely recommend trying this place out. The wait was a bit long but it was worth it.
author: Gloria S.

description: Fast and polite service, clean and well-decorated establishment, and delicious ramen!  Can't wait to go when when I visit the city!
author: Monica G.

description: Best ramen I've ever had - go for the pork, it was delicious. Also, be sure to arrive early to reserve a spot at the queue is insane
author: Benjamin E.

description:
I love this place!
I have visited this restaurant twice now and even brought my friends to experience the food, that's how much I enjoy this place.

Thank you Guys very much for your amazing food and your service
author: Frederic G.

description:
Favorite Ramen place ever, hands down, no contest. Small place, so the waitlist can get quite long. But they somehow bring your food out instantly and really get people in and out. They offer a Yelp Reservation feature so you can sign in on the iPad and then walk around Japantown until the system notifies you of your table.

I always get the Chicken Paitan and it is DELICIOUS. Unlike alot of Ramen spots, it includes egg. Very affordable prices too compared to Mensho. Plus I think it's way better than Mensho.

Chicken Karaage is beautifully fried every single time and is a must-get as well! 

Wouldn't change a thing about this place.
author: Aaron M.

description: What's to say except this was the BEST RAMEN I've ever had and I've had plenty of ramen!!!!! The wait was 2 hours the first night, but it was totally worth it. We came back another night and put our name on their iPad's waiting list, then went sightseeing in SF. We could check to see where we were on the wait list by using the YELP app and came back just in time to be seated (about 1.5 hours later). The ramen here is AMAZING!!! The fried chicken is delicious too!! Totally thumbs up! The best meal in SF on that trip!
author: sarah l.

description: I think it was a little overhyped, I felt like the ramen was comparable to other places.
author: Joanna L.

description:
This place was so good. I had to wait in line for about an hour, but once you're seated there is little wait. While you're waiting there is an entire mall to keep you occupied. Best ramen ever. The chefs treat this as an art, and each bowl is made from the soul. Very delicious. The wait line is maintained on a handwritten list, so it's wise to keep an eye on it and stand nearby when you're 3-4 names away from being called. 

This would be a great spot for a date if you both don't mind gorging yourself on really good ramen.
author: Kevin M.

description: Wow! We were looking for a nice place to eat and enjoyed the atmosphere and all the nice people there! Our waitress was really friendly and knowledgeable! I do recommend that you go very early because you do have to place yourself on the waiting list since there is usually a long line. While we waited for about 30 minutes, we visited all the shops around there and got a notification on our phone once our table was ready! We both asked for the most popular ramen bowls and both got a different one. You can't go wrong with anything here!
author: Joshua O.

description:
We came across this place while attending the cherry blossom festival last weekend. It was in the afternoon around 3-4pm and the wait was about 30 minutes for a table of 4. You put your phone number down so you can walk around instead of standing there and waiting for your name to be called which is super efficient! 

It was a special menu with just ramen selections due to the cherry blossom festival so I ordered the hakata tonkotsu. My bf wasn't that hungry because we bought some snacks at the cherry blossom festival and we saw this grilled chicken plate on yelp so he asked for that. It was $6.50 which is pretty worth it I'd say. The chicken was pretty flavorful and it's pretty cool that it comes out on a sizzling plate. My friends ordered the hakata dx (which I learned stands for deluxe). I'm not sure if there is a huge difference in the two, but my friends thought their broth was in between OK-pretty good. I added corn in mines and it really made a great difference! The overall hakata tonkotsu broth is pretty good but not superr amazing. The noodles texture is thin and a little different from other ramen places. I would like to come back and try the chicken paitan next time. You don't usually see chicken ramen on the menu at other places.

The service was pretty good as well. Even during the cherry blossom festival, we were greeted promptly at our table and were asked what we wanted to drink right away. The waiter also came to us a few times to check if we were ready to order. My bad for being indecisive :/ but at least they were very patient! :)
author: Bailey L.

description: I would love to review this place based on eating there. I showed up 40 minutes before closing and they wouldn't serve me. Seriously? They may have the best food ever but I wouldn't know...thanks. I'm glad I walked 40 minutes for nothing
author: Chris N.

description:
Marufuku did not meet the hype.  However, just because it did not meet my personal taste in ramen, doesn't mean it won't meet your tastes just fine.  The service was excellent and food brought out promptly.  

The ramen broth wasn't my favorite but it was hot and tasted perfectly fine but nothing to write home about.  I won't go back due to the line, but good service nonetheless.
author: Laura R.

description: The ramen is good but not as good as what others have said. For the price it worth a try but the queue is just too long. Don't think I will go again.
author: Kai S.

description: Delicious, juicy, rich pork Ramen. Worth the waiting.
author: Jose Antonio C.

description:
The only reason why I'm not giving this place 5 stars is that it said that it opens at 11am but when I got there, I had to wait about 20 minutes before they finally opened their doors.

That being said, it was well worth the wait. The hakata tonkatsu was amazing. The pork broth was flavorful and not too salty. I LOVED that they put a full egg in the ramen! Some ramen places only give you half an egg or even make you have to add it on for a price! I do like my noodles a bit thicker than the ones they had here, but they were still delicious. 

Not too expensive so I would love to come here again!
author: Abby T.

description:
Pleasantly surprised by this place! Came here on a Sunday night after seeing this place just opened and got great reviews. As usual, there was a wait, but because it's ramen, the line went by quickly.

The menu isn't that diverse, but that's okay. All you need is great broth, noodles, and toppings! I got the regular hakata tonkatsu ramen and my boyfriend got the DX (deluxe) version. We were really really surprised by the broth - it's one of the best broths we've had in SF. It's creamy, rich, and so flavorful. Noodles are very very thin (which I happen to like), but I will say that it was slightly stuck to each other so it was hard to eat. 

The difference between the regular and deluxe version is just the toppings and meat. The DX has braised pork in addition to simmered pork (chashu), corn, and seaweed. Everything else is the same as the regular tonkatsu version. The waitress told us something different and we thought the deluxe version had all the toppings they listed as additional (on the right side of the menu)...which would make sense as it's labeled "deluxe". So heads up - if you want all the toppings that they have, you'll have to pay. But good news - they give you a lot. I ordered extra bamboo shoots and they gave me a full little plate. 

We also had the karrage appetizer and it was...okay. I wouldn't recommend this. Just come here for the ramen. Overall, we'd definitely come back. That broth is really really good.
author: Steph S.

description:
Eating ramen has become more or less an experiment now that I live in the bay area. It's hard to find a ramen joint that makes me happy and it's even harder for me to not give up and just be like: "This is the best I'll get up here I guess". However, I came across Marufuku and I really enjoyed it.
It's just delicious. The broth is flavorful and it's made how I like it. They actually give you the extra stuff in the ramen that not everyone does. The ambience is great too. Heck, there's not even a crazy long wait. And I really can't complain about the price compared to other places. My only complaint would be the ginger is no good here, but that's a minor problem.
I love this ramen place and would easily say it's my favorite in the bay area. The service is super friendly and it's located right near Sophie's crepe! Yeah, perfect for a weekend dinner when you just need your ramen fixing.
author: Jenn T.

description: Hands down the best ramen I've ever had in my entire life. The wait wasn't too long. You can check in from your phone if you're close by. I 100% recommend; you will not be disappointed.
author: Bedros B.

description: This is the jaw-dropping best ramen ever. I mean there's not much else to say. Well, except to arrive before they open in order to get a table pretty fast.
author: Jack D.

description:
There was about 9 parties ahead of us, but they turn tables fairly fast.  We were probably seated within 20min.  Yay!!

The bowl can be a bit deceptive in size.  At first I thought the portion was smaller than other ramen places because the mouth of the bowl was not as broad.  But, it's got a deep, wideness at the bottom so portion was plentiful!  Got the Pork deluxe ramen.  I found the mild level of spice to be spicier than I anticipated.  I'll be going for non-spicy next time.  Broth with corn, noodle, sprouts and corn were deeply satisfying.  I preferred the chasu to the braised pork.  Braised pork was.... a little dryer?  tougher? than I would have wanted braised pork to be.  It was not bad, just not as delicious as the Chasu.  Next time, I'll get the regular pork ramen and add corn to it :).

The Chicken karaage was ok.  Felt like there was too much powdery breading on it.  It wasn't bad, but not as divine as some other karaage I've had (such as Okane or Orenchi Beyond).
author: Kathryn C.

description:
Chicken broth ramen! 

Wait time - 40-45 min wait on a Saturday night at 8pm

Ramen - Pork or chicken broth option. Tried both. Really enjoyed the chicken paitan broth and the chicken leg on the side.  They make 15 per night and at 9pm, I was able to still get one。 The ramen comes with the skinny ramen noodles and tons of toppings.  No need to add additional add ons.  I was super full after the meal, the portions are huge! 

Def worth a try and will dine here again - if theres no wait! :)
author: Chanel L.

description:
Came here on a Tuesday night at 7pm and the wait wasn't too long (~10-15mins). Its a fairly small restaurant so it will probably get crowded on the weekends. 

Got the Hakata Tonkotsu (Mild) which comes with pork belly, soft boiled egg, kikurage mushrooms, bean sprouts and green onions. Considering the fact that there isn't a lot of good ramen places in the city, this place is one of the better ones. To me the broth tasted similar to Santouka's but maybe a little less rich. Their noodles come in thin strands which I'm not a big fan of but it was still okay. Pork belly was flavorful unlike some ramen places where the pork belly isn't seasoned. Its also really tender so it kind of melts in your mouth. The percentage of fat to meat is probably 60:40 so if you're not a big fan of pork fat you wouldn't be thrilled. The mild has a little kick to it so if you're not a big fan of spicy food get the non-spicy (and if you need to you could always add chili pepper later on) 

I would definitely come back here for a ramen fix but I would not wait in line for more than an hour for this. 

P.S. They close Mondays so dont make the same mistake I did coming on a Monday.
author: Valerie H.

description:
Ohhh.. okay, this is how it's gonna be, SF. Marufuku is the best ramen I've ever had. (So far. This may change after our upcoming trip to Japan, but I'll come back and edit.) I was in the area hunting for a Mother's Day gift when I decided to give in to my (fairly frequent) craving for ramen. A quick check of Yelp told me that I happened to be near one of the most popular ramen joints in the city, so I headed into the Japan Center. After wandering in circles and getting sidetracked looking at adorable sets for serving sake, I had to ask a UPS guy where it is inside (pro tip: UPS guys know where everything is at.) It was just before noon on a Wednesday so they'd been open for less than 30 minutes, but there was quite a crowd gathered outside. I added my name to the electronic waitlist, a painless process, and then spent half an hour trying not to buy everything at K-Pop Asian beauty store. I finally got my text and zoomed over! 

The whole experience took less time than the wait itself. The instant I sat down a server asked for my order. I picked the Hakata Tonkotsu, spicy, after debating whether I wanted to spend $4 more for the deluxe version (corn + braised instead of simmered pork belly). I experienced instant FOMO for not going for the deluxe as soon as she walked away, but my worry was needless. The ramen that came out literally sixty seconds later was excellent.  Very balanced broth, nice and creamy with a little kick but not so spicy that I couldn't taste all the flavors. The pork belly was melt-in-your-mouth. I couldn't find the egg at first (I know, right? That's how full the bowl was) so by the time I cut into it it was pretty fully cooked. My bad. I still had about 1/4 of my food left when the check appeared at my table, and it was back with my card in like another minute. It's a little disorienting to be so hurried but I guess it's better for everyone else who wants to get in here! I will return to try the other ramen offerings. 

PS: The cucumber water was a really nice touch. It was like being at a ramen spa.
author: Hannah M.

description: Get the pork belly version of this simply savory bowl of ramen prepared al dente, as it should be. The lines seem worse than they are.  Check in the reservation through Yelp.  It's convenient and fast.  You can shop and walk around the Japan Town mall.  Interesting textures when you order the bowl of goodness.  True comfort food.  Love the crunchy and chew to the ramen.  The base soups are rich and wholesome.  Try the karate too.  With the many ramen shops adjacent, you know that they are the best here.  Small size shop with a modern decor.  The service is fast and efficient.  Try all of the ramen styles and side dishes.  Slurp like a local and enjoy the oodles of noodles on your bowls.
author: Anni H.

description:
As long as you realize you will need to wait in line to get a table, it is worth it.  Actually better than that because you put your name and cell # in the restaurant's IPad and you are free to wander around the indoor mall at Japan town.

This was my first ramen noodle experience.  Menu is short so I just ordered their first item listed on the menu. They quickly served brought me a large ceramic bowl with the ramen in a delicious broth.  I liked the thin round noodles, the flavorful pork slices and a medium-boiled egg floating on the bottom. 

I wished I ordered a salad and the pan-fried peppers as both looked amazing.

I will return to try more off the menu.
author: Stephanie G.

description: The takoyaki was freshly made and has like two pieces of octopus in each takoyaki ball. Totally yummy!! Who can say no to takoyaki?? Cause I know I can't!! The Hakata DX tastes delicious with its rich bone broth. My egg was not soft boiled​ and was towards the hard boiled side. Other than that, the ramen was great.
author: Susan L.

description:
Best ramen I have ever had.

Disclaimer I only had ramen from 4 different places so my opinion is probably worthless, right?
I have dragged a bunch of friends there to share with them my enthusiasm for this place.
So far only a forever unimpressed grumpy Brit did not fall in love with this ramen joint.
On a side note, the ramen noddles are not the best though.
author: Jr P.

description:
Marufuku Ramen, located within the West Mall in San Francisco's Japantown, serves some incredibly rich and delicious Hakata style ramen with some of the best chashu I've ever had!

I came here with a friend during the 50th annual cherry blossom festival and had to wait through a long line until getting a table. The restaurant sports a very modern look and feel with some sort of classy coolness to it. The service is very friendly here as well.

Being that I ate here during the cherry blossom festival when they need a quick turnaround to keep up with business, their menu was shortened to not include appetizers and the food came out extremely quickly. I decided to get their Hakata Tonkatsu Ramen with an added side order of kakuni (braised pork belly) to get the best of both worlds. I ordered it on a medium spicy level which I personally would consider a mild so if you like spicy, I'd recommend going for their spicy or ultra spicy levels. The noodles in the ramen are very thin yet resilient as is characteristic of Hakata style ramen. They weren't bad, but I didn't find them to be a highlight of the dish as they were a bit too hard for my liking. However, the broth and meat were straight up amazing!

The broth is sooooooo rich! It is bursting in umami flavors and creaminess. The pork based broth is seeming with collagen which is essential for a good broth. I didn't let any broth go to waste. Even more outstanding than the broth was the meat. The chashu and kakuni were like a dream. The braised pork belly came in nice large chunk with a good amount of meat and fattiness. The meat part of the pork belly was surprisingly firm yet tender, making it easy to bite through for a perfect texture. The chashu really took me for a surprise though. I typically don't expect the chashu in a ramen to be outstanding, but this one really was a notch above the rest. It had a good amount of fattiness to it and the meat simply melted in the mouth. I don't usually find pork to have this sort of quality, and this chashu is the thing that will bring me back for sure!
author: Joshua M.

description: Quite the legitimate ramen place located in a small Japanese mall. Came with a small group of friends only to find that there was a decent wait so we put our names down for a spot. Fortunately, it seemed that most of those ahead of us had already left due to being so discouraged in regards to how long the wait was so we got seated quicker than anticipated. Once I saw the menu, I ordered a Hakata DX which is essentially the maxed out version & added a couple fixings to my liking. Now, as to how the food ended up being? Quite bomb. The ramen itself was pretty darn good. Great broth that was spicy the way I like it & I was indeed surprised that the spicy here was actually quite legitimately spicy (impressed). The simmered pork was most interesting and having it the first time, I was surprised how sweet it came out to be in taste in mouth. Though it was good, I still prefer the braised pork belly pieces over the simmered pork. Noodles were great consistency & went nicely with the broth & other fixings as included & added. All in all, I can see why this place has the hype & popularity that it has and I will say, it is most deserved.
author: Jack M.

description: This pace was so tasty! The staff was super fast and friendly. Will definitely return in the near future.
author: Leslie D.

description: The Hakata DX was ok, but for some reason the broth got really salty near the bottom of the bowl, so I could not finish it unfortunately. We also had the takoyaki appetizer. Not really much octopus in it. I was kind of disappointed. Not really sure if I will come back.
author: Marc E.

description:
We came by on a Sunday evening, and the wait was 30 mins which is not bad for ramen! Plus because it's in a shopping plaza, you can walk around and then come back. I had seen good reviews and wanted to come since they opened. 

Service was quick, prices were fair, and the food was delicious! I was grateful they had a chicken option. I got the chicken paitan for $10.99. For a few more bucks, you can get the chicken paitan dx which comes with extra grilled chicken and toppings. 

I loved pretty much everything about the ramen. The chicken was tender and slightly sweet. The broth was very flavorful (and quite thick). The soft boiled egg was delicious, with liquidy yolks. The noodles were thin and chewy. Also, you can specify spiciness level. Overall, I'd highly recommend this place! I know where I'll go for ramen in the city.
author: Aimee Z.

description:
tl;dr Broth was good. Everything else was meh.

My mom and I ordered the Hataka (Tonkotsu) DX with added menma (bamboo shoots) and the chicken paitan DX (which comes with a sizzling chicken plate). The sizzling chicken plate came out first, and the flavor was great with the skin but the meat itself was a tad dry. Then the two bowls of ramen came out, and the bowls were so full the waitress spilled a bit on my mom's purse. They quickly came by to put a napkin on it but that's all.

I tried the chicken paitan soup first since it was new to me, and I enjoyed the rich chicken-flavored ramen broth. However, the rest of the bowl was a disappointment. The noodles were overcooked - definitely not chewy as ramen noodles should be; they reminded me of Cantonese egg noodles in something like wonton noodle soup. The chicken in the ramen tasted very similar to the chicken on the sizzling plate - sweet and dry. After a while everything just tasted sweet. My mom's hakata ramen was the same way - good soup but everything else was meh. It could be because of the corn added in the DX. 

After we finished, it took them a while to get us the check and even longer to process my card. A request for water refill also took so long we asked a different waitress. And to my surprise the suggested tip amounts on the receipt were based on the total (including tax) instead of the subtotal. I thought restaurants were better than to try to trick people like that these days, but I was wrong. 

For $40 we left full but dissatisfied. I don't think they'll have long lines for long.
author: Andrew L.

description:
I loved this ramen. I came here by myself and ordered the marufuku salad with the plum dressing, which was amazing, and the chicken ramen. The broth was just creamy and salty enough, there were a lot of noodles, and the chicken was sweet and delicious. I ate half of my ramen out of the beautiful bowl at the restaurant, and then took half of it to go for the next day. 

The staff was extremely attentive and helpful, and I will be back here again(with friends). I would recommend coming early at 5, so you don't have to wait. It would be even better if it wasn't in the mall, but it just makes it that much more out of the way!
author: Lauren A.

description:
We waited an hour to get in. But it has sms notification when you are close to being called so it was very convenient that we didn't have to wait in line. Ramen was delicious. I had their tonkotsu ramen. It was very well priced too in my opinion compared to other popular ramen places. 

Becareful with the suggested tips tho... it round up the bill+4% health tax+sales tax and applied the %. For example our bill before tax was $32.29. Suggested 20% tips: $7.26... I notice some sneaky restaurants in SF do that. Just do your own math.
author: Shinta L.

description: Good Ramen places are hard to find.  I have been to place in San Francisco and Las Vegas, places that have been recommended by people from Japan and to me, you should listen to those people when they make certain recommendations.  Well this place, is a place that I highly recommend because I have been to many different Ramen noodle houses.  The quality and service are excellent.  Plus, with a long line out the door, that tells me that this place is popular and pretty well known.
author: Patrick T.

description:
After trying a bunch of different ramen shops at Ramen Fest, I found Marufuku to have the creamiest tonkotsu of them all. The Hakata Tonkotsu (Spicy) was great; I couldn't figure how another $4 for Hakata DX would improve it. The answer: the sweetest, most fall-apart pork I've ever had.

If you're number 30 on the waitlist, don't panic. It looks high, but the hangry people ahead of you tend to give up quickly and leave.

The bad: 
- Even on weekday evenings, there's about an hour wait if you don't get in 20-30 minutes before opening. 
- You can check-in using the tablet up front and they'll call you when the table is ready; both times I've been called to come back more than 20 minutes before the table was actually available.
- Meh alcohol selection if you don't like beer or sake (not abnormal for a ramen place though)

The good:
+ Tonkotsu good, DX better
+ Reasonably priced for SF
+ In a mall with enough shopping and entertainment to survive the 1-2 hour wait if you don't make the opening line
author: Ashley G.

description:
I Came here on a Sunday morning with a group of 5  and made it into the first seating. We finished in about an hour. 

I ordered the chicken which was brought within few minutes.The pieces of chicken were pretty forgettable and ramen would have been better without the chicken. Mild broth was pretty light and easy to drink.Iwas very happy with this meal.I was equally happy with the service
author: Joseph T.

description: I got here around 4:40 on Saturday and got seated shortly after 5pm.  We ordered chicken Paitan TX with huge grilled chicken in the side, the grilled chicken is enough for two to share. Really good value and tasty broth (we ordered low salt version and it was plenty). I feel good after eating, not too salty.  Worthwhile !!
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
Really great Ramen in Japantown for reasonable prices! There were 4 different types of ramen, two pork and two chicken-based, and each could be ordered with a number of different spice levels. There are also various appetizers, and rice bowls to choose from.

Be prepared for very long lines though, especially from 6-8pm. No reservations.
author: Sarah Z.

description:
17.05.07    First of many visit to come

Food ..... 4 to 4 1/2
Service ...... 4 1/2

Pork Ramen - 4 1/2
    Rich pork broth
    Fresh corn
    Chashu was a bit dry for my taste
    Fatty pork ... Lightly marinated
    Whole egg ... Yolk half running ...
             If the yolk was thick as lava ... And
             Needed a little more infused flavor
    


Takoyaki - 4 - 4 1/2 ....... 5 pieces
     Beautiful crust nice and lightly crisp
     Not dough to taste
     A little skimpy on the octopus pieces
           Some  piece was the size of 
                  a plain M&M (only weakness)
author: S.K. Y.

description: The yelp waiting system was a game changer. I was about a 20 min walk away when I requested a table. By the time I arrived, I only had to wait about 20 more minutes. When you go alone and depending on availability, you may end up being seated with a stranger who is also eating alone. It did not change my experience at all. The broth was creamy and delicious. The pork was so deliciously seasoned. I was, however, not a fan of the whole egg business. I'm used to the egg being cut in half. It made it much harder to eat. The karrage/fried chicken came with a great dipping sauce, but the chicken wasn't crispy enough.
author: Kim X.

description: So amazing!! worth the wait..My favorite ramen in town
author: Elsa Mandy G.

description: Get your name on the waiting list by getting in line long before the place opens. Our group of six did so and shopped around for an hour and a half before we got our text that our table was ready. Once we were in, service was fast and attentive...and the food came quick too! We all got the DX except for one, she got the Paitan. The broth was rich, creamy and flavorful--very memorable. The texture of the ramen was al dente...so perfect and right on point, too. The spicy wasn't so spicy but it was still satisfying. My only regret was that I didn't order mine with extra pork belly!! It was so good. Definitely worth a try.
author: B. M. C.

description: Although the wait was nearly 30mins, it was completely worth it. I ordered the hakata tonkatsu, the egg was perfectly tender, the meat was moist, the broth was tasty. This was a great ramen experience for me. I would also recommend to try the wasabi beer here. It actually tasted like wasabi...and strangely like delta water as well.
author: Dale D.

description: Good ramen, just not anything too special. Had the Hakata Dx and added pork chashu. Pork was tasty. Broth on menu is described as "rich" but really could have been far more flavorful. Karrage wasn't greasy and good flavor but a bit dry. I liked the system they use with yelp so you can check where you are in line, however they still made us wait ten minutes after alerting us our table was ready. Service also not great, received our ramen before our drinks (and ordered a bottle of sake right away after being seated!). Waited 90 mins on a Saturday night around 7:30. To be expected for ramen and just glad we didn't have to spend it in a line.
author: Alana C.

description: The Tonkotsu Ramen was pretty good! The DX version was too, but not worth the extra $4. The broth was a tad salty, but not overwhelmingly so. It's busy but the line goes by pretty quickly!
author: Natalie L.

description: One of the best ramen I had so far. If you want to beat the line, get there 30 min before they open. They will rush you and try to kick you out if you take too long, so prepare to eat and leave lol.
author: Easter z.

description:
What i like about this restaurant is thar the menu is very easy. Sometimes simplicity is the key. Our food came out very fast. The pork belly appetizer was delicious. The portion for our ramen was well worth it. Food was good.

The bad thing about this place is the wait. Its a new place so its kind of expected to see a long line. Their was really no hostess. You just sign your name on the wait list and wait to be called. (They dont talk loud either so good luck) its really uncomfortable when youre sitting there trying to enjoy your food amd youve got eyes on you waiting to see where the next person is leaving. 
They need to figure something out. Its poor service. I do hope it gets better by the time i want to dine there again.
author: Fouka M.

description:
It was good but not worth the wait.
Have had better /similar tasting ramen w.o the insane hype and wait at other places around the bay.
author: Iti R.

description: Every single dish I've tried there has so much flavor- it's absolutely mind blowing! The wait is long, but oh so worth it! Every entree's ingredients were perfectly prepared and complimented each dish seamlessly- I've been to Mensho Tokyo, Hiroshi Ramen, Hinodeya Ramen, and a variety of other Ramen restaurants, but this one takes #1 for sheer deliciousness in my book!
author: Ian P.

description: Best ramen I've ever had. The only bad thing is the line. We got there before they opened but had to wait 40 minutes before we got seated.
author: Ashley L.

description: It was ok. I don't know what the hype is all about. I'm not too fond of the type of ramen they serve.
author: J. L.

description:
Oh my ramen! This place is yummy! I was literally going around in circles for practically half an hour trying to find parking (didn't want to park in the garage) but it was all worth it! I signed on the kiosk and was able to check how many people were ahead of me and I received a text when my table was ready. I love that concept. The extra time I had to wait I spent lingering around the shopping center. There are a lot of cute shops that you can browse while waiting. 

After waiting about 20 minutes on a Friday at around 12 noon, I was seated. I already knew what I wanted so I ordered right away. I get the Hakkata ultra spicy. It was perfect! I love the thin noodles and velvety broth which was not too thick or salty. They give you a whole egg with a slightly runny enter that was so creamy and soft. The slices of pork were thin sliced and not overwhelming. I am not into meats so the serving size was just right. If you want more meat I would say to get the DX. Although I ordered the spiciest option, it was not spicy at all. I do however have a high tolerance for spice so it varies for everyone. 

All in all, I would definitely comeback. This ramen joint reminds me of Ippudo in New York. Yummy! This is a must if you're okay with the long wait.
author: Marie N.

description:
Wow. Best ramen I have had in a long time!

The bowl is deceptively large. I was initially a little disappointed by the size of bowl for $15 (I ordered the DX), and boy was I wrong. That bowl is packed with deliciousness, starting with the huge chunk of tender pork. Wow!!!  And, the soft-boiled egg was cooked to perfection. 

Came at 5:45pm on Saturday and just beat the rush.  I wouldn't worry too much about the wait, though.  The customers turnover quickly - food is served quickly and ramen doesn't take long to eat. 

Will be back whenever I am in Japantown!
author: Jack L.

description: Where in town and my sister brought us here to eat elsewhere but was closed. We are here and food was good but service was lacking.
author: Juan S.

description: Great ramen, great service! It really helps that they have yelp wait list! Will absolutely come back!
author: Emily A.

description: One of my favorite ramen spots in the city. Absolutely love their broth. Be prepared for a long wait though!
author: Denise C.

description:
Best ramen I've had in SF!

I moved here from LA a few months ago and since moving here I have eaten at several ramen restaurants trying to find my new spot. Most of the other restaurants I tried we're nowhere near as good as ramen I had in LA, but this place exceeded my expectations! Strong tonkotsu broth, perfectly cooked braised pork belly, and good noodles. 

Only thing is I would arrive atleast 15min before opening to minimize the time spent waiting in line. But overall, this place is incredible!!
author: Nicole K.

description: Long wait but you check in with app abd shop while you wait.  Clean and nice ambience.  Good selection of Ramen.
author: Maria A. L.

description:
Another new Ramen spot in San Francisco, in Japan Town.

 We waited around 25 minutes to be seated, I would suggest staying close as they move fast and the person calling out names isn't very loud.

I wanted to order the Chicken Paitain DX but they were sold out when we first arrived (menu states limited numbers available daily) :(   So ordered up the Hakata DX spicy with extra Chashu on the side for $2.50. 

The noodles were thin and plentiful. Used to the thicker noodles, but this was a nice switch up. The broth was pretty good, decent flavor and just the right amount of spicy, probably order the extra spicy next time though! Compared to my favorite spot (Mensho) the broth carries a bit less flavor and seasoning. Also different was that the egg was mixed into the broth and noodles instead of placed on top like most ramen spots do it; it was almost cooked when I finally remembered to pull it out.  Ordered the Mentaiko Bowl as well which was good. It's so simple, and a good edition to the ramen if you could use some extra food. 

Overall enjoyed the ramen, service was quick and attentive. Be back.
author: John M.

description: I think this is my favorite ramen spot in San Francisco. Even though there is always a wait and it's in a strip mall, the broth is so flavorful and delicious!
author: Ange R.

description:
Really solid ramen-ya. Located upstairs in the Kinokuniya Building of Japantown, this small shop was better than I expected. I arrived around noon and waited 5 minutes for a table (just beating a crowd who arrived after and I imagine had to wait around 15-25 min for a table.  The service was fast and friendly, and the food really good.  I ordered the Chicken Karaage to start and was happy with the fried chicken bits (not too greasy with good flavor, and very large portion).  

A few minutes later the Hakata Tonkatsu ramen arrived.  Served in handmade ceramic bowls, it was served hot and was very flavorful.  The noodles had a great consistency, and the broth not too salty or fatty, but had a rich flavor.  Honestly, I must say it took me by surprise.  The presentation was great, but the first bite left me slightly underwhelmed.  The turnaround was in each successive bite.  There were so many different flavors in the bowl... the charsu pork and the porkbelly, the corn and the seaweed, the perfectly cooked egg.  Each bite was a little different.  

I might order this with extra noodles next time as they were quite good. I ended up pulling apart some of the remaining chicken karaage and putting it in the bowl once the noodles were gone, chasing some shio ramen flavor towards the end of the bowl.  4.5 stars and I will definitely go back.
author: Beau S.

description: Waited 2.5hrs before table was ready...but the wait was worth it. Probably best ramen in SF.
author: Eric A.

description: Loved how easy it was to put your name in and check the wait time thru the app.  The ramen was as good as the ramen I had in Tokyo...Very authentic.  I also enjoyed the fried chicken appetizer.  I'd definitely go back more often if I lived here.
author: Tiffany R.

description: Got the chicken ramen that comes with a grilled chicken as well. The soup and ramen was very well done. The grilled chicken was a bit dry. We also ordered the chicken karagae and that was also quite well done. The soup was rich and flavourful.
author: Stella L.

description: I went to lunch with my husband and daughter and did not know what to expect since it was my first time in Japantown.  I loved the service and the food.  We were attended quickly.  The tea came out fast and everything we ordered was delicious.  Highly recommend this restaurant if you are in the area.
author: Susanne L.

description:
My friends and I came here because all the booths at the cherry blossom festival in Japantown had really long lines and we were starving. My friend put her name down and we were seated within 20 minutes. 

The restaurant is pretty small and looked really new. There were cool seats in the middle with chairs that were lit. But they were all taken already.

My friend and I both got the hakata dx, her bf got the chicken paiton dx, and my bf got the chicken paiton. All of our ramen had the same thin noodle, which I wasn't a huge fan of. I ordered my ramen medium spicy but it wasn't spicy at all. My friend's ramen was supposed to be ultra spicy but it tasted more like medium spicy.

Luckily they have spicy sesame oil and chili powder for people who want their ramen to be spicer.

All of us liked the ramen broth and the meat included. We were pleasantly surprised by the egg hidden at the bottom of the ramen.

Oh and the portions are pretty big. Even though we were starving while waiting for our seats, we still weren't able to finish our food.
author: Julia C.

description:
