Marufuku changed my opinion on ramen. Whatever magic they're working is outstanding. I was blown away by how good it was - the spicy Hakata and Chicken Paitan were both amazing, and if I didn't have to wait so long I'd be going back all the time.

If you're a ramen hater, give Marufuku a try. Ignore all the ramen snobs (i.e: the true haters). They're mostly just in it for the Yelp cred anyway. ;)
author: Harley C.

description: Got there at 6:30 on a Thursday to sign in on their iPad and finally sat down after two hours. I didn't know I could sign in via Yelp.  I was fine with the wait because I got to sit and chat with my girlfriend on a bench inside the plaza.  I really like this system. You get a text when the table is about to be ready.  No need to stand in line like many other crazy popular places.  I had the ramen and tried both broths.  I like the chicken broth better but the chicken was not as tasty as the char siu and the braised pork.  The chicken in my ramen and the chicken served on a griddle were a bit too dry. The pork flavored broth was a bit too salty for me but the meats were so good. Next time, I'll order the basic chicken ramen (without the chicken leg on the side) and paid extra to have the braised pork & char Siu toppings. I really liked the texture of the ramen.  The portion was just right for one person.  I had no leftover. Even though the waitresses worked non-stop, they are super nice and attentive.
author: Tina L.

description: Was definitely expecting more from here. Ramen was good, better than most ramen shops, but I wouldnt say it is comparable to what I have had in Tokyo. If there was no wait, yes, I would come back. But I would definitely not wait an hour for the food here.
author: Kent L.

description: Outstanding ramen. Chicken broth was phenomenal       Had a bunch of sides--fried shishito peppers, salads, fried chicken, and all were excellent.
author: Itai D.

description:
Good ramen but not great.
Quick service once you place your order.

Long wait so I recommend you get in line before they open and try to get the first seating.
If you get there in the middle of the day, don't worry about the long list as a large portion of those names that are called are a no show.

The chicken ramen with the grilled chicken thigh/leg while limited is quite a bit of food so there is no need to order extra noodles like I did.

The price is quite low considering the quality of the food.

I just wish the noodles weren't thin as I prefer the thicker noodles.
author: Evan W.

description:
Medium Spicy Hakata Tonkatsu Ramen
The meat is sweet, broth thin, and noodles thin. Not for me but it was decent and the colors are really vibrant.

The interior design of this place was beautiful. Orange lights and interesting wood designs.
author: Jeanette M.

description: Long line before the store open. Foods are excellent, broth taste really good and the meats melt inside the mouth. Will definitely come back. Service was great!
author: Han-Chyi P.

description:
This place had quite a wait but it was worth it because the soup omg. The soup was one of the best ramen soups I've ever had. It was just rich, creamy and just melt in your mouth type of feel. It was goooooood. 

The cha siu and the egg tho... they had a slightly sweet taste to them and which I was not a fan of as much as I wanted to be. :( (which is why I docked a star.)

But I'd definitely recommend u try this place out if u happen to be in the area, cuz the soup omggggg. Also maybe u will like how they do their pork and egg!!
author: Daisy S.

description:
Careful... the portions here are huge!! I mean it was also pretty good ramen too, but /none/ of my friends could finish their portions. 

We were super lucky to come about 20 minutes before it opened for its evening service, so we managed to get a table. It's within the Japantown plaza so there's plenty of other shops to stop by if you can't handle the wait (the wait outside stayed steady the whole time we were there!). But we really enjoyed the service and the food, so I would totally come here again if I catch it at a good time. :-)
author: Cindy N.

description: Came on a Friday night and had to endure an hour wait but well worth it. Located in the Japan center in Japantown, Marufuku Ramen lives up to the hype. Had the tonkatsu (definitely add some spice for extra flavor). Broth was excellent, ramen was perfectly cooked, ingredients were fresh, the pork melted in your mouth. My only problem personally is with the poached egg. It was whole (not halved) and hidden under my noodles which wasn't  uncovered until later so ended up overcooked. Also got the braised pork side dish which I didn't particularly care for (meat was too rough and chewy, and the flavor profile). But the ramen was definitely top of the list (in the States) and deserves a visit
author: Alan Z.

description: Amazing ramen! Get here early as it lines up quick before opening. Love love the food!
author: Raymond N.

description: Totally worth the wait! FYI - located on the 2nd floor of Japan Center, not listed on the map. They were out of the specials so 3 of us got the standard chicken paitan ramen, 1 got the pork belly. Everyone was very pleased with their order. Wish i would've ordered spicier. I rec the Nigori sake for a lower cost but still delicious beverage. There is a hidden bar next door that worked perfect to have a drink while we waited for an hour. I would defintely go back!!
author: Ali B.

description: I really loved the ramen there at  Ramen There was a great costumer service. The waiters were very attentive on my drink and making sure I had enough. They would also pick up the little trash I made on my table like dirty napkins etc. I would really recommend this place!
author: Andres B.

description: Breathtaking. Not a huge ramen fan but my girlfriend talked me into trying it on our trip to San Francisco to give ramen another chance. Words cannot describe our amazing it is. The pork belly was a huge portion and was tender and sweet, while the broth was simply amazing. On any future trip I take to the Bay Area, I will make this my first stop. I ordered the Hakata DX and also got the Karaage (fried chicken) as an app. Chicken was amazing as well. Everything is made in house and you can taste this in every bite.....literally!
author: Ben N.

description:
We tried so hard to find a good place to get ramen in San Francisco. Coming from LA we have a high bar. Nothing we tried matched up...until Marufuku.

The line is often long but it is totally worth it. Got the normal Tonkotsu DX, the pork belly is great as is the chashu, but it's the broth and the egg that really make this bowl shine.

Yum.
author: Dale E.

description: The ramen here is the best ramen I've had. It definitely beats anything I've ever tried in Boston! The broth was so creamy and delicious - I got the Hakata DX (spicy). It came with all toppings on the list except for the bamboo shoots, which is perfectly fine with me since I personally don't like bamboo shoots. I don't think I can ever look at any ramen back in Boston the same way.
author: Joanne C.

description: This is the best ramen spot in SF.  The Hakata DX is so rich, creamy, and full of umami flavor.  I've tried some apps and chicken but it's I rather save room for the ramen.
author: Kennedy T.

description:
best ramen ever!!

i go there every other month when it's a bit chilli and it's always a great experience
crew is nice food is at a good price and very fast!
author: Anne C.

description: Was in the area with time to kill and found that this is the best ramen place. The fried chicken appetizer (karagge) came out screaming hot and really flavorful--maybe just a tad too salty. I got the chicken broth ramen since I hadn't heard of it before. It was creamy and also a flavor bomb. I would come back, but only if not in a rush.
author: Amy L.

description: IN AND OUT! This place knows how to take your order and bring your food quick. Though disclaimer I've only been here once. They take your order as soon as you sit down and are very good about getting you water which is already a five star for me. The ramen was decent pricing, $12 for regular bowl and $16 for deluxe. The main difference for the deluxe was additional corn, more meat, and some other stuff. I would probably just go for the regular bowl next time. It does come with some brown looking ginger which I didn't like but that's just me (would probably tell them to not add next time). I would definitely recommend to get the "spicy" version because then the broth in my opinion taste too rich. The spiciness helps make you want to eat more without getting overloaded with the richness of the broth. Solid ramen, was full after eating it.
author: Johnny V.

description: We are not Ramen experts but this restaurant had great Ramen. We tried the chicken and the pork and both were delicious. It's a small restaurant with limited seating. We used the Yelp app to get our name on the waiting list & were seated within 10 minutes. We reviewed the short menu, ordered our food, & it arrived within 5 minutes. I had the mildly Spicy pork ramen & it was plenty spicy. I can't imagine what the very spicy version would be like. Great value for the money. Highly recommended.
author: Stuart S.

description: This broth is incomparable. If skinny noodles aren't your thing you won't like it here. Nor if you are vegan/etc. There's always a wait so plan for that! Simply my favorite ramen in SF.
author: Amanda R.

description: definitely worth the 6 hour wait. probably the best ramen I've had my entire life. the broth was perfect!
author: Natalie H.

description:
This place is has earned the title of best ramen
Food 5/5. Service 4/5. Ambiance 5/5. Bang for your buck 4/5.
Waiting is too long and causes deep trouble
author: James M.

description: This place is amazing.  We had the char siu rolls as one of our apps and my friend proclaimed it the best she's ever had.  The chicken karaage was equally impressive.  Ramen was so delicious, although these noodles are different than other places (it reminds me of somen noodles), but I think these are more authentic than at other places.  We can't wait to return!
author: Doreen S.

description: Hands down this was probably the best Hakata Tonkotsu Ramen I have ever had in my life. Ordered a hakata Ramen medium spicy and the serving they gave was very large. The egg was made perfectly (just slightly runny) and the noodles were a perfect (thin and hard). I am an avid fan of Tonkotsu Ramen and I would have to say this is the best I've had
author: Ryan C.

description: This is the purest high level ramen bowl I've ever had, the staff were super, and they have a nihonshu program. Really devine!
author: Ken S.

description: It is tough not giving this place 5 stars. The ramen here is amazing! Sure, there is always a long wait, but it is worth it. I waited about half an hour before getting seated for a party of two at 2pm. The waitresses here are very nice. They really understand the menu and explain it well. I got the Hakata Tonkatsu ramen and I'm pretty sure I could have eaten another bowl. The broth was rich, umami, and full of pork flavor. The noodles are freshly made in house and I think that's pretty rare for restaurants in the U.S. The noodles tasted great in that broth and the consistency was perfectly al dente. The soft boiled egg was food porn as expected. The chashu was the best I've ever had at a ramen place. It had that sweet, salty flavor to it and it was super tender! It just fell apart in your mouth. I definitely want to go back for more, and I'm super happy I got to try it! I got extra noodles and they literally give you another equal portion of noodles on the side for $2. The bowls in my opinion are not that big, but big in flavor and quality. If you are a bigger person, get extra noodles, egg, and pork lol
author: Michael W.

description: The ramen here has got to be some of the most authentic, taste and texture wise as compared to that in Hakata, Japan. I've travelled to Japan numerous times and this takes me back there with every meal without paying for the flight over!
author: JJ T.

description: This is one of the best ramen. Recommend pork belly one, soup is really good. The chicken one is also not bad, it worth to try both.
author: 瀚嵩

description:
Best Ramen I've had in SF!
The Tongkatsu broth was rich, but not heavy. It almost tasted like coconut milk. I ordered the DX which came with corn, an egg, delicious seaweed, pork, etc. 
the delicious noodles had a bite, adding another perfect texture to the complex and layered flavors of the ramen.
It was well worth the wait!
author: Jelly B.

description: Okay dude so we waited like 2 hours!! Almost 2 : ) ... it was worth the wait, we had a baby with us, and when they saw this, they were very accommodating, they instantly gave us a bigger table, the waitress was so nice about it, not everyone in the city is so helpful about having a baby with you! She said, take all the time you need, you waited a while! About 20 minutes later, our infant lost her temper, so we asked to get our food to go and they packed our food up and had our bill in less than 2 minutes... the ramen was worth the wait, we would seriously go back (maybe leave the baby with grandma this time), but we also got their fried chicken over rice and it was perfect!
author: Sonya O.

description: Ordered the hakata tonkatsu and hakata deluxe ramen. First off, the broth was really flavorful. There was a good combination of fattiness and creaminess, and the soft boiled egg added a nice contrast to the flavor of the broth. For someone who thinks hot cheetos are spicy, I highly suggest getting your ramen at a medium spice level. The mild didn't provide enough kick to the flavor of the soup. My favorite part of the ramen was the super tender pork and the seaweed. Other than that, the hour wait is not worth waiting for in my humble opinion. But in Marufukus defense, as a person who hasn't been wowed by ramen ever, it's the best ramen ever had.
author: Jonathan R.

description: I went two times when I was visiting the city and I really love it! The ramen is delightful and they have good beer too. The waitlist its pretty long but its soooo worth the time, the ramen its really flavorful and the noodles do taste as homemade ones (which I understand they are) and its just an awesome experience. You walk out of the restaurant happy and full of delicious ramen jaja
author: Catalina O.

description: The only Ramen in North County I've been more than once. The garlic one is my favorite, sadly they are putting only half an egg and you can have an extra half for extra fee. I would better increase the price and make it more authentic.
author: Stan E.

description: Delicious Ramen !! The best Ramen I've tried. The wait time is really really long. You have to register in their door and then wait for a message/call that let you know that your table is ready.
author: Diana S.

description: Super yummy! Broth is just right. Service was good. We came when they opened on a weekday and made it on the first seating.
author: Neil L.

description:
Came for a Wednesday lunch on a typical summer day - cold, overcast and windy. Marufuku's warming ramen was the perfect antidote. It is a very stylish yet simple and authentic modern Japanese bistro. They really only have 2 Ramen bowls on the menu - chicken or pork. Both can be DX'd but we went with a standard bowl of each. Each come with thin ramen noodles that had the perfect tooth. Each also contained a soft boiled egg that had been poached in broth. It was perfectly cooked with just a hint of gooey yolk inside. The broth can be ordered from mild to super spicy. Medium was had a nice hint of spice without requiring a cold water balm.

At lunch, there were about 12 people ahead of us and that was about a 15 minute wait. 

I'll definitely be back.
author: Scott D.

description: Worth the wait. we had the chicken ramen...two days in a row! Expect a wait (at least for dinner) but it's easily the best ramen I've ever had.
author: Shana G.

description:
best ramen.
but long wait.
but best ramen.

Ramen was seriously the best I've had. Like everything was good. Even the water. They also use those skinny noodles, so it picks up the soup. And you can get $1? noodle refills. Totally worth the wait, which is like an hour I think.

It's also right next to that store with all the cool mechanical pencils and a bookstore with these cool cat hats. Got my cat a shark one. He loves it.
author: Adrian Y.

description:
Best ramen that I've had in the bay area- although I will admit I'm not a connoisseur.
I've had both the chicken and the pork based dishes and they're both excellent.

The only problem is that the lines tend to be a little long.   Weekdays lunch, right before closing seems to be the easiest time to get in with minimum wait.
author: ninpou k.

description: Chicken ramen was yummy....service was excellent, wait is a bit long and not worth it... get there early and avoid lines
author: Brittni D.

description: While the wait was long, I cannot express enough how worth it it was to wait. The ramen was so flavorful, the broth was creamy and so delicious. You could choose the spice level of your ramen which is awesome! I will definitely return again soon! The staff was very pleasant and prompt with taking care of requests. 5 stars!
author: Christina B.

description: I really liked marufuku. There are a ton of hype ramen places in the city now that I haven't tried so I can't claim that this is the best but so far, it's my favorite of a lot of the ramen that I've tried here. Definitely go for the deluxe versions - it's pricey but Japanese usually is expensive in the city so might as well splurge on the deluxe.
author: Sonya G.

description: Second time eating at the place, great ramen, some of the best I've ever had. Only thing is I'm debating if it's still worth the wait.... we went there @11:10, they open @11:30 so waited to get into "the waiting list", then waited some more, got texted "almost ready" @12:24, and we went to meet a staff person, just to wait for another 12 minutes... food is great, but I'm not sure if I received any service, no one came by to check and ask "how's your food", think that's one star off the rating; and the wait, another 1/2 star off the rating, the other 1/2 star is the "printed tip suggestion". I supposed if people feel like they really get good service they'll tip well.
author: David C.

description: With the high amounts of reviews and good rating. I decided to try out this place. On a Saturday, we had a little bit of a wait but it wasn't too bad. I had ordered the pork ramen xl but it was presented in a similar size as regular.  Also, perhaps due to me drinking whiskey before I arrived, I wasn't able to taste the broth's flavor.
author: Jack L.

description: Pretty good ramen place located at Japantown! I've heard so much good reviews from my friends so I had to check it out myself. I thought since today is raining the line would be shorter. However the line was still really long. Parking is easy during the daytime here in Japantown. We got here at 1pm and there were 17 parties ahead of us. I love their waiting system it is super easy. You just enter your name/phone number on their iPad and it tells you how much people are ahead of you. Also notifies you when your table is soon to be ready. Easy to use and saves paper! We decided to just sit on the bench and wait. We ended up waiting for 30 mins only! Wait wasn't bad at all!! While we were waiting we checked out their menu and knew exactly what we wanted. We ordered right away and the noodle came out in 5-10 min. I got the hakata tonkatsu (mild) and my boyfriend got the hakata DX with no spice. The DX was pricier because it have more ingredients. We both loved our ramen! I knocked off one star because their broth was a little too salty. The service here is very fast, friendly, and efficient. I would definitely come back and try their other items. P.s bill total was $31 not including tips.
author: Tina C.

description: I got the Hakata tonkotsu ramen. It wasn't the best ramen I've had, but it also wasn't the worst. My friend got the chicken paitan dx and it came with a whole chicken leg on the side! I thought that was pretty worth it. I would maybe come back just for that. Otherwise, no.
author: Lina C.

description: I ordered the Hakata - Spicy. It's the best ramen that I've had by far. I highly recommend this place and suggest going as the line can get pretty long.
author: Mick S.

description:
The wait here is long, but you can always kill time by walking around in the shopping center. My total wait time on a Saturday at 1pm was 1hr. 
I ordered the Hakata Tonkatsu Ramen with bamboo shoots and corn. This was my first time experiencing thin noodle ramen -I would say I am not a big fan. The broth was creamy, the pork chasu was very flavorful and tasty, the soft boiled egg was perfection! My order came out less than 5 mins of ordering! Impressive. 
I'm glad I gave this place a try, but I'm not sure if I'd return. I've had better ramen.
author: Cindy T.

description: Marufuku serves quality high quality ramen.  From the whole egg to the pork belly to the noodles to the soup every aspect of the Hakata DX was perfect.  Most ramen places serve you only half an egg, but in every ramen served here you get a perfectly cooked egg that pairs up to their soft tender cuts of pork belly. With it you will be served thin homemade chewy noodles submerged in a umami broth that is rich and bold. I couldn't resist drinking almost all of the broth. I would recommend an extra order of noodles with it if you come in with an appetite like I did. The levels of spiciness is accurate where spicy had just the right kick to it so I could taste the flavor of the broth and not just plain fire in my mouth.  I also got the takoyaki which is a must. Like the ramen, fresh and perfectly seasoned takoyaki was a great start to my meal.
author: Harry W.

description:
I came here on a Saturday evening.
Parking: took around 10 min., 3 blocks away 

Wait: estimated 45 min. for party of four; lots of customers!

Setting: upper floor in the corner; small. Dimmed lighting. Seats were comfortable.

Service: prompt, nice, checked up on us at regular intervals.

Food: Had mild spicy Hakata Tonkotsu. A very satisfying ramen! I'm sensitive to spicy so it had just the right amount of kick. Temperature and portion was just right as well. 

Overall: I'd come again for some quality ramen, hopefully when I can beat the crowd.
author: Cameron G.

description:
My god the wait. If you're in the area and willing to wait a couple hours to eat, then by all means give this place a try! Luckily Marufuku is located inside the mall in jtown, so there's plenty to do while you wait. The ramen is delicious, definitely not the best in the area, but still good. All in all the food is great, the tonkotsu broth is more sweet than savory, and the noodles are cooked just right for that balance of soft but chewy. 

I'd probably not go back, only because the wait is so ridiculous, but who knows. If I'm in the area already and have time to kill then I just might.
author: Andrew E.

description: Meh, it's okay at best.  Pricey for serving size.  Salty flavoring as well.  Suggest Suzu downstairs instead.
author: Joel M.

description: Each ingredient has a really distinct flavor that you don't get a lot with other ramen restaurants. The wait in line is a very small price to pay.
author: Anderson V.

description:
Long waits, service was pretty bad. very dirty  and it did not taste very good. 

The Ramen was cold when it got to me and the chicken paitan was pretty small and did not taste good.
author: David B.

description:
Like everyone, I had read the reviews and decided to go here when I was in town. My girlfriend and I each had the Hakata DX. I'm not sure if they were having a funky night or what, but no one had mentioned this in the reviews I saw.... the ramen was so sweet, neither of us could finish it. It genuinely tasted like they had added a bunch of sugar to the broth. 

The other part I wasn't thrilled about was how rushed the meal was. Yes, I know it's a ramen shop, but I am a person who likes to order an appetizer, then order my meal once the appetizer is done. I enjoy things to be coursed out. The waitress came immediately and when I told her we'll need a few minutes, she showed back up in 45 seconds to take our order again. Resistance was futile. We ordered quickly, and the whole meal was over in 20 minutes. 

I suppose the point of my review is... if you don't like sweet ramen, the Hakata DX might not be for you.
author: Taylor C.

description: Randomly stumbled upon this place in Japantown, and saw people waiting in line half an hour before opening, and was instantly curious. My husband and I decided to try them out and we were not disappointed. The Hakata DX ramen is one of the best things I've ever eaten in my life. The Karrage chicken was also incredibly good. Only downside is that I do not live in San Fran and don't know when I'll have another chance to visit again!
author: Lauren D.

description: Came here last night and waited maybe about 1/2 an hour for a table...not too bad.  We get seated and the waitress asked are we ready to order....uuummm, this ain't no Vietnamese restaurant (no offense) as we need to open the menu first.  We ordered the fried squid which was good and I ordered the chicken dx ramen.  I thought the ramen was good as I love the silky ramen. The dx had the grilled chicken on the side which was different and good.  Besides the waitress trying to make us order so quickly, it is a good ramen place to try.
author: James L.

description:
Expect to wait at least 30min to sit down if you're coming here for dinner. Come 7pm the line starts to get long. You have to wait just outside for them to call out your name otherwise you'll probably lose your spot. It would be nice if they had a system where if the table was ready they would send you a text or smth. That way maybe you can hangout in Kinokuniya bookstore for a bit. 

For the service and the food I'd give a 5. Their ramen reminded me of ramens I had in Japan. I've had the braised pork ramen. Not a lot of appetizer options but we tried the takoyaki balls and chicken karaage, which were pretty well made. One of my friends in our group was late so we ordered ahead and he ordered after. But all the ramens came out at the same time which was nice. In terms of the size of the ramen, it was just perfect. The ratio of the soup to the noodles were on point.

Definitely coming back for when I need my real ramen fix.
author: Namuun B.

description: Soup was amzaing. Portion is big... Cant finished. I think the chicken drumsticks ramen is over rated. I will try other one next time.
author: Lori T.

description: It was alright. Not the best but alright. If your hungry make sure you don't go here, you might die before a table is ready for you. Note to staff, please knock it off with the cucumber water.
author: Brian T.

description:
Brand new place in the mall, decided to try it out.  The interior decor is nice and modern, just like Waraku ramen up the street.  

We order the takoyaki and chicken karaage, which were both very delicious and cooked perfectly.

I got the regular Tonkotsu ramen and initial presentation upon getting it was delightful.  Tasting the broth, there was both a lightness and deepness in flavor.  You get your usuals like a soft egg and stuff, so that was fine.  

The noodles were the only disappointing part if I were to be really picky.  Some of you will not even notice because everything else is so good.  The noodles are the straight, thin type.  Doesn't have a whole lot of taste and doesn't really grab the broth when you're eating it.  

I prefer the slightly thicker curly noodles, and since they don't serve them, I have to stay with my current champion of ramen places, Waraku.  They have a richer, thicker broth, al dente noodles, and happen to be less expensive.

This place is definitely worth a try and I may come back if I'm at the book store and don't want to walk 2 blocks.

J
author: John M.

description: This place is a very good ramen spot. Undeniable quality. Great tastes in the chicken and pork ramen selections. The appetizers were great as well. With that being said, it's not the best ramen I've ever had, which is what I expected from the number one rated ramen shop in San Francisco on yelp and Google. Still definitely worth trying though.
author: Joshua S.

description: Very, very delicious lunch!  We ordered Hakata Tonkatsu, one spicy, one extra spicy, a small salad which was very nicely composed and chicken karaage. and we were not disappointed. I was delighted to find a perfect, softly cooked egg in my ramen.  The ramen broth was exceptional. The portions felt large as it was very filling and satisfying.  We arrived at 11:20 pm on a Tuesday and the line was just forming.  Service was fast after being seated.  The staff were very nice, accommodating and well coordinated. We were very pleased and look forward to visiting again soon.  This is a great place to take visiting friends and relatives.
author: E Elsa M.

description: Located in Japan Town's Shopping Center is this little ramen shop. I went to the shop as a solo guest (first time visitor). It's been on my list for a while. The wait from the time I was there when the shop opened (Sunday 5:00PM) until the time I was seated took roughly 45 minutes. I read through the entire menu and it did not take more than 30 seconds, which tells you there aren't that many variety of selection. I ordered the Paitan Deluxe ($15.99) which has a limit of 15 servings per day. Received my food with about 15 minutes of wait after the order was placed. The ramen portion was very small and the broth was average. Inside the ramen bowl lies 2 pieces of thinly sliced chicken breast meat (honestly it just looks like a very sad bowl). The marinated sizzling chicken leg/thigh was very sweet and salty and nothing really special (can be easily made at home with shoyu and sugar). Overall, my feeling of the restaurant was neutral for the food did not leave a strong impression on me. One thing that made me  leave the shop with a little disappointment was that the waiter gave me my bill in the middle of my meal (it feels like they are trying to indirectly ask me to hurry up in finishing my food). Overall, I would not recommend. But if this is just one of the restaurants/ramen places that's on your list (like in my case), it's probably still worth a visit just for the sake of checking it off on your list.
author: Joseph C.

description: My wife and I decided to get ramen for lunch on a whim. This place seemed to have decent ratings and we both enjoyed it thoroughly. For lunch, we got there at 11:15 which allowed us to get seated when the restaurant opened at 11:30. She got the ramen dish with pork while I got the chicken haitan. Both of our dishes were excellent. We also enjoy spicy food and both dishes were spiced to our orders. I would recommend this place if you are looking for great ramen in Japantown.
author: Harnoor T.

description: I had the spicy broth with seared pork belly and it was awesome. The noodles threw me off at first and after I tried them I thought that the texture was great and it soaked up the flavor of the broth right away unlike other places that sometimes seem as if they just throw their noodles precooked not really tasting like the ramen broth that you're eating.
author: Drew K.

description:
Very much worth the wait. We enjoyed the pork belly ramen, served medium spicy. It was very enjoyable, the taste was fully complimented by the level of spice. 

The noodles were perfectly cooked.  And the serving portion was plenty. Go hungry. Enjoy. 

Oh trust the electronic sign in and text notification, like I said ... worth the wait.
author: Rolando R.

description:
Better than the other ramen I have tried in the US (not many). Soup base is a little too salty for me. I asked for spicy, which turned out to be really spicy. I think I should have picked medium. Braised pork belly was better than expected - it's a little sweet.

Takoyaki is lovely - probably the best I've ever tried - and I love it has a little sour hint. 

Matcha drink is a nice too. I like it unsweetened.
author: Stella S.

description: During our trip to Japan Town, we stopped by this restaurant for their famous ramen noodle. Despite that the waiting was long, the ramen is very flavorful with tasty and buttery bone broth. The polk belly bums are delicious. The chicken leg on their limited serving noodle set is top of the league. Everyone at the table is satisfied.
author: Stan L.

description: Super dooper. Excellent ramen.  Wife had chicken and I had pork.  Rich broth, tasty ingredients, just great!  Worth the wait!
author: Ross A.

description: Delicious!! Really really really good. Thin noodles aren't usually my thing but they make it perfect with their broth and style. The price was great for the serving size and quality. I love how the yelp wait list shows you how many tables are ahead of you. Just a great total experience. I'm a happy customer and will definitely be back for more.
author: Doreen T.

description: Yum!  Had the fried squid legs for appetizer and the Hakata Tonkotsu DX ramen.  Both were excellent!  It's almost like being in Japan!  The broth was rich and tasty.  Soft boiled egg was done nicely.  I'll definitely be back for more.
author: Paul K.

description:
Marufuku is the reigning King of Ramen in Japantown.

I am hesitant to add more words to this review because I don't want to dilute the message that Marufuku is the reigning King of Ramen in Japantown but if I had to add just one more word it would be: karaage.
author: Horace A.

description: The medium size is pretty much the same as a large! Super yummy but the line can take up to 2 hours!
author: Ashleey M.

description: Our uber driver recommended this place.  Absolutely worth the wait.  Arrive a little before they open so you can get in line and get your name on the waiting list.  We got there right at 5pm and there were 28 seatings ahead of us which equates to a 90 minute wait.  This place was packed all night!  We had the braised pork belly ramen. Delicious.
author: Teresa G.

description: Got here on a Saturday morning before opening and there was already a line. We didn't make it in to the first seating so had to wait a little over an hour to be seated. There is an automated system to put your name in and you get a text when the table is ready. Not super warm but efficient. Not too much to offer on the vegetarian front so I had a salad. It was a big salad but nothing I would come back and wait in line for. The  rest of our party had the tonkatsu ramen and the portions were good. We also got some appetizers including edamame, fried calamari (tentacles), and takoyaki. The water we got in our glasses tasted fishy and was a little cloudy from the lemon. Gross and made me think the dishes/glasses weren't clean. All in all we now can say we ate here. It is not for me since vegetarian options are very very limited but the rest of my group did say it was good but not sure they would come back if the wait is so long.
author: Sinee H.

description: Best Ramen I've ever had. Quickly turn tables, so don't let the line discourage you. Staff is very friendly and professional.
author: James D.

description:
Oh my God. This is it! I was so excited to finally find an authentic ramen in SF that transports me back to my food adventures in Japan. This was the first hakata-style I've had in the Bay Area, and it was so on point that even Shin-sen-gumi in LA can't compare. The broth was super rich and the flavor was just right. I love the hint of sweetness. The sliced pork belly was great. If I have to pick on something, I wish the soft boiled egg was runnier. Thank you Marufuku! 

Pro tip: its not on the menu but you can choose the hardness of your noodles. Go Hard!
author: Wayne T.

description: I was recommended this place from a friend. Make sure to get there early because there is a line often. I ordered the usual: Hakata Tonkotsu. I think this dish is overrated especially for the taste. I don't really like the taste but the service was great. The place had a great vibe to it. Would recommend trying something else if you like more tasty foods.
author: Dominique C.

description: Hands down, the best Ramen I've eaten outside of Japan, and one of the best meals I've had in the City in 25 years. The Hakata DX is to die for. The broth has deep, complex flavors. Love the salad with the plum dressing. Awesome!
author: Jonathan W.

description: One of the better bowls of Ramen I've ever had. Great flavors. Long wait times so be prepared to wait. Put your name in and go for a walk around the mall.
author: Carla C.

description: What a delicious new ramen spot!  Mmmmm.  The bowls of gorgeous rich broth. Lots of add ins too. No looking for my pieces of pork belly (Chashu).  No wondering where my smoked egg is (Ajitsuke Tamago).  And the noodles...mmmmm.  I like thin ramen.  I think these noodles are made with egg!  The vibe is nice too.  Friendly wait staff who are hustling!  The impromptu plan to get ramen turned into almost an hour plus wait, but it was worth it.  My bowl came out quickly, hot, perfectly salty, and just freaking yummy, okay?  So go.  Run.  Don't walk.  Well, be careful running...watch for traffic...it is Japantown after all.  Just promise me you go here for your soupy noodle delight!  Leave a nice tip too...these kids work hard for the money.
author: Darby W.

description: Delicious ramen. Rich and complex broth made with pork, delicious house made noodles, excellent combination of flavors from mix of vegetables and ginger in the pork belly version. I opted for mild heat for my first visit but will add more spice on my next visit. Satisfying and comforting, enjoyed with beer. The only drawback is the wait. Seating is limited. I was in a party of 5 and we waited an hour for seating on a Wednesday night.
author: Sue D.

description: Lives up to the hype!! Every time I'm in Japantown, this place always has a huge line and ridiculous wait times but it's all for a good reason. I was finally able to eat here with my sister while we were in the area. We came around 7pm, put down our name on the iPad and then did some window shopping in the area. You can check your status and how far you are in the line via Yelp. There were 50 parties ahead of us and I was shocked! However, time passed by pretty quickly and we ended up waiting 1 and 1/2 hours. I ordered the Tonkotsu ramen with medium spicy and my sister got the Chicken Paitan mild. We managed to score one of the tables in the middle and the seating and ambiance were so cute and aesthetic!! The broth of my Tonkotsu ramen was sooo creamy and thick, I LOVED IT. Definitely cherished those pork chashu slices and the soft boiled egg. Noodles were cooked to perfection. Everything was so flavorful, my mouth is watering just writing this review. Hopefully I'll be back soon (maybe when the wait is shorter).
author: Isabelle N.

description:
Came on a Thursday night at 7 and was surprised by a long line. We waited almost 40 minutes before we were seated. Once seated the lady took our order very quickly and the food was out in less than 10 minutes. 
I ordered the hakata tonkotsu with medium spiciness and edamame. The ramen was delicious, one of the best I've had. The broth was rich without being too fatty and the medium spice was the perfect amount without being overpowering. It came with a good amount of pork, more than I'm used to. The edamame was also delicious. 
Highly recommend this restaurant to satisfy any ramen cravings. The service and food are great and the restaurant has nice Japanese vibes.
author: Melissa W.

description: Good ramen, excellent service and lovely atmosphere.
author: Sean K.

description: Great portions and at good prices. The food was great! My first time there and I will defiantly go back!
author: Torie F.

description: Always saw the line for this place and I finally got to try it last week! Me and my family came here for their ramen and idk it wasn't as expected. Don't get me wrong it was good ramen butt I guess I'm not a ramen person. Def try it or tho one of the more better places to eat in japan town but don't get your hopes up just cause u see a long line and think it'll be super good
author: Chiu H.

description: Best ramen I've had.. and I'm from SD! Definitely on my list of places to visit when I come back to the baaaay!
author: Trisha D.

description: My hubby and I waited about 40 mins on Sunday 2pm.  It was worth waiting!  Tonkotsu ramen was amazing!  The broth was similar to Korean Shul Lung Tang and very rich!  Love this place!
author: EunJoo C.

description: Best Ramen! So creamy and full of flavor. No vegetarian option unfortunately, but you cannot get this flavor without the meat broth. If your eyes think you can eat more than your tummy, order extra noodles, so you can take leftover broth home and have extra ramen for next day. By far best ramen I have been to in NorCal!
author: Niki S.

description: the food was good, nothing amazing that I must go back to, but Id go back if someone else wanted to. the portions were small, I think most men who eats well (my husband) would be hungry with just a ramen order. Id suggest them to upgrade sizes. You can add extra noodles to your order but the bowl is so small that i don't think it would fit without taking most of the broth out. Overall it was good. the place is small, service is good. their check in service is great with an online system that you check in at the door by putting your name and cellphone then they alert you with a text and phone call that your table is almost ready.
author: J. S.

description: This was definitely a great spot for ramen. We have 30 people ahead of us so it took quite a while to get seated. Once inside though, food came quickly. I ordered the Hakata DX without corn ultra spicy. Now I would say I can eat pretty spicy but this definitely wouldn't register as "spicy" to me. Loved the broth too, flavorful without being super salty. Wish the noodles were a little bouncier but that is more personal preference. Pork was also just eh. Would go back just to taste that broth though.
author: Susan G.

description: After spending the day exploring the city, my friend took me to Marufuku Ramen, her favorite ramen place in the city. Luckily, since we arrived on the earlier side for dinner around 5:30pm, we were seated very quickly. I ordered a mildly spicy Hakata Tonkotsu, which was not spicy at all (I'll have to order it more spicy next time) but incredibly flavorful and delicious. Paired with a Sapporo, the dinner overall tasted balanced and was a wonderful introduction to ramen in SF.
author: Andrew T.

description: We were passing by Japantown and we quickly realized that the food there was generally mediocre (which was quite surprising to me). On a quick Yelp search this place turned out to be one of the few places that were actually any good, so we went without hesitation. It was 12.30 pm on Thursday and we waited around 30 minutes. We had Hakata DXs and a small chasu bowl and a small salad (yes, we were starving). They were all quite good! I wouldn't put them on the same level as the legendary Megaramen at Totto NYC, but the style of the ramen was interesting.
author: Karl S.

description: My boyfriend hyped this place up for me. The first time we came here it was almost 2 hours before closing on a Saturday, and there were 57 parties ahead of us. I was not willing to wait that long (already hangry) considering it would probably be closed by the time it reached our turn. Anyways, we came back on a Tuesday afternoon and there were only a few parties ahead of us. The wait was probably 15-20 minutes. When it was our turn, a waitress guided us to a table and I noticed the interior was very small, but homey. We got comfortable and browsed the menu. I ordered the regular ramen. If I remember correctly, I think it was the first item listed on the ramen page. I just added corn for an extra dollar or so, and asked for my ramen to be spicy. I also added an iced green tea. My boyfriend ordered the exact same thing as me. The food came out pretty fast and the broth was bomb. The only thing I did not like about my ramen was the noodles were thin and straight. I prefer the thick noodles. I like this place more than Yamadaya, which is right across the street and is more expensive. Overall, I had a good time here and the food was enjoyable.
author: Tina H.

description: I don't eat Pork, so I am usually left out of group ramen outings. The chicken ramen with chicken based broth was to die for. This place does get crowded, but the food comes out so quickly, you won't be hungry for long.
author: Tyla B.

description: As RAMEN is a favorite snack and meal, this place was fantastic! Al dented noodles and really tasty broth. I haven't ordered everything on the menu but plan on it.
author: Kris I.

description: Easily my favorite ramen in San Francisco. The waiting process is insane (last few times have been 90-120 minute waits) but it's worth it every time.
author: Andy C.

description: My friend took me here as a pre bday lunch because she knows how much I love anything Japanese. When we first got there, we had to put our names on a clipboard at the door to reserve our spot. The wait was moderate for lunch time, about 30 mins.. Once our turn came, we were seated. My friend and I had the Chicken Karrage, Takoyaki, Hakata Tonkotsu Ramen, and Hakata Dx Ramen. Everything was great. I can't even to describe how good the food was. My only complaint is that there wasn't enough noodles for me in the ramen.. Had a lot of broth left. Could have gotten a second helping of noodles but was too full at that point..lol.. Would highly recommend this point.. However, be prepared to wait. This place is small..
author: CJ D.

description:
They have a paper for you to sign in to get your name called, but they don't look at it at all. We got there at 5:28 and wrote our names down, but they just take whoever is at the door first. Why have a list if you don't plan on using it? If all the names prior to being open doesn't count, if you see people write their names down, shouldn't you tell them? Employees watch customers go in and out and said nothing.

The noodles are just meh. The soup is alright. All in all, I wouldn't come back.
author: Stacy C.

description:
Im a ramen fanatic, and am pretty skeptical of any ramen in the states when compared to Japan. I've seen the lines at marafuku multiple times and never wanted to give into the hype and wait. But last week I decided to give it a try, and even though it was a one hour wait at 8:15pm (seated at 9:15pm), it was definitely worth it.

I had the tonkotsu and my girlfriend the dx. The pork belly in the dx was good but too much, I like my ramen less cluttered with toppings and more focused on the soup and noodles. The portions are reasonable and the broth incredible, lots of depth without being overly salty. 

The only two things I would change are that the pork was a little salty, and the noodles a little softer than I prefer. The geso fry and takoyaki are also recommended. 

The interior was well, as others have pointed out, is simple but creates a nice ambiance.


Solid 5 star ramen in the Bay Area. Go early, put your name down and walk around, and the wait will be worth it.
author: Mack S.

description:
Well, I went into this intending to write a 3-star review but when I hovered over the stars, Yelp indicated that 2 stars equates to "Meh. I've experienced better." while 3 stars equates to "A-OK". Well, "Meh I've experienced better" pretty much perfectly captures our experience.

Chicken karaage - good enough, nothing special.

Hakata DX ramen - somewhat dry kakuni pork, entirely underseasoned tonkotsu broth, very thin noodles without bite (not alkaline noodles), and just overall lacking a depth of flavor. The varying spice levels are differentiated by the amount of ichimi powder they add (ichimi is literally just cayenne pepper) AKA it's not some dank spicy paste made with love (like roasted garlic, sesame oil, and pickled green onions) but rather merely a spoonful of cayenne pepper.

Anyways totally not a bad place just would never wait an hour again for it. In fact, our party stands in agreement that even if there were no wait at all, this wouldn't be our first choice.
author: Ryan J.

description: The noodles and karaage were so satisfying. Be ready to wait for a while if you go at normal lunch/dinner hours - always a good sign.
author: Pat N.

description:
I would highly recommend you NOT get the Hakata DX, unless money is not a concern for you.

My friend got the regular Hakata and I got the DX, so we had a pretty good comparison. The only difference we noticed was a single small piece of braised pork in the DX alongside the simmered pork. (The regular only has simmered pork. It's also not supposed to have corn, but I think it had some?) Everything was delicious, but I couldn't understand how one little piece of pork and some corn justifies a 36% price difference. If I had to justify it, I guess the braised pork takes more ingredient and time to make, but the size/quantity really throws you off. Of course, I could just be an amateur revealing the size of my wallet among a sea of SF foodies.

The broths were not too salty, but rich and creamy. The egg was pretty good with a soft yolk. I liked the uniquely Hakata style thin noodles. The DX's braised pork was tender and flavorful, while the simmered pork was kind of typical (thin, pallid). Overall, tasty.

Karaage was good. I believe karaage is supposed to have a rather light coating, but I would've liked a little more crisp on this one.

Takoyaki was super soft and tasted good, but each ball only had one small piece of octopus inside. Not sure if this is normal or not.

Overall this is more like a 3.5 rating, but I enjoyed the food and service was nice, so I rounded up.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Yum. Went here for dinner this past Thursday, and had the Hakata Tonkotsu ramen. Thank god for Yelp's hot and new restaurants push notifications. They help me keep up with all these new places that pop up around me. 

Arrived here maybe around 7pm or so, and they had a signup sheet. There were only two other parties ahead of me on the list, and the place seemed pretty good about getting people in and out throughout the time I was there. My party and I only waited for about 10 minutes to be seated. I'm not sure if that's normally the case, or if it was because they're open/closed sign was accidentally on closed. :P

To the food though, the Hakata Tonkotsu ramen was really good. I got it in medium spiciness level. Honestly, to say it wasn't the greatest isn't fair because the city is filled with so many really good ramen places. I add this place among a handful of other places I really like, and they're all great. The broth and pork were savory. They don't have traditional ramen noodles, but some type of thinner noodles. The spicy level I think is also on the spicier side, so if you get medium, it tastes more like spicy, and spicy tastes more like extra spicy, etc. All in all, I'm happy with this place.
author: Stacey L.

description: Got the Hakata Tonkotsu with a kaidama.  The ramen wasn't bad, but not up to par of Mensho. Regardless the broth had a good flavor, and kaidama left us with noodles that were stuck together.  The service was good despite the seats that were awkward to get in and out of.
author: Tiffany C.

description: Came on a weekday evening and there was still a short line (worse on weekends!), waited about 15 minutes. The ramen soup base tasted great! (I personally prefer the tonkotsu broth which is slightly more rich compared to the tori paitan broth). We were very curious about the wasabi beer so we tried it, but neither of us liked it :X Overall, we liked the ramen and would come back.
author: Claire S.

description:
my friend's been wanting to try this place, so we decided to come here last night.  out of 3 of us, i got here first around 715 and put our names down, and there were 39 parties in front of us.  omg...at least they text you when they're ready for you, so i just walked around the bookstore.  

my friend ended up going down the street to another ramen shop, which had a shorter line, so we decided to go there...however, all of a sudden we moved up a ton in the marufuku line, and the restaurant texted me, so we ran back.  we then got seated and ordered, and our food came out immediately.  i got the chicken paitan w/ added bamboo, and it was GOOD.  i usually get spicy anything, but yesterday i just wanted plainer flavors, so the mild was perfect.  the chicken paitan comes w/ 2 pieces of chicken breast, which was nice and lean.  

by the time we finished eating, there was no wait.  we had waited about 1.5 hours by the time we sat down, yet our actual eating time was probably 30 min.  food was great, but i would suggest coming really late if you want to avoid waiting.
author: Helen T.

description: It was definitely work the hour long wait on a Sunday night! The menu was short and sweet, the ramen was super delicious. Can't wait to go again!
author: Shylene L.

description:
Highly recommend. The portion are smaller than what I'm used to but the soup is worth the money. 

Their soup is the highlight of the place. We tried both their chicken and pork ramen. Their chicken ramen is good but does not stand a chance against their pork ramen. Their pork ramen is awesome. It's smooth but pack enough punch to make you dream about it later. Grilled chicken was great. Fried squid legs were crispy with enough seasoning to make it memorable. 

There will be a wait unless you come at an off hour. It is worth the wait.
author: Sompatsorn K.

description: One of the best ramen I had! Chicken karaage is delicious as well (crispy on the outside, soo juicy inside). The wait is long but it's worth it.
author: Sylwia K.

description: I have tried ippudo and couple of other hakata style ramen. And Marufuku is a favorite! Glad to find this gem that serves hearty bowl , thick broth and spicy enough for my palate. The chicken paitan is worth trying but I always go back to hakata (pork broth is always better) . N the pork belly side dish is not to be missed.
author: Hester D.

description: I am not a big fan of ramen, but this place made me become one! There is a wait list, yes! But so worth it. Plus, you don't have to stay in line, you'll receive a text message when they are ready for you. Highly recommend!
author: Jane A.

description:
It's so far one of the best Ramen I had in the US and the best Ramen I had in San Francisco. The chicken wing (karaage) and octopus ball (takoyaki) are tasty too.

Sometimes the soup is too salty. That's the only down side.
author: Ryan C.

description: I have tried so many ramen and this place is a bit saltier than my preference. Other than that, everything else was perfect. Very nice presentation for the food. Service was fast and friendly. Just make sure to put your name down when you get here because there is always a line in front.
author: Tess N.

description: Delicious come here every time for ramen! It's usually a 30-45 min wait but the wait is definitely worth it.
author: April C.

description:
This place is amazing. I've been coming here since I was 16. Place has been constantly updated. Might even changed names not sure because j never remember the name but I do remember that it's in Japan town mall in the corner upstairs lol.

FOOD:First off, I've never had a bad experience with the taste here. Everything has always been delicious. The funny part is when the bowl comes out, you're sitting there thinking.. that's it? But I will assure it that the bowl is definitely enough. It is small in diameter but deep and filled with goodies. I hate when I go to a ramen shops and you have to add all the extra, which here, for the most part you do not. Though if you do feel the need, the extras are very well priced. The meat is always so flavorful and tender, almost melt in your mouth. That is always a deal breaker for me and they have never disappointed

SERVICE: I enjoy the service here. Servers are quick and food comes out asap. The only part I ever have problems with is having my bowl removed before I am done with it. I am the type of person to eat the food and drink the soup. Some of the servers will ask if you are done but there are a select few who will just take your bowl if your taking a break but look to be done. Almost gave 4 stars because of the but I just love the food.

PLACE: This place is very well kept. Like I said before they update the restaurant and it is a great atmosphere. You can see a range of business people to high school kids.

TIP: just like most really good ramen shops, this place is slightly small so expect a wait. Like really expect a wait. The greatest part is if they say about 30 + minutes you can always go and walk around the shopping mall and buy a couple things. It is worth the wait though so walk. Also If they call your name and you do not instantly appear they will put a check or star next to it. This is to show that you have been passed but are still on the list so when the next available table frees up they will sit you down. 

If you have not already tried the place out, I recommend you should.
author: Jackie B.

description: Best Ramen I've ever had. Very tasty and rich broth. Wait can be long so get there before they open to start waiting in line. Highly recommended!
author: Selena S.

description: Coming here made me feel like I was eating amazing ramen in Japan! Don't sleep on it!
author: Lionel B.

description: We tried this ramen place based off the reviews. Generally seems like a long line but since we were there early, we decided to stand in line just before they opened. I had the basic ramen with chicken which was tasty, but I left still hungry. I wished the portions were a tad larger. My husband ordered the karaage and rice as an appetizer before his ramen and was full. The staff is nice and the place is clean.
author: Erin M.

description: Long wait - be prepared. It was worth it, though! Delicious and savory! Put your name on the waiting list and then browse the stores in the mall to kill time.
author: Michelle C.

description: Busy lunchtime spot, but they are quick to bring out your food. I did the regular ramen and liked it. You can pick your spice level--I'm usually a medium/hot girl, but didnt know what to expect so I got mild. Definitely had more of a punch than I thought mild would have. The bowls are the perfect size, not too much or too little!
author: Angela H.

description: Great udon noodles!! Was amazing! Line can be long but it's worth the wait. More cafeteria style than a restaurant. Very casual and family friendly.
author: Julie K.

description: We waited almost 2 hours to get in. Their wait system was stupid ridiculous. You get in a queue that links to your Yelp and shows you how many parties are ahead of you. I was at the door and showed the hostess that it says that I have 0 parties ahead of me, so why were other people seated before us? I was hangry. She said I have to wait for a text and a call. So, she called 3 more parties and when they didn't show, she allowed us in. They prioritize 4 seat tables for bigger parties and will push the parties of 2 like us back even though we waited longer. Ridiculous! It shouldn't matter how big our parties are. I only got the text and call when I was seated. Food was good but not good enough for me to wait 2 hours again.
author: Jade H.

description: The ramen here is extremely delicious! Best food I've had in San Francisco! Great food and even better people! Thumbs Up for Marufuku Ramen!
author: Brendan C.

description:
Excellent ramen. The only downside is the wait and some may prefer the thicker Noodle as opposed o the thin style. 

Karage chicken was also really nice but must get the grilled chicken paitan ramen.
author: Brad B.

description: I'm actually not a huge fan of ramen but this place has the best ramen broth & noodles! I highly recommend it! I got the Chicken Paitan Deluxe, which comes with a side of grilled chicken leg on a sizzling pan, so tender and flavorful! They serve limited amounts daily so make sure you go early! There is also always a long wait of at least one hour. My tip is to go right before they open for either lunch or dinner so you're in front of the line. Yes, people are already lining up!!! But it's worth the wait!
author: Debo R.

description: Marufuku Ramen has amazing, creamy, and salty ramen. The service is really fast, and the ramen comes out good.
author: Alison H.

description:
When we were seated, we ordered right away (we waited an hour before opening, we were pretty hungry). We ordered the karaage rice bowl, braised pork rice bowl, hakata DX ramen, chicken paitan DX ramen, and takoyaki. We were the first to order so we were surprised when a table was delivered takoyaki before us. The waitress realized that she had given it to the wrong table. This happened again with the chicken ramen. The mixup is understandable I guess, it was really busy.

The food was delicious. I'm not crazy about ramen so I wouldn't rave about it, it was good. I would definitely come back for the rice bowls; really filling for a really low price. 

Oh yeah, my little sister FOUND A WIRE IN HER RAMEN. One of those wires they use to wrap up bags of bread. Yeah, shocked, we asked where she found it and she replied with, "In my mouth." We called a waitress right away and she was very apologetic and offered to replace the ramen. We were already so full so we declined the offer. They removed it from the bill.

So why the four stars after that experience? The delicious food and kind staff. Mishaps happen, it's how you handle it. Of course, if my sister had swallowed the wire, it would be a whole different story.
author: Chantelle N.

description: I've eaten at many a ramen place in my life, and Marufuku ranks among my top/favorite ramen places. Broth was rich and creamy, chashu pork was spot on, egg was perfect soft boiled seasoned... perfect bowl of ramen. Only downside.... waited 2 hrs for a table. I was #65 on the list when I arrived. Be prepared to wait. I don't know if any food is worth waiting 2 hrs for, but Marufuku is worth it at least once!
author: Amanda W.

description:
It's no Ramen Tatsuya (Austin, TX), but definitely some of the best ramen I've had in North America. Overall I'd give it a solid 8.5/10. Broth is rich and well-crafted (9/10) and the ramen noodles are fresh and thin, with just the right firmness (9/10). Pork belly is think and flavorful (9/10) and the ajitama egg was 8/10. My only complaints are that there was a bit "flotsom" (i.e,. corn and green onion bits) and the presentation was a tad too salty for my taste (and I like salt). The excess corn also may have made the soup a bit too sweet. Instead of excess corn and onion, I'd like to have seen some other more substantive bits like woodear mushroom or something. 

Still, very good. It's well worth the wait and price. Will come back soon.
author: Chetter H.

description: Great service with a quaint atmosphere. It's the best ramen that my wife and I have ever had, and it was well worth the wait. The waiting list was long, but it moved quickly. Portions are large and well priced. This is Heaven in a bowl.
author: Ron B.

description: Starving one night during a line of meeting in the city, stopped by and tasted the ramen with chicken katsu..not bad at all! they were busy which means they are good right? hoping not to wait for so long next time when hungry well not much they can do here.  recommended this place
author: Jason C.

description:
The ramen was really good!  Broth: I like the richness of the broth.  It was creamier and the pork flavor was on point.  I like how I could taste the ginger when making the broth.  It definitely lightens the pork flavor.  Noodles: the noodles were nice and thin.  It works well with the broth where it doesn't soak up too much pork flavor and we can taste the freshness of the noodle.  Pork: I like the variety of the pork belly.  I had charshu pork belly and regular pork belly (not soaked in soy sauce marinade).  I really like the regular one.  It was soft and not too salty.  I think the charshu pork belly was cooked a little too long.
Toppings: the topping were great.  I felt as though they added to the dish.

I highly recommend the takoyaki!  It is sweet, savory and has the right amount of salty.  On top of that I also like the bonito flakes.  MUST ORDER!

Other sides I have tried: rice bowl (don't remember the name, but it had cod roe and seaweed) and fried ika.  These dishes were pretty good too.  They aren't that different from other places.

Service was great and quick, but I felt that they could have asked if I wanted dessert.  Who doesn't want dessert after a good meal? (That's just me though)

Overall this is an amazing place to have Ramen!  
It's a whole in the wall, but not really because it's so good and it's on yelp (damn it) so everyone knows about it (damn it).
author: Logan G.

description: Loved this joint! Was lucky on timing and didn't wait long. Unfortunately, they didn't bring my 'special' chicken side that has limited quantity on the menu even though it was available.  It was my first time, so I didn't know what was served with my plate until further research on yelp.  I had a feeling something was missing... Will have to go back and make sure my order is complete next time.  Besides that, great, fast, friendly service and good food at a decent value for this city.
author: Giovanna B.

description: Best ramen ever. Nothing to complain. Good service. Wonderful ramen with broth and large portion of meat. Cut off time is half an hour before store closes. Need to be here before 1:30 to get a number.
author: Vivian Y.

description:
A great new ramen spot in the Bay! I'm a big fan of the hakata ramen style (thin, non-curly, solid noodles). Both my girlfriend and I got the Hakata Tonkotsu. At $10.99 I thought it was very worth it since a lot of other ramen places charge more nowadays. I was impressed with the tasty, yet non-overbearing flavor of the broth. The simmered pork also had a lot of flavor with a good amount of pieces in the ramen. The egg was your delicious runny yolk style. I got extra noodles for $2.

The service was also friendly and efficient. Luckily my girlfriend and I came in a bit after 5PM for dinner, because the list of people waiting filled up quickly soon after. It's nice that there's plenty of shops to explore if you know you've got some time before your name is called. Be sure to check where you are on the list though, because there's no automated waiting system. The waiter/waitress just calls your name out.

The chicken karage was also crunchy and paired really well the squeeze of lime and side of mustard mayo. 

New ramen spot that's closer than Ramen Parlor for me and my girlfriend. Would recommend giving Marafuku Ramen a shot!
author: Jeff L.

description: The real-deal.  Some of the best ramen I've had stateside right along some of the great spots in NYC and L.A.
author: Rex I.

description: The wait time can get pretty long but my party of 3 only waited about 30 minutes. I had the tonkotsu ramen which was excellent. I saw a lot of people had ordered the chicken paitan which also looked very good. Looking forward to try that next time I go. It's one of the better ramen options out of all the many others in Japantown but the wait can be very long if you go during peak dinner times.
author: Michael L.

description: I came here last Tuesday for a late dinner. The Hakata DX is my favorite as it is one of the richest Tonkotsu styles I have tried in San Francisco. The soup came almost immediately after we ordered and the egg was on point. I highly recommend coming for a late night dinner if you want to avoid the line! :) Great ramen, great service, and great atmosphere!
author: Titanium M.

description: so goooooood! Best ramen I've ever had. But come early because the wait list is always insane. Expect to wait between 30-90 minutes for a table. Worth it though!
author: Neva H.

description: I went there  with my family and we all enjoyed the dinner a lot. The place has a chill, relaxed atmosphere, the staff was very friendly and helpful. Price-wise, it wasn't cheap, but not to expensive  as well. Perfect spot for a nice family dinner.
author: Siarhei F.

description:
Parked at the garage near Benihana. Walked into the Japantown mall and went up stairs to the 2nd floor. There was a line out the door on this Friday lunch our. 1:30ish. We put are name on the list. We waited about 20 min. to get seated. We ordered two soups to share and the octopus balls. The two soups were: chicken paitan DX (the DX stands for a deep fried chicken) and the  hakata soup. Both spicy. Yum. Met a very nice korean man that gave us a few tips on what to order. We ordered one beer. Our bill was $50 including tip. 
1app
2entrees
1beer

Both of us left full and content.
author: Jackie H.

description: Wow, great tonkotsu ramen!  Pork belly melts in your mouth.  We also had the paitan chicken, which was a really impressive display and tasty.  We got in line about 40 minutes before they opened, and it was just right.  Friendly staff, too.
author: Jeff B.

description: This place was perfect for me as I am a vegetarian. This was a great place to go to on an empty stomach. It's also good to know that it's Kosher. It's difficult to find kosher restaurants in SF.
author: Ela A.

description: Came here with a couple friends around 6:00, line moved fairly quickly and we were seated after about an hour. We ordered the Hakata Tonkotsu and Chicken Karaage. The broth was one of the best I've ever had, rich and smooth with tons of flavor. Ramen noodles were cooked perfectly, I normally don't like thin noodles but this place changed my mind. The Chicken Karaage was crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside, the sauce elevated the dish and complimented the chicken flawlessly. I would definitely come back again!
author: Crystal C.

description: This was our first time to Japantown as well as the restaurant. The directions on Yelp were a bit confusing. I'd suggest using the Yelp checkin before heading over to avoid the wait time.  Staff were friendly and attentive even with how busy it was.  The table ordered the edamame, chicken karage and shashito peppers as a starter. I ordered the Hakata DX medium spice level. I'm not a spice girl but this was perfect.  The broth had some unique (in a yummy good way) flavors from other ramens I've had.  Simple presentation but quite delicious. A must try again.
author: Stacey M.

description: I have tried many ramen bowls in SF and this is the best for me. The broth was so flavorful, noodles were eggy and were perfectly cooked. The egg was excellent, yolk was runny and delicious. We got there 20 minutes before it opened and were in the first seating so no wait. But I would have waited for this bowl of ramen!
author: Carla F.

description: Just amazing. Ambiance is wonderful. The appetizers are tasty and flavorful. The food is quick and the service is amazing. 10/10 would recommend this to anyone in the area.
author: Nanki G.

description: Definitely go for the chicken dx ramen. Limited to 15 servings! Also get the mirufuku bits. Serves two as an appetizer!
author: Andrew C.

description:
Finally Japantown has a legit ramen shop!!!  Up until now it's been sad little tourist traps. But Marufuku is a nice little gem. 

The Decor is modern and simple.  The booths are wide and comfortable!  My nitpick here is that the floor was slippery. Like, caked in grease kind of slippery. 

I ordered the Hakata (tonkotsu) DX:  The broth is proper!  Full bodied and rich.  Great pork flavor with nice color.  Definitely the highlight of the meal.  It came with cha-siu which was fine and fatty porkbelly which was tender and juicy. It has a sweet aftertaste from the seasoning and the natural fats!  Noodles are thin but have a decent bounce to the bite.  My nitpick here was that my egg yolk spilled out of the egg and fully cooked in the broth (sad panda).

My wife ordered the Paiten DX. There's only 15 per day so we jumped at the chance to try it.  Again the broth superb. A bit of light chicken flavor and the same thin noodles.  Came with a sizzling grilled chicken leg.  It had good flavor but was super chewy and dry. 

Overall I appreciate the quality of the food and the service was great. Another go-to spot in SF to satisfy my constant ramen cravings!  A Must try!!!
author: Anthony L.

description: I'm a fan.  Who isn't.  But the long lines and weird hours sometimes make this place not worth the hassle.  It's still the best ramen in the city I've had so far.  Will definitely be back.
author: Andrew P.

description:
Marufuku Ramen is legit. The ramen is great, prices are reasonable, and the decor is sleek and modern looking. I had a chance to try both the Tonkotsu and Paitan ramen. Both had really delicious, rich broths - although I preferred the Tonkotsu slightly more. The noodles were thin and slightly on the hard side - this was a plus for me as I really like my noodles cooked this way in ramen. 

As another reviewer pointed out, it's really similar tasting to Shinsengumi, one of the top ramen places in the LA area (which serves the same style - Hakata). Overall I think this is a great addition to Japantown and the SF ramen scene in general, and I'll definitely be heading back next time I get a chance.
author: Justin W.

description: Ramen is excellent. Wait is long tho. Waited 1.5 hr on Saturday, which isnt that bad i guess. Noodles are different from other ramen places, but flavor of pork and soup is very nice
author: Mason L.

description:
I've been to Marufuku twice since they opened and I'm still disappointed. 

The first time we came here, we tried the Chicken Paitan DX and popcorn chicken. The ramen wasn't very flavorful and I think the chicken side was a little bit too excessive. For those new to Marufuku, the Chicken Paitan DX comes with a giant chicken leg on a stone plate on the side. I wasn't able to finish both the ramen and the giant chicken leg. The popcorn chicken was also very dry and too salty and it wasn't very good. I think you can find better popcorn chicken at any run-of-the-mill boba shop.

The second time I came here, I tried the Hakata Tonkatsu DX. The menu lists the Hakata Tonkatsu DX as having "braised pork belly, soft boiled egg, green onions, kikurage mushroom and bean sprouts." What the menu doesn't tell you is that the ramen also contains ginger, and you get 1 piece of pork belly and 3 pieces of chashu as the default Hakata Tonkatsu DX option. I opted to get the Buta Kakuni add-on ($2.5 for 2pcs of braised pork belly) with my ramen.

However, when I received my Tonkatsu DX, I had only received two pieces of pork belly instead of three, so I asked my waiter what was up with that since I had gotten the add-on. She looked like a deer in headlights and explained that the Buta Kakuni add on means you get 2 pieces total, not 2 extra pieces. In other words, I paid an additional $2.5 for one extra piece of pork belly - so not worth it! The tonkatsu ramen broth is super creamy, fatty and salty, but that's typical of tonkatsu broths.

All in all, I think Marufuku is a little overpriced and I probably would go to Jinya or Santouka instead of driving to the city for ramen.
author: Cathy W.

description:
Meh. Ordered the ramen with chicken on a hot plate, the Hakada dx, and karage. Broth was so so and the meats were the only things good. Noodles are egg noodle like which we def are not fans of.  

Waited 20 mins on a Friday at 12:30pm. Saving grace was hitting up Salt N Straw afterwards.
author: Ben M.

description: Great, and I m an GREAT Ramen. Service was superb and fast. We got in line at 4:30 to ensure we got a seat, as the restaurant is rather small. Can't wait to go back.
author: Seth T.

description: This place is on the second floor of Japan Center, my friends and I took sometime to find it and somehow it's not on the directory either. Don't come to this place on an empty stomach, we went on Saturday night and we were 40th on the wait list at around 6:00 pm which took about well over an hour. The food was good, I had the Chicken Kaarage and Deluxe Ramen. It was fresh and the service was quick and efficient. I just didn't expect the braised pork and chashu to be a little on the sweet side. That's why I only gave it four stars, I like my ramen more savory than sweet but my friends liked it as it is. All in all, it was a good experience.
author: Princess B.

description:
This is one of my favorite ramen shop to go to now! The interior design looks like a traditional ramen shop with a little twist of a vibe of the 1950's with relaxing jazz playing in the background. It makes the atmosphere be very cozy, intimate, and respectable. It is SUPER CLEAN!
For the staff, they are very friendly and super professional. They make sure that the customers are having a good experience at the restaurant. I had a very tall lady as my waitress and she was super kind to me and the other customers. 
Now for the food is just amazing. I had the Hakata Tonkotsu and it was amazing! I felt like the judges in the manga/anime Shokugeki no Soma where I just kept slurping the ramen and it was gone before I realized it! The noodles are thin which is actually great for me since I'm not a huge fan of thick ramen noodles like some places do. The broth was absolutely delicious! It was light and thin but creamy and had a ton of flavor to it.  The kakuni was super thick and juicy! And the soft boiled egg was a super nice touch for the ramen. 
Huge compliments to the chef! I saw him working through the window and you can just tell he is having fun cooking for the customers. 
This is a great place for a chill vibe ramen and I know for sure that I will be coming back to this place!
author: Bryan V.

description: Great Ramen! Please bring Marufuku to Chicago! Check in with the Yelp app makes the experience very convenient.
author: JD C.

description: My favorite part of the ramen here is their thin noodles. I love love thin ramen noodles for their overall texture when you slurp it into your mouth. The broth is thick and creamy like it should be and I like to order medium spicy to cover up perhaps that meaty scent that the ramen broth has (I mean all pork or chicken ramen has that smell but I'm not a big fan of it so yeah). Oh and I love the soft boiled egg here! Split the yolk, soak it up with the broth and enjoy!
author: Christine K.

description:
tl;dr: this is a great Hakata-style ramen shop. For any non-ramen-nerds, Hakata-style ramen is different from the typical Tokyo or fusion-style ramen you'll find in most places in the states. The defining features of Hakata ramen are the thin, hard noodles and rich pork-bone broth -- Marufuku delivers on these two fronts as well as any other place I've had in the states. For any cross-country ramen connoisseurs, the closest analogue to Marufuku that I've had would be Shinsengumi in SoCal.

The noodles at Marufuku are quintessentially Hakata -- long, thin, and as hard as you'd like.
