Their menu does not feature the hardness levels of their noodles, but given that its a Hakata-style shop, its implied you can customize. On my initial order I went with their default medium-level of firmness, which was consistent with other ramen shops. When ordering my kaedama, there seemed to be some confusion with the waitress as I simply asked "can I change the hardness?" to which she said yes and then left without telling me what firmness levels they had available (since many places, even in Japan, do not serve harigane or beyond). Somehow my second-serving came out relatively quickly and seemed to be consistent with barikata-level noodles, so things worked out anyway, heh.

The soup for Marufuku's Hakata bowl is rich and creamy, and is typical of what you might find at other decent ramen shops in the bay area (e.g. Orenchi). They don't serve the extra-rich Hakata-style broth that you'll find in most shops in Japan, where the pork bones are left to cook for so long the soup begins to stink and take on a rich (almost putrid) odor to match its strong taste, but thats to be expected as it would likely turn off many visitors who are not accustomed to the region's unique flair. I've actually never encountered that style in the states, so this isn't so much a knock on Marufuku as it is an open question for whether there is a market for it outside of Japan.

I don't care much for toppings or pork meat, but their soft-boiled egg stood out to me as it is was extremely runny, and very pleasant. Their chashu is made with pork belly and was also a bit more pleasant than your typical ramen place's tougher pork loin chashu.

There wasn't a line on the Thursday evening that I came, and so my group was seated fairly quickly. Generally service was good, but the wait time between ordering and receiving our food seemed longer than expected given how few other parties were ordering.

Overall great spot, and I look forward to trying their chicken ramen next!!
author: Omar M.

description: Hands down the best ramen in the city! We got in line 30 minutes before opening at lunch on a Tuesday and were 5th in line. We had classic ramen with medium spice which was just enough kick. The pork was perfectly seared and toppings were well portioned. Can't wait to go back!
author: Catherine W.

description: Don't get distracted along the way by the other places in the Japan Center mall. Very nice ambiance with swing music playing makes you feel like you are transported to another place. The ramen is delicious. The menu says something about the broth cooking overnight. There is a chicken ramen option of which they only have limited quantities, but today I wanted tonkotsu, pork belly to be specific. I also got the karaage. Ill be back soon to try the fried squid. The table next to me got it and it looked great: large tenticles lightly fried.
author: D K.

description: most reviews here only reiterate my sentaments. The Pho was devine and when back in town this will be one of my first stops. The parking was fair and excellent and timely customer service.
author: Mike J.

description: Hakada Tonkotsu was really good. There is a good portion of noodles and the meat really moved me. I wish I ordered more since it was so good. The broth isn't super salty so I drank ALL OF IT. I also am a sucker for mentaiko so I ordered the mentaiko rice bowl. Most places, mentaiko isn't spicy but theirs has a kick. I definitely recommend this place.
author: Janelle O.

description:
This might be the best ramen in town and everyone seems to know it. I recently stopped by for lunch on a weekday and had 34 parties ahead of me. I'm looking forward to a second location or a reservation system.

All the ramen types I've tried are good, but I especially like the ones with pork belly. I think they had tea eggs when they first opened, so I've been disappointed in the regular soft boiled eggs in the ramen the last few times I went. Overall, still great though. Service is so-so.
author: Owen S.

description:
Once I walked in Marufuku Ramen, it gave a very modern Japanese hipster kind of a vibe. I ordered the Chicken Paitan ($10.99) in medium level spicy and my friend ordered the Hakata Tonkotsu ($10.99) in medium level spicy. 

Once we received the bowls, I thought it was kind of small. But the bowls were actually small but deep. 1 bowl was the perfect amount. There were bean sprouts, seaweed, a boiled egg, green onions, and chicken/pork chashu in it. The ramen, which claims to be home made, was super thin and delicious. Overall, I think the ramen was worth $10.99. I would definitely return to this location! It also makes me happy to see a successful ramen restaurant finally take over that location after many years.
author: Victoria H.

description: I've been wanting to try this place out for a while to see what all the hype was about, and I'm sorry to say it but it is definitely overhyped.  Came about 30 minutes before opening time to wait in line.  Unfortunately, I did not make the first round of patrons to be seated, so another half hour later, finally heard my name called.  I found it really annoying that as soon as I sat down, the waitress came by to take my order without me even having a second to glance at it.  Luckily, there were only a few ramen options to choose from so I was able to quickly settle on the chicken paitan dx and hakata dx.  Both soups were creamy and flavorful, although the hakata broth did seem heavy on the palette as I tried to finish it. The braised pork belly was delicious, but the other slices of pork were too fatty and nauseating.  The chicken leg that comes with the paitan dx was super tasty though and a highlight of the meal.  Now, I know that this place gets packed, but I found it extremely rude that the hostess handed me the bill as I was still eating, not bothering to ask if there was anything else I wanted to order.  As soon as I took my last bite, she swooped in to take away everything, then asked if I was done yet.  No mention of whether I needed more water, etc. even though I was clearly out.  They are like a machine there pumping patrons in and out.  I give credit to the rest of the staff inside that look like they are working their butts off...but seriously, after waiting an hour to eat there, you would think a japanese establishment that has such high ratings would attempt to work on their customer service.  The hostess girl who doubles as a server seriously needs to work on her stank face and awful customer service. Her attitude sucks and leaves a bad taste in your mouth to what would otherwise be a decent dining experience.
author: Phan ..

description: Honestly, a bit anti-climatic after all the reviews and long lines.  If anyone has spent time in Japan, I think they'll be disappointed with the thinness of the noodles.  There's no chewiness or bite to it. A great bowl of ramen is more than the broth. Ask yourself would I go back after the one experience.
author: Cdub S.

description: This is one of many best Ramen place so far. The ramen broth is very creamy, only reason I give 4 stars is because  how rushy they are, from the moment we sit down. Rush to order to eat and to get our check... besides that everything else was good.
author: Cui Le M.

description:
This place reminds me of Kagura, which used to be a ramen restaurant in San Mateo. I used to love their Hakata ramen and there was nowhere else in the Bay Area that served it. Hakata ramen usually uses thin ramen noodles instead of the traditional thick ones and their pork-based broth is simply amazing. It is not as heavy as tonkotsu broth, although tonkotsu is also made of pork bones. Here at Marafuku, their Hakata ramen is comparable to the one as Kagura. 

I ordered the Hakata deluxe in spicy, which came with 1 piece of kakuni, a slice of chasu, corn, 1 delicious runny egg, bean sprouts, kikurage mushrooms, a piece of nori, and green onions (14.99). I don't like kikurage mushrooms and I was able to sub it for bamboo shoots! The ramen was so delicious and it was definitely nostalgic as I was reminded of Kagura. The price is a bit expensive, but it is understandable being in Japantown. I would definitely come back to order this again because it's just that good! The broth was so good that I almost finished all of it. But be careful, there's obviously a lot of msg in it! 

The geso fry was also cooked to perfection and they serve it with Japanese mayo and a slice of lemon. Kagura also used to serve this and it's soooo good! 

The service was very friendly and attentive. Different servers checked up on us multiple times and always made sure we were accommodated for. The decor is very very nice and modern. You just have to see it for yourself. 

I'm not sure but I think this place is owned by the same owner of Kagura since everything is soooo comparable to it. Definitely give it a try!
author: Brenda K.

description: Amazing ramen, maybe the best I've had in all of San Francisco. The matcha iced tea is a great pairing for the salty broth and the rice bowls are rich and flavorful. There is usually a bit of a wait to try to get there early. They use the yelp wait line so go to the front and sign in- then walk around the mall and enjoy the shops till it's your turn. The service is amazingly quick and very friendly, and the prices are pretty g old as well. Overall, I would give this place six stars out of five if I could. It is not to be missed.
author: Alice R.

description:
Loved this ramen! I got the classic pork (not DX deluxe) and added corn. The broth was some of the best I have had but the meal was not so rich that you feel a little sick at the end. Perfectly balanced. The noodles were thinner than I normally have, but also very good. Still dreaming about that broth!

My only suggestion is to add a vegetarian dish for those vegetarians and vegans. I normally do not eat meat, so I gave the pork belly in mine to my date.
author: Stephanie S.

description: Came here without a reservation on a Saturday evening. Wait was around 30 minutes but definitely well worth the wait. The broth was delicious - extra noodles option really filled me up.
author: Ernest W.

description: So worth the wait.... the shishito peppers were tasty and the tonkatsu was perfection.. add to that a hitachino red and all is good in the world!!!!
author: Richard M.

description: I was here last week with my boyfriend and had the best ramen. We initially wanted to goof off at the photo booth place but it was closed so we decided to eat lunch. This place had a line out the door and people sitting on benches waiting to get a seat. I mean if that doesn't tell you the food is good I don't know what to tell you. I got the hakata tonkotsu medium spicy and my boyfriend got the chicken one also medium spice. We both loved it. The inside has really cool seating in the middle which we got to sit at. The service was good and for as busy as it was we didn't feel rushed. I'd recommend this place to anyone wanting ramen.
author: Kim H.

description: 5 stars for the fantastic food. The best ramen in the city IMHO. But I have to give a serious downgrade for the horrible waitlist experience. We put our name on the Yelp waitlist and was provided with a wait time of approximately 75 - 105 minutes. We dutifully followed the instructions and arrived 75 minutes after joining the waitlist only to see there was still a significant wait ahead of us. So, we popped across the street to grab a drink while we waited. After about 30 minutes we headed back to the restaurant where we waited another 30 minutes to excitedly receive a phone call that our table would be ready in 5 minutes. We then waited another 15 minutes to be sat. In total, we were sat 45 minutes after the 105 minute mark passed. While I get that the waitlist time is an estimate, 45 min late is pretty ridiculous. Moral of the story- great ramen, but be prepared to invest some time waiting around in a mall.
author: Caryn M.

description: I don't usually leave reviews but this place rocks!!! Must-go place in Japan down and you don't wanna miss their heaven-taste ramen!!!! Marufuku bun also strongly recommend, so favored and yummy!
author: Catherine W.

description: Ramen was pretty good, but honestly I don't think it was the hour wait that we had on a Friday night. My friends and I all ordered the Hakata DX, which was solid. Large portion (good amount of meat - most places have barely any) and nice broth. Where this place was really lacking for me was the appetizers. We got the chicken karaage and the geso fry, which were both very underwhelming. Very bland and overcooked.
author: Cynthia M.

description: Came here for lunch on a Thursday afternoon about an hour after opening. Short wait of about 15 minutes and managed to grab the chicken paitan dx and the tonkatsu ramen with a mentaiko bowl on the side. Both ramen have great broths and the chicken leg was super tasty and juicy. Just the right amount of char on it. Definitely grab one of the limited chicken paitan dx if you can!
author: Steph c.

description: The ramen was worth the 30 min wait. I wanted to try the chicken pantai dx ramen but they were all out. Instead  I ordered the Hakata Tonkotsu ramen which satisfied the cravings for authentic ramen style noodles. My order came with pork belly and perfectly soft boiled eggs. Since I was new in the area I had to use Google to find the place and had a difficult time finding it. Google had it spot on for the building but the name wasn't on the building directory so thinking I was in the wrong area, I had to go around the building thinking it was somewhere else close by but the restaurant was actually tucked in a corner on the second floor. I would go back again, now I know where to find it :) one less star for difficulty finding the place.
author: Jason P.

description:
FANTASTIC. My new favorite ramen shop! I'm so glad I decided to come here. Went during the 50th cherry blossom festival, so it was definitely packed. Despite that, we got seats relatively quickly (~30 min wait), even during prime lunch time.

The ambiance of the restaurant was nice. I really liked the table that I got seated at: the bench seats were lit up!

I got the Chicken "Paitan" DX ramen and my sister got the Tonkotsu DX. They were both AMAZING. The chicken on the side was tender and sweet, and just so so good. The pork in my sister's ramen was also fantastic. So really, 5 stars on the meat.

The waitress was attentive and gave us really quick service.

The prices were pretty standard, but seroously worth it. I'll definitely be coming back!
author: Elaine L.

description: Great ramen! Plenty of flavor and proportions don't leave me feeling too many regrets. Not too long of a wait either.
author: Kara W.

description:
Sorry Suzu you've been usurped as my favorite noodle joint at the J-Town mall.
Broth is delicious; noodles are amazing; octopus balls are bomb!!  (Which btw I had no idea - I mean "octopus balls" doesn't sound exactly appetizing)
The special, chicken, "we only have 15 of them" ramen order comes with an entire leg alongside the ramen, so just know that.  
Also - Sapporo on draft?  What?!  So good.
author: Jennifer D.

description: We came here on a Sunday morning at 11 and the line had already begun even though it didn't open for another 30 min! By the time they opened they line was wrapped around the corner. Luckily we were still early enough that we got first seating. It was definitely worth the wait! We got the Hakata DX and the Chicken Karage which both turned out so delicious. The pork belly was so flavorful and the karate was very moist as well! Make sure you get here early!
author: Sally T.

description:
I really wanted to like Marufuku, but unfortunately can't agree with the steller reviews.  The Chicken Paitan DX was lackluster, and the chicken side was a bit much.  The Hakata Tonkatsu was unmemorable as well.  The ramen noodles were far too thin for my liking.  They almost seemed like Chinese noodles.  

We asked for bamboo shoots since it wasn't listed as an ingredient of either.  Our server said they already were included and no need to add, so we hesitantly said that's fine, no need for extra. Of course when we received our order, no bamboo shoots were included... our server also forgot to place our order for sake.  So, service was very lacking.  Sadly, we won't be back.
author: Cathy B.

description:
First Hakata styled ramen in SF! Reminded me of NYC ramen scene in terms of taste. Until ippudo opens in SF and Berkeley, this is the place to get your hakata styled bowl.

Note that their menu is temporary one, so I can see they'll be adding more menu items.

Unless you're super hungry, don't get Tori paitan DX bowl. It comes with a frigging chicken thigh as a side.
author: Silin N.

description: Almost always a wait but definitely always worth it. The broths are on point, not too fatty or heavy.
author: Allison C.

description:
Wow, this place blew my mind. The noodles are so fresh and authentic. They have so much flavor. The ramen here is different than most other places. Being someone who's had authentic ramen  in Japan, I can honestly say this place is damm good and close to being the same as what I had in Japan. 

I had the special, and I slurped up every last bit of broth there was.  SO good. 

Highly recommend this place!

Also a super nice restaurant. Loved the decor. And, service was great.
author: Julia W.

description: I've been here only three times. But each time, I swear it gets better. There's a reason why this is the only place on the second floor of Japantown that has a long line.  I recommend coming here early if you want to reserve a spot with friends, the wait for me took about 1 1/2 hours on a Friday night for a table of 4!
author: Jeff L.

description: Long lines.  Fast service and polite staff.  I didn't think the ramen was all that great.  It was just OK.  I prefer Iza Ramen and Mensho Ramen more than this.  If you happen to be in Japantown and it's about to open, like I was, then maybe it's worth trying. Otherwise, I would recommend skipping and going somewhere else.
author: Dan K.

description: Best ramen I've had in SF, maybe in the US. Tastes authentic to Japanese- fast service and friendly once you're seated -- however, expect to wait at least an hour plus to get your food. They are super popular and do a waiting list system to get in that can get up to 3 or 4 pages deep. You will not be seated if you're whole group isn't there and if you miss your name being called, you are most likely out of luck - totally worth the trouble seek it out, it's in a Japanese mall in the second floor so plenty to look at while you wait.
author: Victor M.

description:
I thought the ramen here was really good. Added corn and bamboo shoots to my bowl for $1 each! Broth was creamy and not salty at all. I think they could have given less ramen... felt so bad not being able to finish it. Service did not disappoint.

One last thing, don't get the matcha green tea. It's powdery and gross hahaha
author: Michelle L.

description: Saw the line before opening and had to go! The ramen was amazing and the takoyaki was hot. Service was around enough to keep my refill my water. The mild is really spicy, for me at least.
author: Yo T.

description:
One of the best ramen place that I've tried. My boyfriend and I ordered the Hakata Tonkotsu. They give you a choice to chose your spicy preference. I have a high tolerance for spice. My boyfriend has a low tolerance though. But we both ordered it on the "spicy level," which was the second to the highest spiciness level. Let me tell you, it was no where near as spicy as I thought it would be for my boyfriend and I. Our ramen was delicious. The broth is as thick as the other places we've been to which made me like this place even more. The only downside about our entree that I did not like and will ask them to exclude that in my ramen next time is this ginger like texture and flavor. All and all I would definitely come back to this restaurant whenever I'm in town. Customer service was great, so that was a cherry on top. Keep in mind also that we waited for 45 minutes for our seat BUT we came during the Cherry Blossom Festival so that may be why they were so slammed that night.

Update: you definitely want to see if they accept reservations. I came to visit Japantown on July 29 with my family and passed this restaurant and there was a humongous line. This place is definitely worth the wait though!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Good portion size and authentic, fresh ingredients but food is way too salty. I'd recommend the steamed pork belly as an addition since the char siu is very fatty. Again the steamed pork belly is also too salty but has good flavor and melts in your mouth. 

Egg was over cooked and underwhelming the last time I went.
author: Bobby D.

description:
Pretty good 
Busy and lines all the time
A bit pricey for the size and depth of the soup
author: Sujanne J.

description: So good! We all tried different ramen bowls and everyone was happy with their choice. Broth is amazing! Get the corn if the bowl you want doesn't come with. I tried medium spice and it was perfect. My husband got spicy but said it want enough. If you like spice, get ultra spicy.  Will definitely be back!
author: Erica A.

description:
This place was delicious. My typical go-to ramen in the city is Genki Ramen, which I have no hesitation recommending. Genki has like 25 different ramens you can get. Marufuku has 5. Everyone at our table got the Hakata DX, and we selected different spicy levels. The service was friendly, and the food came out quickly.

One thing I really appreciate about this specific dish I got was how complex the flavors were. Every bite of my Hakata DX was a bit different. There's pork belly, tonkatsu, the fried egg, the noodles, the spicy broth. Sometimes I'd get a good taste of ginger. It was just really darn good.

Go here!
author: Kevin H.

description:
Japantown finally has an establishment with great tonkotsu (pork broth) ramen!

You can select from five spice levels on the menu. I've had "mild" and "medium" so far. I thought the medium detracted from the broth's richness a bit. So if it is your first time, I recommend sticking to "mild" or below to evaluate the broth.

Both times I went the noodles were thin and soft. If you like your noodles on the firmer side, you'll have to ask for that. I'm not sure if they offer thicker noodles. The noodles aren't the best I've had in SF. But they were good enough. Besides, I care about broth more.

If I could improve the tonkotsu broth in any way, it would be to make it creamier and fattier. The leaner broth puts Marufuku a half notch below my favorite ramen places in Vancouver, BC and Japan. But for San Francisco, you'll have a hard time finding better tonkotsu than what Marufuku offers.
author: Gregory S.

description: This was a really nice restaurant with really good ramen although the wait was incredibly long. It took me over an hour and a half just to get our names called. P.S make sure you put your name on the iPad they have as you walk in or else you'd be wasting your time.
author: Stephanie S.

description: Best ramen I've had in SF thus far. 10/10 would eat here again and happily accept weight gain. I opted for the takeout experience instead of the wait-in-line and sit down experience and would highly recommend that version. If your sensibilities are fat and your patience is thin.
author: Mandi M.

description: Waited for two hours for this supposedly best ramen in SF. I have to agree to the claim.
author: Lin-hsiu H.

description: Long wait times as it took over the old Sapporo Ya ramen place. We waited 40 minutes for a table and was inside for less than 30 minutes. The service is great! soup was very rich and creamy and the noodles very cooked just right. I will be back.
author: Jan H.

description: Best ramen place I've ever been. The noodle is excellent, very chewy. The soup is thick and have lots of favor. The Takoyaki is hands down the best I've had. Highly recommended and worth the 1+ hour wait.
author: Steven W.

description:
There's a weird smell, kind of like body odor.

The girl checking the names sheet says that the wait would be 30 minutes every time someone asks, even if it had already been 30 minutes -.- just tell the truth even if people leave...
author: Trang V.

description: The best ramen I've ever tried! Seriously, if you are looking for a top quality Japanese soup, look no further. Was also really impressed with the service. Highly recommend!
author: Bob L.

description: Went on a Sunday and I heard of the long lines.  We dilly dally a little bit around the mall before coming up to Marufuku--word of advice go here first!!  Sign up for the waitlist and then do your shopping.  Their waitlist uses yelp and its so convenient to sign in and then get a text when they are ready.  My sister was able to look at the number of parties before us and there's like an indicator you can look at to tell you how close you are in getting a table on yelp.  Its super convenient.  We had 68 parties ahead of us!!!  Our wait time was like almost 2 hours but we shopped a little and hung out.  It's pretty amazing to see how fast the number drops so don't fret if you are like 68 in line.  This was my family's first time here.  It was worth the wait.  Hakata Tonkotsu and the Hakata Deluxe were such a hit for us.  The broth is creamy and the pork belly was cooked to perfection.  I would recommend both- Mild to no spicy.   I had the unsweetened Matcha tea which I liked as well.  If you want to get excellent ramen this is the place to go.  Hands down.
author: Jazmin J.

description:
You know when the line is long that means the food is good!  Best ramen in town!  Pork broth ramen with all the vegetable fixings and a whole egg. I personally like to take a little bite out of the egg and let it cook in the ramen! 'Ono! (Delicious)
Don't forget to try the chicken karaage...lightly battered full of chicken!  Tako Yaki balls off the hook! 
Until next time!
author: Rae T.

description: Ordered the Hakata Tonkotsu and it was delicious. Those who are from NYC know we got Ippudo and Ichiran, 2 of the most popular ramen place...and I feel like this was better than Ippudo because the broth was just bueno. Haven't got the chance to try Ichiran yet but I will soon once I'm back home. Even my bf said it reminded him the time he was in Japan last year.
author: Jen Z.

description:
Went here a while back because I saw on yelp it had 5 stars at the time. The ramen is really meh. The noodles were really thin and almost seemed like egg noodles.

This can be purely my preference, but I like the thick noodles. If you like thin noodles, this place is great. The broth is super super tasty. I think if they offered a Tsukemen with thicker noodles, this place would be OP!!

I may be critical about ramen.. I've tried an unhealthy amount. An emotionally and physically unhealthy amount.
author: Mathoo O.

description: best ramen i've ever had, hands down. and i've had a lot of ramen in my lifetime!! there are only 4 kinds, 2 tonkatsu, 2 chicken. tried both. i highly recommend the extra fancy tonkatsu offering ($16). but you can't go wrong. the braised pork on top is CRAZY good. i tried my boyfriends chicken ramen and it was superb as well. portions are perfect. not the biggest bowl of ramen i've ever seen, but i thought it was just right for one human's worth of consumption. we went on a sunday night around 8pm and got in around 8:35pm. not too shabby considering around 30 people were waiting to get in. people seem to be in and out decently fast. can't wait to revisit!!
author: Camille R.

description: ok so i've been to quite a few ramen places. i'm from OC and the ramen that i've had sucks lol. typically it's very bland and the noodles are just not good. i was convinced that ramen was just not my thing. but i came to sf to visit my cousin and she wanted to get ramen so we came here. let me tell you this is the BEST ramen i've ever had, i finished my entire bowl. the broth was so flavorful and the noodles were thinner but i loved it. i ordered the tonkotsu and my cousin got the chicken one they were both so good but the tonkotsu (pork belly) was definitely a lot better. i wish i lived closer to here because i would come all the time!
author: Victoria C.

description:
Honestly the best Ramen I've had. Fantastic pork broth, very rich and somewhat creamy, lots of veggies, whole egg (not half), and LOTS of ramen noodles. The noodles are a little thinner than what I've had in the past, but they were cooked perfectly.

Limited menu. I think there were 4 or 5 types of Ramen. Some good appetizers. We had the chicken Karage, which was hot out of the fryer. Crispy on the outside and tender on the inside. Served with a bit of Kewpie, but it didn't really need it.

Be patient, this place is new, so wait staff doesn't have it quite together yet, but are very polite and seem conscientious. It was worth the wait. The restaurant seats maybe 50 - 55 people.

I've had Ramen all over the bay area, and this has to be the top for ME. Some will probably disagree. Wish it was closer to the East Bay. I think it's going to be packed in the future. It was packed when we left and we got there right at 5 pm.
author: Cynthia S.

description:
The queue is worth it - I was the last person before their lunch closed - though one gentleman came in 20 minutes after me and begged the chef to feed him since he had been in the ramen void that is Miami - they obliged and he finished before I did. I had the first pork ramen on the menu $10.99 - and it was wonderful. The pork was well cooked, the broth delish, and the egg I found perfectly cooked underneath the lovely presentation of toppings.0 Photographed for Instagram perfect with their custom printed chopstick wrapper - the chef found it on Instagram and liked it!
I yearn to come back here. It was lovely.
author: Lexa G.

description: Great ramen!!! Love how they have waitlist on yelp so you don't have to go over there and wait for a long time. Probably took 1.5hrs til we actually got a seat for 2pm on a weekday at 8pm (when we first put name down). Wait was worthwhile! Always in search of great ramen and this marks my top!
author: Bao H.

description: I'm not a ramen fan, but I think this place may have just changed my mind! The broth is very rich and tasty! My fav was the shashito peppers! I'll be back soon!
author: Denise N.

description: Best ramen in sf so far. The waitlist system is very effecient. The broth is well prepared with rich flavors. The pork always comes out tender and delcious. everything else taste fresh and a lot of thought is put into ingredients and preperation. The appetizers never disappoint. Nice clean restaurant. Super friendly staff and waiters/waitresses.
author: Gerald B.

description: From the ambiance to customer service to the food, everything was amazing. Last summer I went to Japan and had Ichiran ramen. I'm not going to compare the restaurants directly, since Ichiran has such a large fanbase and I'd rather not get roasted online, but I can definitely say that the bowl of tonkotsu ramen I had at Marufuku was--dare I say-- better than Ichiran! The soup was rich yet not overly seasoned, and the noodles grabbed the soup perfectly. Every bite was delicious for a reasonable price.
author: Catherine Z.

description: Super affordable and tasty. Their meat looks fat, but it melts in your mouth. You won't taste stinky pork flavor. They also give you a lot of topping. The wait is not terrible. Just walk around for 10-15mins and they will text you when your seat is ready.
author: Tina H.

description: This place is really over hyped. I have been to many ramen shops and this place soup base is good that's about it. The noodles are not traditional chewy noodles but a softer thin noodle. What really cost the 2 stars is the way they do business. The Wait is a killer. I was already waiting for an hour for a party of two. But they let party of 4 and then party of 7 go in before us. Turn out its not who have been waiting but how many is in your party. So if there are no 2 seater table available they will let people who just put down their name go in first if they have the "right" party number. I really felt that they should call by the order of the list rather than how many is in your party.  If two people have been waiting for an hr and a table for 4 opened up you should just let them sit and let the party of 4 that just showed up wait instead.  Truly. Should be first come first serve.
author: Liang J.

description: So yummy. Best pork belly ever and such generous portions. It's a lot of delicious food and pairs so well with the sequoia Nama sake.
author: Ke D.

description: Was a little disappointing after all the hype. The ramen was good but not worth going back. And it's kinda disappointing that we had to go back and forth w the kitchen about how most of the menu wasn't available and we really only had a couple choices because everything else had ran out. We really weren't even there that close to closing.
author: Jennifer R.

description:
I went to Marufuku Ramen for the first time for Sunday lunch and I ordered Hakata Tonkotsu. Overall, it was pretty good and I will go there again for sure. 

PROS:
- authentic Hakata ramen
- perfect texture on their boiled eggs
- lighter on salt and fat than other places
- Nice, modern restaurant design

CONS:
- very popular (Go there early. We went there 25 min before the opening but we were already the 4th group in the line.)
author: Mariko H.

description:
Hands down the best ramen I've had in SF. We've lived here 2 years now. I always find something off with ramen in they city. Too salty! Too fatty!
But this place just gets it right! Can't wait to come back.
author: Dawn S.

description: Had the tonkotsu. Not 5 stars because I didn't get very much corn for having it as an add on.  The broth was quite nice, the chasu pork was tender and tasty. Everything was well seasoned, the ginger cut the richness and the sesame seeds was a nice touch. Though I've grown to prefer springy, chewy, thicker noodles my Japanese friend informed me that skinny, more floury flat noodles are traditional to tonkotsu so this tonkotsu version is more authentic than most.  The bowl was deceptive, it was small but deep so you get a good portion, I think the bowl helped keep the soup hotter longer.  Ooh, you get a whole egg, not half!
author: Mirba E.

description: Totally worth the wait. Get there early and put you name on the waitlist. Really good ramen.
author: Natalie T.

description: I appreciate the ability to put our names in through yelp! It was an hour wait so we just walked around until it was almost time. Soup was very good. Creamier style broth without the oily or fatty sensation. They use the thinner straight noodles, but I prefer the wavy type. I do wish there some more vegetable in the bowl as it was a little too salty. Overall, pretty good.
author: Rita W.

description: Went here, not too long of a line. The takoyaki balls were alright, very saucy but the octopus was small and mostly dough. The ramen broth wasn't bad either. I tried the pork and chicken one and as you expect, pork is more rich and chicken is more light. Chicken one still had a lot of flavor though. In my opinion, the noodles went better with the pork broth though
author: Victor D.

description: My experience: The service will rush me through my entire meal and the chicken karaage was undercooked on the inside. I have no desire to go back.
author: K I.

description:
Delicious! Enjoyed the ramen, sake, and takoyaki. The staff was great and love the yelp waitlist so that you don't have to wait at the restaurant. Get your name on the list when you first get to Japantown then explore! 
Hakada Tonkatsu ultra spicy was really good, but could have been a little spicier! 
Great spot!
author: Lily C.

description: Generous amount of ramen. Very good flavor. Would be nice is there was draft beer. Be prepared to wait at least 25 minutes.
author: Jamal W.

description: This place has wonderful ramen, and absolutely delicious rice bowls! If you have a big breakfast but wanna feel full at lunch, get the fried chicken rice bowl for just the right amount of food. The rice is fluffy, sticky and aromatic. The chicken not greasy and perfectly cooked, with well seasoned breading.
author: Haley S.

description: Best Japanese ramen place. This place does not compare to any other place on the west coast. This place is so good that even one of those customers and those back end workers did not lower the score. Amazing place.
author: D C.

description: All I have to say is this place is AMAZING. JUST go here. And eat delicious ramen. You won't regret it.
author: Shelly P.

description: We stood in long line for 15 min, but we will not have to do this again. What came in a bowl was rather flavorless broth with Somen like thin noodles which turned me off completely . I think one has to grow up in Hakata region to appreciate this, but otherwise...No.
author: Yoshi K.

description:
We went with a group of four and everyone present voted this in their new top 2 of ramen places. The soft boiled egg and braised pork belly really make a difference in taste and texture. 

I also ordered a large salad with the plum dressing, not expecting much, but really craving something green. It was fantastic. Really, I don't think you could go wrong with the menu.

We came later, around 8:45 and although there was a long waitlist, it moved very quickly as people didn't stick around for their name. Service was good, food came quickly. We will definitely be back!
author: Alexi V.

description: Really loved the dishes here I was very impressed with the taste of each dish when I came here Indefinitely have to comeback for more!
author: Khalid H.

description: Does Marufuku Ramen worth 2 hours waiting in Saturday evening? Of course not!! Their soup base is nothing but above average. So is their thin noodles. I don't figure why so many idiots are willing to wait  at least an hour to eat a very regular ramen rather than go to other ramen shops  in Japantown. If you are decent ramen enthusiast, the best way to save your time is to order a to-go ramen and eater them at any benches outside the ramen shops. I promise if you try like this way, you won't try second time in Marufuku Ramen.
author: Haixing L.

description: One of my favorite ramen spots! Line can be long, but worth the wait. I like the geso fry for appetizer. Definitely check it out!
author: Michelle L.

description: I been to Japan and never have I tasted something so close. I actually surprised myself by eating the whole bowl!! Definitely coming back!!!!
author: Marlyn C.

description: OMgosh! I can't give this enough stars. The chicken ramen was so spicy and delicious! Very fresh ingredients and authentic. Worth travelling from downtown (past the Tenderloin) to Japantown for this!
author: Janine M.

description: I have become a ramen expert because the fact that I eat them for the past 40+ years. I was very much enjoyed the ramen at this place. The only thing I would replace is their choice of noodle. But the flavor of the soup base was thick and delicious. It was not salty nor too creamy. I had the Katana DX spicy(shouldve gotten extra spicy, Im a spicy guy), didn't need to get extra items because it was just good enough for me. The service was good, constantly pouring tea for my table even when they were busy. Its a little pricy for a bowl of ramen ($15.99) because it was their most expensive ramen that has everything in it pretty much. I guess its worth it being in San Francisco. I gave it a 5 stars because the flavor and service. Lets say if you want to eat at 7pm get there by 6pm or just get there when theyopen for dinner which is 5 pm.
author: Jackson W.

description:
Marufuku is great ramen places. I ordered Miso ramen.
It so delicious.
author: Sung K.

description: Great little place stuck in the Japanese mall. We came on a Saturday and it was busy. Wait list was long. Service was fast for quick turnaround. Not an expert on ramen but this was really good.
author: Kai L.

description: Yum yum. Again, my sister and I went there for lunch and I love the noodle here. It's similar to ramen we had in Japan. The broth is rich and creamy and felt so good. The line was a little long though. But again, good things worth waiting!
author: Sara L.

description: Great and helpful service. The ramen was delicious, fresh, and so flavorful. 10 our of 10 would go again.
author: Antoinette P.

description:
Best ramen I've ever tasted! There's usually a line every time I go which is usually in the afternoon which is understandable since it's a popular place. People seem discouraged because of the wait time but the service is great and the longest I ever had to wait there was around 10 mins. 
I usually get takoyaki with my ramen and it's such a nice combination. The food is very filling especially if you get a entree.
author: Anna C.

description: Went here on a Friday night and even there were already people ahead of me, it only took about ten to fifteen minutes to get a table. Menu was simple and rather short in options but the food they served to you was truly delicious and scrumptious. Quick service as well. I am putting this one on my list!
author: Patricia B.

description: We got the Hakata Tonkatsu. They nailed it. The broth, meat, everything was top notch. The boiled egg inside was a work of art in its level of preparation. Get here early... this place fills up quick for lunch.
author: R G.

description: Probably the best ramen in the bay area.  I ordered the tonkatsu one.  The broth is flavorful and not too salty.  The egg is cooked perfectly.  Will definitely come back here
author: Jenny X.

description:
This place is a welcoming addition to both San Francisco and Japan Town. From the welcoming staff to the well curated menu, you will be truly impressed. The place fills up quickly so come early.
I started with the Chicken Karaage, served with a dollop of Kewpie mayonnaise. Each piece was slightly crispy on the outside and moist inside. Next, Ramen Tonkotsu, a rich pork broth with a perfect cooked egg, thin noodles, corn, and slices of pork.
Overall, Marufuku is well priced and the portion are just enough. Check this place out soon before there is a line.
author: Thomas B.

description: It was good when they first open. Today it's so so. The broth is hit or miss. The quality is not that great. Would not wait over an hour for this again
author: Evelyn Q.

description: Came here for lunch with my mom. I just happened to be in the area when they opened for lunch so there was no line! We tried two different ramens and they were both amazing! I love how you can customize the level of spice. We smelled the chicken thigh, and omg, i was drooling and regretting I did not order the XL!
author: Anna Y.

description:
So we found this little gem of a place in the mall (of all places) in Japantown. The food here is greeeaaatt, and the lines forming before opening speak for it. We got there 10 minutes before opening, got in line, and ended up having to put our names on their iPad waitlist, which apparently works through Yelp (though you don't need an account). First time I've used this system, but it's very convenient! You can wander the mall and when your table is almost ready, you get texted. Would have liked to have more clear signage or instructions on what to do afterwards, because it states to see a staff member within 5 minutes or your table might be forfeited. It was a little confusing when we showed up after receiving the text because there is usually a line in front of the ipad, and it was unclear if there was a second line for people who also got texted and were waiting to be seated. There was no staff member up front at the time either, so we were not sure if we were supposed to wait outside with everyone else or go into the restaurant to flag someone down. 

Anyways, onto the food!
We started with Japanese fried chicken and pork buns. The fried chicken was good, but would probably skip next time. The pork buns were great! The buns were fluffy, and the pork was soft and flavorful. Would order that one again! 
We both got the Hakata DX. The broth is flavorful and definitely one of my favorites. Not as thick and salty as other places, which was actually a good thing as other places oversalt their broth and therefore appear more flavorful as a result, despite the actual broth itself being meh. So this broth was goood. The noodles were also good as well--great texture and bite. The egg was perfect. 

Service was prompt, attentive, and to the point. 

Price is perfect for portion sizes. 

Would love to come back next time we're in town!
author: Jenny B.

description: Inside interior is so modernized, sleek and clean. Our order is so quick. HaKaTa TonKotSu ramen is beyond amazing. The broth is so rich and tasty, pork belly is chewy and delicious. The vegetables are also fresh. I've got my soup in medium spicy and still it's not spicy for me. Overall, it is a great experience to dine in.
author: Thet K.

description:
Severely underwhelming given the yelp rating. Got the chicken and pork DX bowls. The braised chicken leg came way before the ramen so we finished it separately. It tasted like a normal tea time chicken leg. 

The ramen broth was underflavored and very watery. The noodles were white, thin, and straight, like Chinese noodles. It did not have the nice eggy texture that one would expect. It was so bad that we did not have the persistence to finish the bowl and had to take it home (to be finished absent-mindedly as a brought-to-work lunch). The restaurant also smelled weird, not unlike a public restroom. 

Hinodea is a much better option for ramen, across the street!
author: Ryan L.

description: Long wait, 45 minutes after being told 15 but worth the wait.  Excellent food presentation, quality and quantity.  Get the Hakata DX, pricey but worth the price.
author: Mike K.

description: One outstanding ramen! I'm not a crazy ramen guy but my girlfriend absolutely loves eating any type of soup noodles, ramen especially so she knows what she's talking about. Even though i'm not a crazy ramen guy, I thought this places ramen was better than most I've had. Great flavor in the soup and the noodles were just perfect. The fat from the pork belly was just an equal amount to the whole dish like it was planned. I'd definitely recommend here if you're looking to add one of the best ramens you've ever had on your list.
author: Dennis K.

description: This place was so worth the hype! Get here right when it opens because there will be a line! My friends and I got here a little less than 10 minutes after they opened for dinner and we still waited 20 minutes. It was good and they serve you FAST! Got our food in less than 5 minutes of ordering. We all got the hakata tonkatsu spicy and it was good and favorful! Definitely will come again and maybe will try the DX.
author: Maiko I.

description: Visiting San Francisco area. My husband found this on Yelp. A hidden gem in Japan Town! The restaurant has a causal modern contemporary decor that reflects in the flavors of the food. The ramen noodles are made fresh daily! The broth had depth in flavor, pork belly was moist and tender. We also had the char sui bun which really impressed us because the buns were made to order. So reserve your table prior to arriving on Yelp this will cut down on the wait time.
author: Maria S.

description: I waited 45 minutes (which apparently is on the shorter side of wait time) for a table for 1 person just to eat this ramen and it was completely worth it. I got the chicken based brother and it is THE best ramen I've ever eaten. It was creamy, full of flavor, and packed with delicious veggies. I would gladly wait 45-an hour for this ramen again.
author: Toyiah M.

description: I ordered the Tonkostsu XD (forgive my spelling), and The broth was amazing, the pork was cooked perfectly as it just melts in your mouth. My main knock on it was that my egg was at the bottom of the bowl and was pretty much a boiled egg. So it didn't have runny yolk, so that was my little half star knock on the place (unless it's the way they meant to serve it then I'll rescind that last statement and give this place 5 stars).
author: Brian C.

description: I love this place. Food is soooo good and the staff is very friendly. Very clean place and ambiance is lovely.
author: Michelle L.

description: The wait was so very long but it was worth it! We got there at 1 and had to wait till almost 3 pm. If you don't go to Japan town often (like me) then you can walk around to spend some leisure time. The ramen soup and pork was so tasty! Customer services were good too.
author: Eva A.

description: Yes the ramen was good. BUT THE WAIT TIME IS SO DAMN LONG!!!! Luckily we were not that hundry when started wating. It was worth the wait for us. Just make sure you have something in your stomach when you start waiting.
author: Mike J.

description: It's pretty expensive and the waits are about an hour long but don't let that turn you off.The staff are a bit conservitively friendly and polite and will cater to your every needs.I was also served pretty quick.I ordered the tonkotsu ramen with medium spiciness.It was pretty good as it was rich but not heavy.The egg and pork were cooked to perfection.The spiciness depends on you but I thought medium was good not too spicy but it has a kick.
author: Clayton C.

description: This is probably my favorite ramen place. The price is average for ramen but taste amazing. The pork was very well made and tasted sweet. The takoyaki was definitely the best I've ever had. I would recommend this to anyone who loves ramen.
author: Brandon L.

description:
Pretty solid ramen, still don't think the broth is as good as ramen parlor or men sho but it's definitely legit/authentic ramen. Used thinner noodles cooked well with a nice bite, but I prefer the thicker noodles. 
I got the Hakata DX spicy which also came with a nice chunk of braised pork. Was not a fan of the pink ginger though, still a solid ramen spot on the city.
author: Piers Y.

description: Stand in line for this Ramen shop I don't care how long it takes you get inside and get a seat just do it! Make the afternoon for it because it's so worth it. I had the HAKATA TONKOTSU  and my husband had their CHICKEN PAITAN both were $10.99 packed full of noodles and full body broth. On top of that we had corn and a whole soft boil egg it was delicious. It was the best ramen we have had in a long time. We say this ruined our forever, because in Chicago we can't find a ramen shop that we can say is that great. The prices in Chicago is $15 and up for a ramen bowl and here in San Francisco we can get it for about $11 that really a great deal. It was so much noodles I couldn't finish it I let my husband get my left overs. It comes out hot, fresh and amazing. I love how the broth has the fatty taste without feeling greasy. The pork belly is soft and savory. Everything works well with the house made noodles to the full body broth absolutely worth the wait in line for lunch. We were so glad we go in line and decided we were going to have Marufuku Ramen for lunch. If you haven't tried this place yet you totally should and tell your friends about it!
author: Jaci Y.

description: waited 30 minutes before the doors even opened and i'm honestly glad that i did. i ordered the hakata tonkotsu in the level spicy. i must say it is the best ramen bowl i had ever had in san francisco. the noodle was terrific, the soup was spicy good, and the pork belly was so delicious and flavorful. i love this place so much!!! 5/5!!!!
author: Kristi A.

description: The wait is extremely long, but the ramen makes it completely worth it! It's probably one of the richest broths I've ever had. Would definitely recommend!!
author: Mabel W.

description: This is literally the best ramen I've ever had. Yelp tip: join the waitlist from your app and beat the crowds right at 1130am!!
author: Rebecca S.

description: i had the hakata dx and it was amazing. the broth was rich and flavorful, it's just the ramen itself for me is too hard since I prefer soft noodle. They have different spiciness levels, which is great. I went here over the lunch time and still saw people queue to enjoy this ramen. waiting list is not that long though.
author: Alfona K.

description: Visiting San Francisco from out of town, and seeking a good Japanese restaurant in Japantown, I turned to yelp for a recommendation. Great job, yelp, this has to be the best ramen I've ever had! I enjoyed the hakata tonkotsu dx (spicy), and the hot green tea. It was incredibly flavorful and had a perfect balance of ingredients. The meat was tender and not too fatty, with a wonderful flavor enhanced by the broth, and the noodles were thin and perfectly al dente. The decor was attractive, and the service very friendly. Definitely worth a stop!
author: Jason R.

description: Good ramen! They only have a few things on the menu, but the soup base was so rich and hearty. Didn't try any appetizers or other food so cannot comment on anything other than the ramen. The service was good, but very crowded and can be a bit of a wait during peak hours. Also the seating is very close together and can get a bit loud, so for me, it's not the kind of place you sit for a long time chatting with your dining partner.
author: Judy H.

description: Was super excited to try this place, heard a lot of hype about it. Went around 12 on a weekday, and still had to wait about 45 mins to get in (although they were pretty quick considering how many people were waiting). Got the fried squid legs, which were a great start! they were delicious, I would suggest ordering another side of mayo for it as they do not give you nearly enough. Then ordered the Hakata Deluxe with Spicy broth. Took my first sip and choked on the harshness of the spice, but while it was spicy, they broth was still quite bland. There was nothing special about the noodles. The braised pork was very tender, yet overly sweet in my opinion, and although the egg was perfectly soft-boiled, it was quite bland as well. I expected this place to compare to the many ramen places I love in New York, but it fell short of my expectations. For San Francisco though, this place may be one of the only places to go for "quality" ramen.
author: Yeji S.

description: Best sf ramen. Prefer it over mensho. Pork is of great quality and they def put effort into the orders. The waits are always long so I recommend coming early, putting name down and then have a plan to wander around somewhere nearby before you get called
author: Anant P.

description: I seriously think this was the best thing I've ever eaten and they have amazing customer service.  Get there early to get in line.  The bill blew my mind with how low it was for that amazing dining experience.  Will return every time I'm in SF.
author: Dane N.

description: Perfection. Quick service. Arriving at noon on a Wednesday had about a 20 minute wait. We would have been happy waiting an hour or more. So good.
author: Kim R.

description: Went here at 11.30 am and there was a line. Got the chicken karage and pork ramen. Both were very tasty , service was pleasant and quick
author: Chris P.

description: Hakata ramen in NorCal is very rare, finally we have a few open now. Marufuku Ramen is the first ramen I tried with Hakata style ramen. Been there twice with two different people .. line always long, which is ok "since we don't mind to wait long for good food".  But sorry this is not the best. 1. Tonkatsu broth is a bit too salty ( I heard the guy next to me say that as well, even his friend said this is best ramen I tried at the beginning, then halfway I heard "aww..too salty and kept asking to refill water ) , 2. karaage chicken is a bit oily and over cooked but chicken itself is very good, squid leg is very good and fresh but again is a bit oily as well. I think twice is good enough for me, since I've had better experience with this kind of ramen from Japan, and SoCal have more choices and very short or no wait. (Not because I don't like the restaurant but I am pretty picky with ramen)
author: Vicki C.

description: Admit I don't know much about Ramen. But I just had the best damn bowls of noodles ever.
author: Alexander M.

description: Extremely long wait no matter when you.  That being said the ramen was super light and yummy, the broth was flavorful and the portion size was deceivingly big.  Go during off hours to truly appreciate the experience
author: Sarah N.

description: Extraordinary ramen. From the noodles to broth to the design and service. This place is exceptional.
author: Brian B.

description: The worst ramen I have ever eaten. The broth is incredibly salty, akin to drinking salt water. The noodles are mediocre and not handmade.
author: P L.

description: So, so good. The Hakata DX is my go-to. My friend ordered a Coke that came in a glass bottle, and the crisp, sweet bubbles paired surprisingly well with the salty, silky broth. The karage chicken app is also super tasty. Only downside is that there is usually a bit of a wait, and you have to stay right up at the door to catch them calling your name or they WILL move onto the next guest waiting. On the flipside, if the group in front of you isn't around and you are, this is actually kind of awesome haha.
author: Sara F.

description: Definitely my new ramen spot!!! Long line out the door but it's sooo worth the wait. They call and text you when you're table is ready. Their service and broth is the best I've had at a ramen parlor.
author: Suzie A.

description: Waited nearly and hour and a half. Got the hakata tonkotsu & geso fry.  It was good but it's not like wow this the best I've ever had. The soup was too salty for me, the noodle is thinner than the normal ramen but that was good. I would come back again if I happen to be in the area and if there is no line.
author: Sasa L.

description: this Is the second ramen place we've been to.  This place is amazing.  Soup is so good....
author: Des C.

description: I've been to so may Ramen places in Los Angeles, and all were great, but I never expected to come to San Francisco and have the best Ramen I've had!! The broth was made perfectly well, the pork belly was to die for!! The egg was excellent, I recommend anyone who comes to San Francisco to try this Ramen spot, you won't be disappointed!
author: Emmanuel A.

description: Super yummy! Also they can make vegan options. :)
author: anna b.

description: This is the worst experience I had in ever. I  have waited for more than one hour. And you know what, they gave the table to anywhere people and the REFUSE to give it to us. I am so mad and never come again. If you guys want to have that experience you are welcome to there
author: Zhang L.

description:
Great taste.
Best ramen noodle in town
author: Ha N.

description: The best ramen in the Bay Area, but Bay Area ramen is not good. This place has legit Japan tier ramen.
author: Matthew L.

description:
We are ramen lovers and been to Japan more than a dozen times in the past 10 years, always seek out good local ramen stores when we visit Japan... still, we are very impressed with this ramen store in SF Japantown.

The broth is the soul of the bowl, very rich, yet not greasy. We ordered a salad and fried chicken (karaage) for wife, and two deluxe noodle bowl for me and my teenager. The portion is definitely American size, a big bowl of noodle with all fixings plus a big grilled chicken quarter, needless to say my teenager was smiley and satisfied.

The noodle is Hakata style thin noodle, it's a bit thinner than regular ramen. To me, I feel it captures the flavor of broth better than thicker noodle, but apparently my Japanese friends all want to alert me it's different type. They do offer in spicy broth, which is not too spicy to my family's taste,  we really enjoy it.

Always a line waiting outside, don't let it discourage you. Worth the wait, will recommend, will definitely return.

Oh~ wife said, salad is excellent! Must try!
author: Leo L.

description: It's real. It's the best in the city, and it rivals SoCal's high-end places. The Hakata DX ($15) is a must. Not only is the soup rich and creamy and savory, but it doesn't leave a mouthful of fat and sticky umami in your mouth, like Tsujita does. All it leaves it deliciousness and a craving for more. I've read that service here isn't great, but it was super speedy and efficient for us. We arrived around 8pm on a Wednesday, and even with 13 parties ahead of us, a table for 2 was ready in about 40-45 minutes. Our waitress came by almost immediately, and we started with the squid legs and karaage. Both were fried perfectly and extremely succulent. The squid legs had the perfect texture of being springy and chewy without being overly cooked. The karaage was tops, as the batter was perfect, and the pieces were huge for an appetizer. The ramen itself though...what a delight. For an extra $5, you get corn and both the braised and the simmered pork. I prefer just the simmered, but the braised reminded me of home cooking. Don't forget to dig for your soft boiled egg as you're slurping up the thin noodles. Best ramen place in the city. Easily. I will be back to try and snag one of the 15 chicken paitan bowls per night.
author: Danny C.

description: Straight fire. The flavor of the broth here is as good as it gets, the only real complaint I have is that I personally don't particularly love the skinny type of ramen noodle that they use and wish they'd have an option for a thicker noodle. Other than that this place is great.
author: Jeffrey C.

description:
Service is very friendly - and fast, too!
We started with the takoyaki, which is my fave;
kaarage, and geso fry and shared the Hakata Tonkotsu DX - perfect  lunch for two. Oiishikatta!
C
author: Geri S.

description: 4.5 stars get the chicken deluxe, you are welcome! Your ramen comes with a side of piping hot chicken. If you are coming for lunch you'll want to get there around 11:55. This place gets packed around lunch time and you can easily wait an hour to eat. Plus there aren't a lot of tables. This place is delicious and you should give it a shot their food is seriously good. We did come here once when they asked us to move tables in the middle of our meal to make a large table for another group...not their best move it was awkward. Also we asked for no egg on the ramen due to an allergy and they forgot and there was an egg in the dish...they did bring us a whole new bowl of ramen but it was a little scary.
author: Lauren R.

description:
You can never go wrong with their Ramen, it's the best we had so far. But why 3*???

First, they served us with "used" small plates! This is unacceptable.

Second, make sure you compute the TIP on your own! Their calculation for example on 15% mark was overcharged by at least 50c. I don't mind giving higher for service, but come on that's fooling your customers! If you have your old receipts, check them to believe...
author: Paolo R.

description: absolutely amazing. make sure to get there before it opens because there is a line. I had both the fried chicken and fried squid. both were incredible I would highly recommend it.
author: Avery L.

description: Ok, there's always long line here thats why im curious why! So my daughter and I tried this noodle house.. let me share my experience, since there's a line you have to put your name at the waiting list then while you wait they will text you and i was amazed because you will know by your phone how long you still gonna wait before your turn (nice app) when we get inside they got our orders and  they are on a hurry ( i was pissed) we just got sit and looking for the menu and not yet decided what to order, then when we already place our order it so fast its just 5mins we already got our orders, when i taste the noodles nothing special in there! Im dissapointed! And where not yet done eating the server took my daughters bowl! Hello!! Where not yet done, how rude! And im not even asking for a receipt but they already put the receipt in our table, its because it has long line they want you to push away! Bad service! I dont recommend this place.
author: Jholor S.

description: The chicken paitan ramen was delicious!  Most tender and flavorful chicken I've tasted in ramen soup.
author: Melissa T.

description: I've tried a lot of different ramen spots in the city and this one is my favorite! Pretty much everything I've tried on the menu has been amazing. I love the fact that they have Japanese cider (soda), so nostalgic from drinking this as a kid. Be prepared to wait a bit, get there early and put your name down. Also, it gets really hot in there but so worth it.
author: Emilia R.

description: Extremely unhappy with the service. We were rushed-the waitress (the older woman) was on our case at all times and wanted us out. She rushed us to order, didnt feel like explaining the menu to us, rushed us with check and ignored us at all times when we asked for things. I would prefer to spend my money elsewhere.
author: Natalya V.

description: Long wait for this small Ramen eatery in the mall. We arrived at 11:25AM during a weekday and there was already a long line. We missed the first seating so waited about 25 minutes for a table to open. We had the chicken ramen served with a 1/2 chicken and the pork ramen. Nice flavorful broth. I ordered medium spicy and it was not spicy at all.. next time I'll order spicy. Overall a nice Ramen place. I think Coco's Ramen in Bernal is slightly better (and cheaper).
author: Autumn G.

description: Great broth and meat, but I have had better ramen before. The egg was more hard boiled than soft boiled. Not worth the 1.5 hour wait.
author: Lauren H.

description:
Great tasting ramen! The pork belly was delicious, a hearty portion. I can't wait to go back!

It's in the Japan Center mall on the second level.
author: M. M.

description: Ramen is pretty serious business, especially as Sydney, Australia, is in the midst of a ramen phase. I always enjoy hitting up ramen places all over the world, and certainly have favourite places in different cities. My preferred style is Hakata, almost as if the noodles are like al dente. Well, it was such a incredible delight to have enjoyed one of the best ramen bowls I've ever had in my life at Marufuku. The tonkotsu may be the go to, but the chicken paitan is well worth the try for something a little different, namely the chicken chashu. It's all supported by a simple, minimalist menu. Don't think twice. Try the food here, you won't regret it.
author: Tin P.

description:
4.5 popular with wait list.  nice to have another shop along the lines of mensho.  pork broth flavorful with large oil droplets but not too oily.  noodles almost too straight and thin without an alkaline bite.  but the additives onions menma etc were great, with a perfect runny center egg.
kakuni pork belly style too sweet actually.
author: Rob C.

description: Very good place to fill your hungry stomach.  Their ramen is very tasty and chewy to the right degree.  I love their soup, too.....Delicious!  Oh, and their teriyaki pork in their noodle soup is soft and tender.  This is definitely a very nice North East Asian cuisine you should try if you never had good North East Asian food.  :D
author: Alex S.

description: Great ramen. One of the best in Bay area. Wait is very long during popular times. Service is pretty good. Seating is good. Clean place. Small tables. Very quick service.
author: Joon P.

description: This is my favorite ramen in, not just Japantown, but the entire city. I come here 3 or 4 times every month. Their Hakata Tonkotsu is to die for. Plus extra chashu? Please! They deserve more than 5 stars!
author: Josh T.

description: The ramen broth at Marufuku is outstanding. It's flavorful and rich, the best I ever had. I especially like the thin ramen noodles used. The chicken karaage is very good. The restaurant is clean and nicely decorated; the wait staff is great. The reason I am not giving it five stars is because of the long wait time getting seated in this small restaurant. A great number of parties waiting are two people and most of the tables inside seat four. I believe when the wait time is over an hour, it would be advisable to allow table sharing. There are couple of booths that look to seat 6, but I saw parties of 2 seated. Moreover, the day I was there, the gal calling out the names had such a weak voice it was extremely difficult to hear her, let alone understanding her. If the party didn't respond in a split second (and I am not exaggerating), the name was crossed off and the next party called. We waited over an hour, I suppose it was worth it but I also believe it can be better managed.
author: Karen M.

description: Very delicious ramen with some ice cold matcha tea really hits the spot. The atmosphere is super laid back and very ethnic. Somewhat of a wait but still definitely recommend.
author: Michael C.

description: Omg this Ramen is life. That's all that needs to be said. Oh and the wait is worth it!
author: Vickay I.

description: Definitely one of the better ramen places around in SF but the wait was pretty long. Got there around 5:45 on a Saturday night and had to wait a little over an hour for a table of 4. Food came fairly quick. I ordered the tonkotsu dx and the broth was delicious. It had just the right amount of richness in flavor. The noodles are thin which allows it to soak up the flavor of the broth better. However, the egg and pork were a bit disappointing. Egg yolk was overcooked (maybe because i found it at the bottom of the bowl) and the pork belly wasn't melt-in-your-mouth soft. But otherwise the ramen was good. Don't be fooled by the bowl when you first get it. It's fairly deep so there's actually a lot of noodles.
author: Crystal Y.

description: Taste was very good in this restaurant. All our family members enjoyed the dishes and the service was very nice.
author: Santhiya V.

description: It's just like "OMG So freaking delicious!" I'm traveling SF from NY. New York has few famous/popular Japanese ramen places and I tried toto ramen & ippudo. But definitely Marufuku Ramen is THE BEST!! If you are craving for Japanese Ramen please go here!! Great service and Super delicious ramen will make your day :)*
author: Erica K.

description: Marufuku Ramen is the place to go when you are craving ramen! Decent price for what you get. It may look like its a small portion, but its actually more than it looks. Very filling and delicous. Also got a pork belly rice bowl to go very good but small portion. Service was quick and good, very friendly workers. Good vibes and everything. Lovely small place. Right across of Sophie's Crepes. 10/10 would come again!
author: Brandon W.

description: marufuku opened in sapporo-ya's old spot, and it's been getting a lot of attention on yelp. tried to come here a few weeks ago on a friday and was utterly astounded at the wait time, so we came back at 5:45 on a wednesday instead. no wait and were immediately seated at a table for 8, but whatever.  RAMEN TIME! note that there was a short wait when we left 30 minutes later.. marufuku specializes in hakata style ramen in tonkotsu or chicken paitan broth - so thin noodles with a lot of broth fattiness. we ordered (beers to start, obvi), chicken karaage, takoyaki, and spicy tonkotsu ramen (not DX).  i added menma and sweet corn nomsss cuz i like my ramen to resemble a salad. lol.. apps came out in good time, following by our piping bowls of noodles! an instagram and snapchat later, we dug in.  i think the flavor of the broth is pretty good!  fatty and rich in flavor, i drank every last drop.  however im just not a huge fan of thin noodles, so i left a bunch of those untouched.. overall, glad i tried marufuku..!
author: Christina L.

description: By all appearances the bowl of tonkotsu ramen brought over looked really promising - from the layout of the items in the bowl to the slightly contorted bowl. However, as I started enjoying it, the sweet tasking broth and sweetly marinated Cha shu really hit the wrong notes. It became hard to enjoy no matter how solid the pork base soup was.
author: Anthony W.

description: Quaint and a solid four star try but still I'm uncertain on the detail to daily freshness. I guess I would need a tour from one of the supporting sous who would spill the realities. No harm, But I can sense better to come. Worth a taste definitely!!
author: Clinton B.

description: They are using the thin ramen, it's pretty good. Just there's no AC in the whole building, we feel like had a meal in hot bath.
author: Xinyue Z.

description: It was very good. My first thoughts of a ramen place was. WTH am I doing spending so much on ramen noodle, but it changed my view because it was actually Ramen Noodle. The taste was outstanding and the atmosphere was suitable for family and dates alike. Being my first Ramen house I have been to I have probably spoiled myself and nothing would be quite as good as this place. There may be a wait, but even at the end of the night if you sign up before closing they will get you seated and it is worth the wait.
author: Chau M.

description:
The Hakata DX was most delicious. The soup (pork bone) base had the perfect amount of fat mixed in. The meat was nice and juicy. Highly recommend. 

Make sure to listen well for your name. The place echoes a lot. It seemed that a couple parties before us missed the spot in the queue because they weren't listing well.
author: Sean C.

description: Food is good. But there is no air conditioner. It is so hot inside, when the temperature reach to almost 100 degree outside.
author: Chen S.

description: Hakata Tonkatsu and Tori Paitan were good but is it worth the 1-1.5 hr wait? I think not. Get in line in time for the first seating because the line starts to build - fast.
author: Cyndi G.

description: Hakata Tonkatsu + corn and wasabi beer. Yum. Medium-bodied tonkatsu broth that is rich and creamy but not at all heavy. Really excellent broth. Nice sweetness on the chashu (simmered pork belly).Would have enjoyed the egg more if it were just slightly more soft boiled.
author: Chinthrilla M.

description: If you can get past the line, this place is pretty amazing. The service is really great, everyone is very polite. The ramen is superb.
author: Kort K.

description: Great ramen! Enjoyable atmosphere. A must visit in Japan town
author: Ana L.

description: The ramen is amazing! Service is pretty fast. If you come early (around noon on weekends) the wait isn't too bad (less than 1 hour). We just walk around Japantown until it's time for food. Definitely worth the wait and worth the price!
author: Kiky W.

description: Great ramen and fast service! This place is unique in the fact that they have amazing noodles. Almost every other ramen I've ordered in San Francisco has thick yellow noodles..I'm assuming they all use a similar provider. But Marufuku had authentic ramen with thin white noodles.
author: Maggie L.

description:
Worth the wait. Everything was prepared quickly, and it was amazing. Ramen broth was superb, and I am usually not a broth person. Had just the right amount of saltiness to it and it was smooth and creamy. Spice level was just right. 

The appetizers were amazing. Come with an empty stomach. Suggest getting apps and a bowl of ramen to share so you can try as many things as possible!
author: Stacy W.

description: Best ramen in sf! I got there right at 11:00 and it was packed. If you plan on eating at this place Go at least 20 minutes before they open or you would have to wait in line for about 30 minutes to an hour.
author: Tuyet T.

description: My new favorite ramen place in SF! The broth is the perfect taste, not over-salted or too thick.  The egg was AMAZINGLY delicious. Again, best ever! The line was a bit long though on July 4. We had to wait an hour before we got seated, so don't go there hungry since you're likely going to have to wait!
author: Irene C.

description: Probably the best ramen I've had in the Bay Area. It can get packed pretty fast, which is why I suggest going on a weekday. My go-to ramen from their menu is usually their Hakata. You. must. tryyyy. iiiit!!!
author: Geraldine G.

description:
Delicious tonkotsu and the staff is friendly but the wait can be very long.

For example, I rolled up at 8:45 pm on a Thursday and had to wait 15-20 minutes. Expect around an hour+ during peak times like lunch and dinner on weekends.

Best ramen in japantown though!
author: J F.

description: Super reasonable price for generous portion of ramen and a grilled chicken on the side. It's quite a small restaurant so be prepared to wait in line for your chance at this delicious restaurant.
author: Evelyn C.

description: Love the noodles and broth, they really live up to the hakata style. Noodles were the perfect consistency. My only gripe is that their char siu is sweetened and doesn't mix well with the savory broth. If you eat here, eat the char siu first and then dig into your noodles and soup.
author: Nona K.

description: Perfection! I'll be dreaming of this delicious bowl of ramen for days. Can't wait to come back and try a few more items, but you need a group because the ramen is so filling! It came hot and steamy, I had mild spicy but might go one notch higher next time. Also, it's a bit of a wait but cool shops to walk around once you've put your name on the list. WORTH THE WAIT!
author: Lisa B.

description:
Service like a Chinese restaurant during a fire. Now the food was outstanding and defiantly refreshing addition to Japan Town;BUT......

All five dishes came out to the table at the same time and the servers constantly reaching in front of my face take newly emptied. 

Clearly directed to do so by leadership because there where at least four different staff working our two top.

Too bad.
author: Tim P.

description: Decent ramen but its definitely not nearly as good as the overall rating states.  Mensho Tokyo Ramena and Iza Ramen are definitely higher caliber albeit at a higher price.
author: Yoichi N.

description: Some of the best ramen I've had. The broth was amazing and the pork belly was melt-in-your-mouth good. Service was good, and fast. Will definitely be back!
author: Valerie C.

description: We arrive 30 minutes before their doors opened and we were the third party to get in line. By the time it was 10 minutes until opening, the line to get in was insanely long. Once they opened, the waiter sat us according to the size of our party. Servers started coming out to take our orders in no particular order. It was frustrating that those seated first were not helped first after standing in line for half an hour. Once we got to order, our food came out pretty fast thankfully. The ambience is low key and cozy. The food was great; we'll definitely be back.
author: Alejandra R.

description: One of the best ramen i've ever tasted!!! Worth the wait. The broth was so delicious and tasty. I would definitely eat here again before i leave san francisco. Just make sure you come early as it gets busy but their service is fast so you might not wait that long.
author: Gem Marie D.

description: Delicious ramen and extremely filling. Service is quick once seated and the atmosphere is warm and friendly.
author: Armani C.
