description: LOVE THIS PLACE. It was definitely worth the wait. I had the hakata tonkotsu and this was probably one of the best ramen I've had. It taste homemade, not like it came from a powder packet or anything like that. Plus it came with braised pork and a soft boiled egg. YUM. They have 5 spicy levels. I got mild and it was just right. I don't have the biggest tolerance when it comes to spicy food, but I still wanted the kick. I definitely would come back here to try the chicken patain as well.
author: Christy P.

description:
found a good ramen in SF after a while!

servers are quick but come on weekdays for shorter queue
author: Felicia T.

description: Yeah, this place is pretty amazing. Came here on a Saturday not at all knowing it was some special anime event in Japantown, so we thought we'd be waiting forever to get in, but after putting our name down and walking around for about twenty minutes, our names were called! Super friendly customer service and outstanding ramen. And you must get the chicken karrage. I still drool just thinking about it...!
author: Caitlin M.

description: This is what I was looking for in Ramen.  Great flavor, the noodles were fantastic, and the egg was almost perfect (a little over done) or this would be five stars.  I may amend this once I go back if the egg is perfect.
author: Bryan G.

description: Great ramen with nice thin noodles and delicious broth. Well worth the wait time for a table.
author: Susan L.

description: Hella good #bless My fav ramen in SF. The tonkatsu and chicken ramen are good.  If you leave your name on the list and bop jtown or the neighborhood it's good for time. Nice staff too
author: J P.

description:
This is probably my second most favorite ramen place ever! Very close to number #1 but its so hard to decide. Came with a group of four on a Thursday lunch and we only had to wait about 5-10 minutes. We all ordered the tonkotsu hakata because we're pretty basic. The noodles were thin and chewy and I thought it was good but the highlight of the ramen was definitely the broth! Hearty and tasty and just the right amount of seasoning. 
The service was excellent! The waiters and waitresses made sure we got water when needed and checked on us often enough for us not to wave them down. That's awesome in my book. The pricing was fair for any typical ramen place ranging $11-15 a bowl depending on what you get. Probably the best ramen restaurant in Japantown hands down!
Oh and Ramen Dojo is my #1 but their service is not as good compared to Marufuku but their ramen is worth dealing with subpar customer service!
author: Anh P.

description: Highly recommend to anyone who loves ramen!! Try to get in line early though as the line builds up fast. Me and my friends got the tonkotsu
author: Suryatej G.

description: Ramen is amazing, but the line is ridiculous. Dare I say, worse than State Bird Provisions?  If you are eating during normal meal times, be prepared to wait at least 90 minutes.  With that said, it really is delicious.  We just try to go when it first opens and then it's not too bad.
author: Judy K.

description: The food was absolutely gorgeous. Their slow roasted pork broth is the perfect comfort food. Service is swift and atmosphere is pleasant.
author: Jemma L.

description: I love this restaurant.  We waited for 30 minutes or so (cos they have small restaurant and people are lined up outside to try their food) but it was worth the wait!!! I ordered takoyaki which was so amazing. Specially the sauce I almost licked the plate.. (I forgot to ask because I just ate everything quickly.. And also  hakata DX. (I don't wanna be so like a crtitic) so let's put it this way.Broth was amazing, noodles was perfectly cooked, soft boiled eggs (amazing), the meat..... Omg, the meat... It was so flavorful and tender. Love it!. And their sake, Dassai I think. I don't drink alot but I would say. That was good. Got me lil tipsy. Hahahah. I would surely comeback here...
author: Kim D.

description: Recommended by a friend's daughter.  We waited 40 minutes for lunch on a Friday afternoon.  The wait was well worth while!  The broth is unbelievably tasty.  Probably the best broth I've ever tasted.  The pork belly was sooooo good.  Not too fatty and loaded with flavor. Not too crazy about the thin noodles.  I prefer the standard ramen noodles.
author: Kim T.

description: Finally real tonkutsu soup based ramen in San Francisco. will definitely come again and again!
author: Brian C.

description: Ramen, menu options, service, atmosphere, were all fantastic.  It's slightly pricier than other ramen bars in the same area, but I thought it was worth it.  The only downside was the 45-60 minute wait on a Sunday night.  Perhaps a week night will be less crowded.
author: Annie R.

description: Pretty solid lunch spot for a day in SF. It has a nice ambience with chill soloistic jazz playing in the background. Though I was not particularly impressed by their noodle quality, I thought that the broth was great. Extra bamboo shoots are definitely worth, too!
author: Andrew L.

description: One of the best Ramen places in town. Pork and chicken broth are both excellent. Egg is perfectly cooked every time. Pork and chicken is slightly sweet. Long lines but they serve the Ramen almost instantly.
author: Klaus S.

description: One of the better ramen places I've been to! Don't let the appearance of the bowls fool you. They may look small, but it's actually a lot in depth. Will be back to try more!
author: Peggy M.

description:
excellent 
efficient 
if you can stop by the crepe place on the same floor for dessert
author: Daniel R.

description:
It definitely speaks artisanal, so if you're looking for old fashioned ramen it's probably not here. Despite being renovated to look hipster for the young folks but unfortunately I have to admit the old version of the restaurant was better than here. I don't even understand why there's such a long line to eat 4 kinds of mediocre ramen that doesn't even use thick ramen noodles. It's thin noodles. It tastes like I'm eating Chinese fried noodles my mouth was so conflicted. My egg still had a piece of eggshell on it; the best part of the ramen is supposed to be the egg but it was the saddest lumpiest egg I ever saw. 

The broth was okay though
author: Anna C.

description:
Went there for Sunday lunch. 

Waited for about 40 minutes. 

Good service and good ramen.
author: Ann L.

description: We decided on this place because of all the reviews and their rating, and when we saw the wait list and all the people waiting in line, we figured it must be really good! It wasn't bad by any means, but it wasn't anything great....so that was a little disappointing. I wouldn't really wait in the line again unless I had that much time to kill. Service was fast and efficient, I wouldn't say over top friendly or personable.
author: CJ B.

description: Great ramen!  Very tasty broth and good portions. I had the Hakata DX. Very good!  Also had chicken karage, which was tasty. Price was very reasonable and the staff was friendly. Only drawback was the huge waitlist but it went by fairly quickly for our 2-top. Waited about 40 min but was worth it.
author: Aaron N.

description: This ramen place is very crowded and often see many customers signing in and waiting.  They are not very big, but their ramen was very good.  Everything in a ramen with the flavor of the soup, egg cooked perfectly, and pork melts in your mouth.  We ordered the tonkatsu and miso ramen.  They were fast and located downstairs lower level west side or the mall.  I would highly recommend trying them.
author: FG L.

description: Yay! A new ramen shop that features a white chicken broth . Delicious . There have been a lot of places opening up that do Tonkotsu ramen but not many that feature the thick white chicken paitan . I am so happy! This will be my destination on days I break my gluten free diet.
author: Ina D.

description: Good long wait for this place, but its worth it. Very good flavor and good chicken. Its honestly the best ramen I have had. The combination is just great. Think and well cooked noddles. Good meat
author: Andrew M.

description:
The wait: 1.5 hours
The date: Saturday, 5/27
The people: 5 
The seats: booth 
The food: solid noodles, okay broth (could have been more flavorful), delicious meat (kakuni). The egg was fantastic. We also go the karaage which I thought the chicken was a bit tough for my tastes.

This place is good enough for me to come back for a ramen fix, but I'm not sure I would want to wait that long again. I was slightly peeved since it doesn't seem like the staff figured out how to optimally seat people. We had to wait an extra 20 minutes because they didn't want to add a chair to the usual 4 person tables - which I could understand for some of the 4 person tables right next to one another but there was one by the window that was large enough to fit 5. When we finally got seated we also noticed a party of 2 sitting in an identical large booth right behind us (wuttttt)
author: A Y.

description: This place is a gem!! We were visiting the golden gate park and happened to found this place close by so we decided to atop by for lunch. The place is really small and only one girl is serving all the tables but you can tell it's a place that people in the neighborhood would come very often. And their food is AMAZING! All the ramens and appetizers were awesome and if you just happened to come to the neighborhood definitely give it a try!
author: Jessica G.

description: Went here with my girlfriend. Wait time was about an hour, I know super long, so what we did was put our name down on the sign in sheet and we hung around the Japanese town area, went to some shops, got a crepe. We got back and the lady in front kindly seated us. As for the ramen, probably top 3 I've ever had. Super recommend.
author: Loren C.

description: The best Ramen ever!!! They have upgraded the interior so now it's the best Ramen ever in a really cool atmosphere. The service is great too.
author: Babs P.

description: I always had dreams to have a delicacy that would get me wanting more. I stumbled on this restaurant, and I will never regret knowing it. It will remain my best place always. It is a place to visit always when I am on any trip. It's the best.
author: Kibegwa M.

description: I went to there it was first time . Ramen is okay but noodle was very thin it not my favorite. BUT!! One waitress was amazing service!! She is very knowledgeable about Ramen , SF ...oh everything. She is completely professional service. Other two waitress, they never smile to me and I can not understand what they say??? But another one of waitress Minako ( she told me she is new!!!?? Unbelievable!!) I definitely will come back again with more my co worker or friends!! Thank you Minako and Marufuku!!
author: Yummy H.

description:
I tried the takoyaki and Hakata DX ramen and added a bamboo shoots to go. Their service was extremely fast. I think within 5 min my order was ready. 

To-go wise, the takoyaki was pretty good, especially since I ate it when it was still hot. It had a slight crunch on the outside and was soft inside. Proportion of octopus to dough was not bad, though there could always be a bit more octopus!

Ramen was not exactly what I was hoping for, which could be a result of several reasons. 
1) I know I ordered to go which may make a difference. However, what disappointed me most were the noodles. When they pack to go, they separate the noodles and meat from the soup. But within the short duration from picking up my order to eating it (maybe 10 min), the noodles were already extremely stuck together and none of the meat or other additions were hot. Even the hot soup could not loosen them entirely, resulting in huge chunks of noodle stuck together. This leads me to think that the to go orders are not quite made to order. Rather, they pre-prepare the noodles, meat, and other additions and just scoop up a container of soup when you order to go. 
2) the soft egg! Could be because I've tried many different ramen places but I definitely was thinking of something different. The egg they have is cold and it's not really RUNNY. It is soft, but it just wasn't quite what I was hoping for.

Reviewing the pork... I actually liked the Chasu pork better than the braised pork belly, only reason being that half the pieces of pork belly I got in my order the tougher leaner pieces of pork belly and not the tender fatty pieces. However, the tender pieces were definitely good! Just a matter of getting the right pieces. 

Overall, this was okay to me as to go. Could be because I had different hopes and expectations for ramen that this was not amazing to me. But, if you want something fast and to avoid the line, I would recommend at least trying this place as to go. 

However, one day I do hope to try this again, actually waiting the full duration in line, to see if there will be a huge difference. Until next time...
author: Cynthia Y.

description: Wonderful experience.   Short wait time if arriving just before or shortly after opening. The broth was delicately balanced, and staff was very attentive. Will be going back.
author: Jason C.

description: I ordered some fired calamari, a rice bowl, and a pork ramen. The ramen was fantastic! Even after I went to many Japanese ramen restaurants in New York, I thought the ramen here was great. The price was also affordable. The ramen was just about $16. The total was around $40. This is a great place. The only downside was that we waited for about 30 mins.
author: Zhong Z.

description: Legit Ramen. Best yet inSF in my opinion. Line could be long during weekends but moves fast. Ordered the Hakata DX. You will not be disappointed.
author: Jay Y.

description: Put our name down at opening and still waited 1.5hrs for the table! Worth the wait though. Hands down the best ramen I have ever eaten.
author: Caroline B.

description: Probably good food but the woman in the front taking everyones name is super rude... bad attitude. People come to eat food but also experience. So why ruin the experience?
author: Abby L.

description: I ordered the Hakata Tonkotsu in mild & it was amazing! The pork was so flavorful and very tender & the soft boiled egg that came with the ramen was delicious! It honestly didn't look like a lot when you first get the bowl, trust me there's a lot, the bowl is pretty deep. The service was fast, my friend & I got our food in 5-10 minutes.
author: Geoffrey O.

description: Hands down, best ramen I've ever had. Their pork belly was so tender and tasty. We're from out of town, so glad we found this gem of a place. This will now be a must on our future visits to San Fran!
author: Nelson V.

description: We had a nice lunch. We drove down from Santa Rosa and stood in line for over an hour because of the reviews. Was it worth it? Not sure. The ramen was good, but it wasn't out of this world. Still, we may be back to try it again when we have the craving for Tonkatsu Ramen.
author: Brittany K.

description: Ordered the Chicken DX, absolutely worth it.  Fantastic and worth a visit.  Don't be fooled by the odd location upstairs in a mall/shopping center.  If you are looking for good ramen, especially chicken ramen, this place is great.
author: Chris E.

description: the wait is FOREVER but if you get on the waitlist on yelp before you go it's a smart move. the pork broth is my favorite.
author: Wendy L.

description: Amazing ramen! The restaurant is quite popular, and we had to wait about half an hour for a table of two at dinner time. Totally worth the wait, though!
author: Ellen F.

description: Hands down one of the best ramen spots I've ever been to! Food for the soul! Most ramen places have a small ramen to broth ratio, but Marufuku gives you more than enough. I recommend the Hakata Deluxe. The kicker here was the pork belly which was caramelized in a sweet glaze, which gave a greater umami flavor. Texture of corn and kikurage mushroom was a perfect compliment to the deep rich broth and perfect hakata style ramen. This is a must try! Will definitely come back when I'm in town!
author: Joshua I.

description: I don't quite understand the hype with this place. The ramen was inauthentic but affordable. They were very accommodating to my friend's vegetarian requests.
author: Tiffany W.

description: THIS PLACE IS SO GOOD. I don't understand anyone who gives 4 stars for having a slow line. If you do not want to wait so long, I'd recommend coming around lunch time. The weekends is usually when the restaurant is packed. If you don't like waiting don't come here. There are plenty of restaurants in Japan town. However, the ramen in this restaurant is definitely worth it for me. Coming to the restaurant at the right time will save you the wait. I'm pretty sure the popularity will die down and I will be able to enjoy the food more often.
author: Kyle K.

description: Great ramen and fast service. Good price for value. Expect to wait in line during busy hours, especially in the evening.
author: Daniel M.

description: Waited over an hour but well worth it! Food was amazing and didn't wait long once ordered. Servers are prompt and friendly. Ambiance is cozy...feels like you're in a big ass living room.
author: Joseph M.

description: Yep, the chicken paitan was delicious. The egg was cooked perfectly and the broth was yummy. I ordered the broth spicy, and it wasn't actually too spicy. I showed up a little before 11:30 am hoping to beat the lunch rush and got seated along with the rest of the line when the doors opened. I'll definitely be back!
author: Julie B.

description: service is fast and accommodating. they were pretty busy when we came in, but we are still welcome with smiles, and gave us a sit right away. we ordered chicked ramen, Tonkotsu Ramen and Karaage. and it was delesh!!! ill definitely come back again.
author: Mary Jade D.

description:
I loooved this ramen.  There was a line of course, but it was worth the 30 minute wait. These guys are super fast and the service was great. They serve thin noodles, which I didn't have a problem with because they were delicious. I'm not a fan of eggs, but this soft boiled egg soaked up all the yummy broth and was a welcome addition to the mushrooms, bean sprouts, and pork belly. I ordered it spicy, which it was not, but they have a spicy sprinkle on the table which took it up a notch. 

My husband got takoyaki and a kakuni bowl, and he loved them both. There was A LOT of bonito flakes on the takoyaki; easy enough to scrape off. 

Eat here!
author: Leah V.

description: 2.5 The photos and reviews made me want to try the place. Unfortunately, my taste buds say otherwise. The tonkatsu ramen was so so. Broth was not the best I had but it wasn't too thick which was good. Noodles were not bad. Chasui was thinly sliced and too sweet for me. The whole egg was alright but a bit too sweet as well. The soy sauce chicken leg was meh. Presentation is nice but the taste wise not so much. Ramen is a good portion and pricing is good. The place is really small so if you arrive at rush hour.... good luck with waiting.
author: Ann L.

description: Loved it! Went for dinner and the portions are decent. Only concern was the waitress wasn't as informed as id hope
author: Sara H.

description: The wait was long about 1.5 hours. Food was ok. Karage was actually pretty good but the ramen was so bland. It was stupidly bland. I dont get the majority of the reviews or hype about this place. The noodles arent traditional ramen noodles and the soup is so plain, you'd get more flavor from a ramen soup base packet. Ive had my share of many ramen places in the entire bay area and I still rank Ramen Parlor or Ramen Dojo as number 1. Theres depth in their soup. This soup from Marufuku is just too 2 dimensional. If you must try it, try it. You can be the jugde but dont trust yelp reviews too much. We may consider if we are desperate and have zero wait time but I think we still rather go to izumiya or eat something else.
author: Victor T.

description: I don't get ramen very often, but when I do, I want to go to Marufuku Ramen. I like everything about their ramen. Both their chicken and pork are extremely tender and flavorful and pair well with the different broths. The noodles have a great consistency and leave you satisfied. Additionally, they get your ramen to your table quickly, which helps you get into the restaurant when there's a long wait and ensures you aren't waiting very long to eat.
author: Reilly C.

description: The wait was about 2 hrs on a weekend. Chicken paitan was even more flavorful than the tonkotsu broth. I was surprised to have enjoyed Chicken paitan so much because tonkatsu is usually my preference. If only they could allow for people to leave their numbers to get a text instead of using the paper signups to wait. Also the place seemed small with layout so added to the long wait. It seems like they could benefit from redecorating or repositioning the layout to include for more tables and chairs. Service was quick and pretty good.
author: Peachie Y.

description:
Terrible wait experience. Super disorganized and they would just read the same list over and over (in a whisper) for people that put their names down who knows when. 

I normally don't write reviews but I felt like I needed to share my experience. Food was good but Being left on a cliffhanger of whether or not we would be seated wasn't enjoyable.
author: David M.

description: Outstanding ramen! Medium spicy would have been slightly too spicy for my 13 year old but perfect for me. Not sure where else you could go to get better.
author: Sarah F.

description: The place's minimalistic design is beautiful. The food's simplicity is a great expression of Japanese relentless pursuit of excellence. Visit this place, you will not regret it!!!
author: S D.

description: Feels like an authentic ramen experience.  Handled our food allergies well.  Worth the wait.
author: Leslie G.

description: Maru-freakin'-good. On par with Santa Ramen and Ramen Dojo. Expect about a 45 minute wait if you are not here at 5:30 when they open.
author: M.A. L.

description: New hot spot in Japantown. Their ramen is so good that its worth waiting in line for an hour. They bring you food in less than 15min. Reasonable and delicious food
author: Sonya T.

description: Hands down best ramen I've had!! Even better then authentic ones in hawaii. Their octopus balls are bomb!
author: Yelena L.

description: Really like this Ramon place. Thumps up for the great experience we had. Probably will come back in the future.
author: Laura J.

description: Ended up here as the location was great easy to find. I think this was one of the best ramen places I've tried! So many different options with ramen. Service was great and presentation was on point! I would highly recommend this to anyone who is looking for a place to eat some ramen!
author: Jennie K.

description:
This place is in the mall, but too new for the mall directory so it can be hard to find. It's near the elevator.
There are 4 ramen options. I had the braised pork belly and it was delicious! Greasy, but worth the calories. The broth is very flavorful, the egg is perfectly cooked, and the corn is a sweet contrast to the other flavors. The noodles are... noodles.
author: Laura P.

description: Yelp waitlist says there were like 52 parties ahead of us. Really?  And we made their at noon. Maybe next time we will be there at 10:30 to be number 5...
author: Mike N.

description: Yum!  Saw a line here one time, and decided to try it on another day we were at Japan center early-ish; lined up with party of 4 at 1125 and were seated as soon as they opened at 1130.  Chicken DX comes with a big thing of barbecued chicken; I think pork DX came with softer braised pork.  (We had regular chicken, regular pork, and both dx versions.). Delish broth for both chicken and pork, loved the soft boiled egg (dig for it!).  Spicy broth was great, actually spicy without being overpowering.  My daughter also liked the fried squid appetizer and I liked the salad.
author: Jen G.

description: It's not bad, but Santouka over in the east coast makes better ramen. I'm giving it two starts because the wait for 2 was over an hour long, the place we were sitting smelled like wet towels, and my friend and I both had diarrhea after eating the heavily oily ramen. I can't even think about this ramen now without feeling queasy. You'll spend around $19 here for the pork ramen and half an appetizer.
author: Y W.

description:
I liked this place very much.  I'm willing to bet that the people leaving bad reviews where expecting a different type of ramen, and dispite their "knowlage" of ramen never had this particular type. It's always a big let down when you don't get what you expect, especially If you aren't open to releasing expectations in the first place. Also we all have different tastes and it's fair to say some people just don't like this style, and I suppose if you don't like it you have no choice but to right a bad review if you choose to write one. 
I thought the ramen was exceptional. I stumbled in there by accident and the experience was nice all around. The staff was friendly, but not too bothersome, the ambiance was nice as well. Even the serving bowls added a nice touch to the experience. I didn't even have to wait in line because of good timing, so I'm sure that helped as well. I don't have anything bad to say about the restaurant or it's food. Thank you!!
author: Timothy C.

description: This place is so worth the wait. Put your name on the list and go shopping for you favorite incense or that special pair of chopsticks. The place is crowded and yet everyone is happy and smiling and enjoying their amazing meal. Highly recommend it!!!
author: Tonya C.

description:
I really want to give this place at least 4 stars, but there is a key component I was not pleased with. I would probably give it a 3.5. We got the Hakata Tonkotsu (simmered pork belly), Hakata DX (braised pork belly), and chicken karage.
Karage had big chunks of juicy meat and was pretty good. For both ramen, we ordered the spicy level and agreed that the broth was deep, rich, and full of flavor. It was one of the best broths I've had! I liked how it was rich, but not too oily. Our main complaint was the the noodles. They were thin like angel hair pasta and not at all like the traditional chewy ramen. As good as the broth was, the noodles soured the experience. ..
To sum it up...
Pros: ramen broth, braised pork belly (in the ramen), chicken karage, decor
Cons: noodles
author: Stephanie K.

description: I had the Hakata Ramen DX which is made with a tonkatsu broth and had chashu and braised pork. The meat was tender and the braised pork was flavorful. I ordered ultra spicy but it wasn't spicy at all. Overall the ambience was great and the broth was tasty. I will definitely be back.
author: Alison P.

description: Love Love Love this tiny place. Expect a wait and be sure to write your name down on the clipboard list. You can browse the great Japanese bookstore across the way while you wait. While there are a limited number of selections on the menu, the it is for a good reason: everything they offer is delicious and clearly the broth for the ramen takes time to prepare. Service is extremely quick, so even if you had to wait to get in your food is sure to be delivered quickly.
author: D W.

description:
suggested tip amount is incorrect.
good portions.
i was not a fan of the flavor.
egg was perfect.
fried squid was good.
but the suggested tip is incorrect.
author: Bruce W.

description: It was ok, we did wait a while which we expected after reading the reviews. The ramen was good, but not great. Wasn't thrilled
author: Tkpasq P.

description: The marufuku ramen is so Marufuku'n good. Very delicious broth. The wait times are murufuku'n long. But so worth it.
author: Upkar L.

description: The service was quick and the wait people were extremely pleasant.  My family and didnt particularly enjoy the food and the ramen was underwhelming.  The food was somewhat bland and greasy.
author: Cybelle M.

description: Worth the wait! Super fast, friendly service, and the ramen was the best we've ever had.
author: Staci H.

description: Best ramen I have ever ate.  We travel from the Central Valley to eat here.  Seriously, I have dreamed about the broth.  The flavor of the broth is amazing.
author: David C.

description: Best ramen I've had, much flavor, nice atmosphere, service was very nice. Long line, but worth the wait.
author: Eric M.

description: Chicken paitan deluxe came with a separate sizzling plate of chicken. Top two best ramen of my life.
author: Tera D.

description: The best part of this ramen place are the nice pics on the website ... those noodles are not ramen , the DX pork shouldn't be cold in the broth and the pickled items are flavorless. Go to Ramen Bar if you want to pay $15 for a great bowl of ramen. Marafuku = Tourist one and done.
author: Roger B.

description: Not my favorite ramen place. I got the Hakata DX ramen and I'm not sure I'm a fan of the extra thin noodles they use. The broth was creamy but heavy on the ginger. Though the Geso was pretty good, I wish the portion was slightly larger. Overall everything was just ok. I don't think I'll be back.
author: Joyce L.

description: Chicken Patina DX is totally worth it. A bowl of ramen plus a roast chicken at the side for about $15. However, there are only 15 of those per day.
author: Tim C.

description: I am a fan of Orenchi And Santouka but this place hit the spot. The soup and char siu were on point, but I wish they had an option for thick noodles. The ramen was still very enjoyable.
author: Teresa L.

description: Best ramen I've had outside of Japan. This time I tried the chicken paitan ramen with chicken chashu. Delicious is an understatement. The chashu chicken just fell off the bone. Flavors were rich and deep. My wife had the Jakata DX again. The eggs are cooked perfectly leaving the center custard. Service is fast and efficient. Don't be turned off by the line to get in. Plan ahead. If you can try to get there before they open. It's worth the wait!
author: Randy C.

description: You're lunch hours are way too short. 11-3 would be better customer service in particular with your long lines.
author: Nancy R.

description: Last time i visited the service was good, the place is comfortable...
author: Dennis H.

description: This place has the best ramen in town. A little hard to find but the food is worth it. Great service as well. Will definitely be back.
author: Eric V.

description: 10/20/17: Staying at Inn of the Opera on girls school break. Came back to J Town to buy books. Saw the long lines so decided to give it a try. Girls had Chicken Paitan, wife had Hakata Tonkotsu, and I had Tonkotsu Deluxe has nice chucks of pork fat with meat ( salty). All our meals were excellent and worth eating here. Next time try Chicken Paitan DX ramen served with nice rasted chicken on side. They only make 15 per day. They looked yummy
author: Phil S.

description: Great customer service. The ramen noodles as some other reviewers had pointed out were truly mediocre at best. They tasted like supermarket package ramen noodles. The grilled chicken leg was good. Pork belly was dry, and tonkotsu soup was alright. However, the customer service was very good. My water was always filled.
author: GR Z.

description:
Good Food,
Hands down one of the best bowls of ramen I've had in a while. I think this might be my new favorite!! 

I ordered the Hakata Tonkotsu ($11) in medium spicy. The food came out in minutes and when I took my first sip of the broth, my eyes literally widened like O_O... because it was SO GOOD!!!! I can't begin to explain how I savored
author: Reshma B.

description: Excellent service. Accepted my party despite being 15 mins before their 3pm closing. I highly recommend the Hakata DX ask for it spicy!
author: Nick B.

description:
This place was amazing. The best food I had during my trip. I recommend the pork ramen, it's quite filling on its own but the broth is so good you drink the whole thing.  If your a big eater they actually will refill your noodles for a small fee.  Just don't finish your broth.

Their kragage is not that special stick with the ramen.
author: Kirby K.

description: Amazing ramen. Had the pork and chicken broth and loved both. Will be back.
author: Ben G.

description: Overall a good experience. The price was very affordable and the ramen broth was very nice, but the ramen noodles are too thin for my personal taste. The karaage was good and did not taste overwhelmed by the flour layer and oil.
author: Miu K.

description: Fantastic Greek food in a tiny space. Great for takeaway or dining in if you can snag a table. Their rotisserie chicken and chicken juice potatoes are excellent, but you can't go wrong with anything you order. Staff is friendly and service is quick as well.
author: Penny S.

description: Everything was great!! Great service by checking on customers and being welcoming. Gorgeous interior design, traditional with a modern feel. Karage and fries squid was perfect portion and crispy. Love the buttery pork meat and ramen was good although I prefer thicker ramen noodles. I definitely recommend this place and will be back!!
author: Karen J.

description: So ya food was great. The pork rice bowl was delicious. The pork was tender and the sauce in the rice was great. Both complimented each other well. The chicken was nice and juicy, with little oil. Combined with the hint of sourness from the lemon and the taste of  mayonnaise gave it a nice taste. Lastly the ramen. It was a smaller portion than the mall, but had more noodles, which gave more of a balance of noodle and broth. It was also nice and spicy as well as not as salty as the place downtown.
author: Akash P.

description: I had the Hakata xd. Looking at the menu there were choices on how spicy you would want the broth. So I asked the waitress on what would she recommend and she responded "no spicy, so you could taste the broth." She was right. I would break down this review from the broth, noodles and toppings but I'm not going to do that. This bowl is food porn not for your eyes but your palate. Utmost respect is given to the use of pork in this dish. You taste that the pigs were happy to be in this bowl for this is their ascension to heaven.
author: Gio B.

description: Wow!!! So flavorful, delicious and filling. The broth is outrageous with a great depth of flavor. I highly recommend this little gem.
author: Holly T.

description: Price is very reasonable! Their ramen is great, but I personally like thicker noodle, and they only have thin noodle which is the reason I took away a point.. if they have the choice of thick or thin noodle and if they introduce gyoza in their menu, this place will be much better!!!
author: Shinji K.

description: marufuku ramen is on the 2nd floor of the kinokuniya building. 2nd floor meaning not including garage. please head upstairs where the kinokuniya book store is located. at the top of the stairs on your right you'll see the mugizo udon restaurant, marufuku is located on at the corner. you'll usually see a long line in front.
author: Alice C.

description: This place was reasonably good. It wasn't drop dead amazing. I don't remember the flavors, now that I've left the restaurant, like some other places.
author: Betty V.

description:
If it's any one thing I take back from my trip to San Francisco, this place is definitely one of the flavors I remember the most. Don't get me wrong, there were plenty of places I came for my first time in the city (and I'm from LA), but there was definitely an impression left by this small humble ramen shop that I won't forget. 

The place, first off, is typical of a lot of ramen places I've been to. Very clean and professional workers, we were greeted promptly and sat down after waiting. I would say dinner is an awesome time to go because of the cooler weather, and you get to drink with it which is great for warming up as well. 

I ordered the chicken ramen Dx with a side of chicken karaage bowl. I have to say, this is one of the most unique bowls of ramen I've had, as I'm use to and love hakata style ramen. It comes with a big fat chicken leg and the broth is delicious. The egg is soft boiled to perfection and all the ingredients gave better flavor to the rich and not too robust flavor of the chicken broth. I would definitely recommend this option if you like heartier broths, but don't want to get the typical pork one. My friend ordered the hakata ramen and it was just as good as the chicken one. Pork was perfectly cooked and the slices were generous. Quality of the broth was excellent as well. I would say this ramen pars as one of the best I've had and ranks number 1 in my opinion, when it comes to chicken base. The karaage chicken was very good too, but it was a little dry because it's chicken breast. Regardless, there is plenty of flavor and all the food came out FRESH which is an absolute must for me when it comes to getting the best ramen experience!
author: Anthony E.

description: Finally!!! Some Hakata Tonkatsu Ramen! My favorite. My hometown is in Orange County, and I was a regular at a popular place called Shin Sen Gumi (also a Hakata Ramen house). I've been in the city for 4 years, and Marafuku Ramen is the only ramen place I've found comparable to Shin Sen Gumi. I most definitely will be returning since I live nearby! So stoked :-)
author: Mika C.

description:
Yes! This will now be our go to place for ramen!
The chicken paitan was very good:
Great, hot, flavorful soup without being too salty. 
Thin, al dente noodles. The two slices of chicken were soft, and flavorful. So good. Egg was yolky. Love the cooked bean sprouts too in the ramen. Going mild spicy was good b/c we could still taste the flavor of the soup with a slight hint of spice. 

My husband had the tonkatsu earlier and he thought it was creamy and delicious. (Though I think I'd prefer the chicken slices in the paitan than the tonkatsu which had fattier thin slices of pork.)

We saw the next table order their ramen with the chicken leg, though it looked good, we passed on it. 
We ordered the pork belly rice bowl and karaage rice bowl. They were just ok (would have like more sauce for more flavor). Will skip the bowls next time. 

Great service, everyone was so friendly. There were people in line outside, but it seemed like the line moved fast (you're also inside a mall, so it's it too bad if you had to wait). 

I can see why some people compared this to shinsengumi in LA, but I think this is much better. The thin noodles and soup sort of reminds me of Ichiran in Japan (but I don't think anyone can top Ichiran for us :) Flavor-wise, like this much more than Dojo in San Mateo.

Prices, portions, and toppings were reasonable for SF that would make us want to make this our go to for ramen. We're taking Dojo off the rotation.
We'll definitely be back at Marufuku.
author: Minh D.

description: Very authentic and delicious ramen. We kept ordering more and more. The wait was a bit long, but very much worth it. My brother was super happy eating it, and everyone else also seemed to be really enjoying it.
author: Natalia G.

description: service was good, prices were okay, and the food was good. My only issue was the greasiness of the food.
author: Jan A.

description: I came 2 weeks ago on Friday night with my family. The waiting line is very Long. We wait  about a hour to get a table. I order the Hakada Dx. Everything taste too sweet in the ramen bowl. Broth and noodle are just normal, nothing special.
author: Kiki Y.

description: I tried the Octopus Balls (Takoyaki) and the Hakata Tonkotsu Ramen medium spicy. It was all prepared promptly and tasted amazing. Will def come back again
author: Karan C.

description: Stopped in here with my son and brother and. Hold not have been more pleased. Service was above and beyond and ramen was perfect !
author: Laamake L.

description:
fried chicken was surprisingly so good! broth was amazing although i do prefer curly and thicker ramen noodles. but despite that, everything was really delicious. 

super long line but it was worth it ;)
author: b r.

description: This was the best ramen soup I've ever had! I can't wait to go back!!!!! The pork was delicious and the soup was very flavorful. Good service!
author: Danai P.

description: Well worth the wait. Delicious full bodied broth. Thin noodles. Wonderful everything!
author: S T.

description: Very good chicken ramen and the chicken that comes with the deluxe ramen is delicious. Bit of a wait.
author: jones z.

description: This is hands down, the best ramen I have ever had. The noodles are the perfect texture and the broths are amazing. I live in Southern California and will have to wait until my next visit for a great bowl of ramen.
author: Kathleen C.

description: I am not a Ramen expert, but this place really rocks. We were going to a show at the Fillmore, so dining at Japantown was a natural. We got there around 6:15 on a Tuesday night, and the wait was about 10 minutes to be seated. My friend and I both ordered the pork ramen (I got the DX version) and we split the squid legs. The soup is the richest, most delicious and complex soup I've ever tasted. Really good. I was a little unsure about the concept of pork belly, but it's sort of bacon-like, delicious and even a bit delicate. There were tons of other things like sprouts, a soft boiled egg, corn and so forth in the soup. I was hungry, and couldn't even finish the whole bowl. Squid also good! So if you're in the area, and looking for some good Japanese food, check them out!
author: Daniel O.

description: We went to the restaurant after watching a Netflix Chef Table on a Ramen noodle restaurant. Marufuku did not disappoint. There were so many layers of flavor. The line was worth the wait!
author: nikki s.

description: Personally, this is just 3.5 stars.  I had more delicious ramen in San Mateo n in LA.  We had a party of 9, we're lining up 4:50pm, didn't get seated about 5:45pm.  I thought the grilled thigh chicken combo with ramen would be gone then but they still have 12 left, OMG.  We ordered 3 orders of that.  I like their appetizers then ramens n soup mean.  Ramen soup is okay, good noodle texture, sweet pork (meat).  Not of us like the grilled thigh chicken, it was sweet too, no wonder they had so many to sell during 6pm.  For the price combo of the thigh chicken with ramen is reasonable.  The line makes it overrated.  See it for yourself.
author: L. C.

description: This place is bomb. We came here when it first opened and weeks later, the line was huge. The pork Tonkotsu is so flavorful, and I personally prefer the straight, thin, al dente noodles. Unfortunately the line is long, but it does move relatively fast. I try to explore Japan Center while I wait or come early when it opens on Sunday
author: A B.

description: We ordered the Hakata Tonkatsu and the Hakata DX.  The Ramen noodles are the thin style and lacks the characteristic "bite" of the thick noodles that I favor.  The braised pork, simmered pork and egg had the reminiscent salty sweet Chinese five spice seasoning that is reminiscent of Chinese instead of Japanese cuisine.  Both the braised and simmered pork was tough and dry, as if cooked hot and fast, thus not allowing the fat and connective tissue to render slowly and remain in the meat.  The best part of the Ramen was the broth, but like most types of food that uses a lot of salt, the subtleties of flavors are often hidden.  Overall, this a decent for San Francisco, but isn't as good as the ramen from Orenchi and Halu in Santa Clara.
author: Jimmy P.

description: Be prepared for a wait during the lunch menu, and to me, that's what makes a good restaurant the best. It is located on the second floor of the mall and don't let that fool you. I had a type of chicken ramen from the lunch menu. I can't say nor spell the name as well as some Japanese Fried Chicken as an appetizer which I can't say or spell either. The food was brought out pretty quickly. I would have liked the appetizer before the main dish so it was a true appetizer. The ramen is out of this world delicious. It's not like anything I have ever had. The noodles were firm and flavorful and they were more straight than curly. They make the spiciness to your preference and it was perfect for the level. The wait can be rough if you are starving and I mean the wait I so worth it! I sat next to a women who said she had been to Japan 4 times and this place was better than anything she had in Japan so I hope that helps you choose this little slice of deliciousness.
author: Nikki G.

description: Probably a little better than 4 stars.  Thin noodles, excellent meat.  The sauce for the karaage was a little too much like honey mustard.
author: Alison D.

description:
A unique ramen spot. Noodles are thinner than I'm used to and I'm still not sure how I feel about that.
Ramen portions = huge. We were a little confused between their ramen options. Regular vs DX so in case you were wondering, DX has more meat, corn and some other ingredients added in. I got the Hakata Tonkotsu which did not disappoint! Will have to try their chicken based ramen next time. 
They take their spiciness seriously. I believe they have mild, medium, spicy and ultra spicy. I normally eat pretty spicy, and judging by experience, most restaurants in america have their spiciness scale off, so I ordered spicy thinking it would taste most like a medium. But was actually pleasantly surprised by the spiciness of it.  Another friend got ultra spicy and that was a bit too much to be enjoyable for me 
I loved the spicy cod roe rice bowl, well priced and SPICY 
Lastly: be prepared for long waits. Came here on a Saturday night, shortly after 5pm. Wait time was an hour for 3 people.
author: B S.

description: best veggie ramen i've ever had! it's an off menu item but the waitress suggested it for me and it's perfect for those vegetarians who still want good ramen without any meat broth. it doesn't weigh u down but is still insanely satisfying. really great service. wish i had this back home!
author: Michelle W.

description: The ramen is pretty good! Will definitely try other combination next time!
author: Jay N.

description: This was fantastic ramen.  The broth was very flavorful and the portions were great.  I got the Chicken DX and they served it with with a large chicken drum on a hotplate. It was more than enough food.
author: Mark W.

description: By far the best ramen in SF. Had a 30 minutes wait for dinner during weekdays, but it was worth it. Ordered the Hakata Tonkotsu spicy. The broth was rich, chasu was flavorful, and bean sprouts were crunchy. Egg was served as a whole instead of being cut in half like in other places, but still good anyway. Definitely will come back next time I am in town.
author: Putri I.

description: Service staff seemed a little out of sorts but the food was fantastic and came out fast. The menu menu was great, you can chose your spiciness and extras. I will be going back as soon as I can.
author: Jordan M.

description: Good soup. Not the best ramen I've ever had but probably the best broth in SF. Noodles were thinner almost as thin as angel hair. Noodles were not al dente typical ramen thickness as I usually like. Nice staff. Very long line. Would come back if I were in the area.
author: Annie P.

description: One of the best ramen restaurant I ever ate even in comparing to Japan during my business trips. The only drawback is portion size which is less than generous. However, this is SF.
author: Victor L.

description: I had the chicken ramen and my some had the pork version.  Both were very good.  We got there early so only a 30 minute wait.  Price was ok.  Food was good but not worth a one hour wait if it had been busier.
author: Michelle W.

description: Big fan of Ramen clubs. So delicious so fun yumyum. Hakata w Corns.
author: Antonia P.

description: Great ramen. We had the chicken with egg. Awesome fried chicken. Loved the octopus balls. And attentive service. Will definitely come back.
author: Joel R.

description:
Definitely one of the best ramens I've ever had! I had the hakata tonkotsu ultra spicy level. I was expecting a tearful kinda spicy. It was a good spicy level but I wouldn't exactly call it ultra. So for my spicy food lovers, get the ultra! Loved the modern upscale ambience of the restaurant (and the old school rap and r&b music!) Food came out really fast and the staff was super friendly! Would definitely come back! 

One of the servers recommended that if you're really hungry, get the chicken paitan deluxe. She said you get your ramen bowl and a chicken leg on the side.
author: Hoa H.

description: It's okay it's made with MSG broth. Compared to other ramen places in J Town, of course this one is the better one. But I still preferred HINODEYA which is more authentic. For San Francisco, I think NOJO on Hayes Valley is the best!!! Authentic from Japan, spoke with the manager. This is not real true ramen. Been to Japan myself 10 times.... no no no... imagine if the broth has no MSG, it won't taste that good, trust me. Mostly non Japanese, Chinese and whites eating here.
author: Clemencia S.

description: Wow. This soft-boiled egg tho. It is the BEST soft-boiled egg I've ever had. I didn't know what to expect because Marufuku's got a lot of hype, but friends of mine said it didn't live up. Maybe they missed this ridiculous egg. The ramen itself is good, broth is fairly rich (but the noodles are very thin, almost like Chinese egg noodles), but I've probably had better. The egg definitely stole the show for sure. All in all not a bad value, if you can manage to avoid peak hours.
author: Kelly D.

description:
Very well!! Hakata Ramen as weii as good service.
Thank you!!!
author: yen t.

description: I had the signature pork ramen. It was okay but did not warrant lining up or waiting. We arrived about 10 minutes before they opened on a Saturday. We waited in the line and were seated as soon as they opened. Loaded with MSG- made my eyes red and itchy. The soft-boiled egg was excellent, though.
author: Hello T.

description: New favorite place for ramen in SF. Get the CHICKEN PAITAN DX - Chicken ramen with rich white "Paitan" broth, chicken chashu if you can. An entire chicken leg to yourself on the side. Chicken was juicy and tender. Soft boiled egg.
author: Julian W.

description: I was really surprised by the ramen here! We came for lunch around 1, and we waited for about 20 minutes. The interior is dimly lit, and their organization of the booths and middle arrangement were quite neat. There was especially a lot of room at the booths, which was surprising for a ramen place. Their choice of music was awesome; jazzy music which was calming. Service was also really nice :). I was apprehensive about this place since they didn't have miso ramen, but I got the Hakata Tonkatsu with No Spicy, and I can say that I was impressed. Everything was flavorful, and I really liked the meat; it was actually kind of sweet. I was AMAZED by their egg, though. The egg white was soft, and the middle was incredibly soft with some of the yolk oozing out. I think it was the best egg I've tasted from a ramen shop. I was also surprised I liked their thin noodles since I usually like the thick and chewy ramen noodles instead. I basically enjoyed everything except for the pink ginger, I presume it to be LOL. Needless to say, this place is awesome!!!
author: Kristine T.

description: Best ramen for the price point in the city. Quantity and quality is great; only drawback being the crazy lines that form after 6pm. If you have the patience to wait 30 mins or so, definitely is the best spot to go to!
author: Sam L.

description: Didn't even get to eat. Waited in line for 20 minutes, only to have a waitress come out and stick a sign to the door that says "Cash Only, Sorry". Did your machine break? Why don't you have a backup? Honestly very annoyed atm.
author: Zulia M.

description: Another great ramen place on the peninsula. Really enjoyed the Hakata Tonkotsu, Chicken Karrage, and Mentaiko bow. Reasonably priced. Long line indeed, but you can put your name on the waiting list and shop first.
author: L T.

description:
This is my first time at this Ramen restaurant  marufuku; Three people served me. One Taller gentlemen waitperson  staff recommended the $9.50 beer saying that it was 'beautiful' and had a sweet aftertaste.  He could not describe it Further. I asked him if it were a light lager like Stella Artois but he cannot say except for it is has a sweet finishing taste. the staff needs a lot of education,  and refinements.  The Beer did not need my expectations especially a $9. 50 12 ounce beer. The beer it's in the IPA category by the way. 

3 to 4 people came up to my table with their suggestions on what I should order!   I wasn't seeking that many suggestions it's a ramen shop not coi.  In the  end I ordered a basic spicy basic ramen with the pork belly spicy. 

hard to mixup that , unfortunately they gave me someone else's order and I took a bite or two thinking  this is not spicy.   They brought me out another bowl of Ramen which turned out to be my next table Who seem irritated at me.. It was an awkward encounter.  Two awkward encounters already. My spicy Ramen eventually came.   the noodles are thinner than I've come to expect. The broth was edible however 3 to 4 service people came to check on me during that time. Seriously just bring me my food check on me once or twice and that's enough you don't have to check in before five times while I am eating and I have to stop and answer you again and again. The restaurant was fairly empty a quarter full and I think the staff needed to be educated or refined are there cooking and their menu..  I suggest the owner have a sit down session with his new hirees every day for an 15 min explaining the concept of his restaurant.    

All in all I spent 20 min in the restaurant. And spent 30 plus dollars on a not so great meal with unrefined service on a beer. Came out of there not knowing if I will go back
author: Stefan N.

description: Waited for about an hour to get in.  Because of the reviews and the wait, I assumed this place MUST be good. Noooooo! Compare to RAMEN places in NYC, this was down right horrible.  First of all, the water cup smelled like pork fat.  Second, the ramen was discussing.   It seemed like someone wanted copy someone else's recipe and failed miserably.  It had gross smell and the meet was too dry, how do you even do that?
author: Olivia R.

description: One of the best ramen places I've been to.    We ordered the tonkasu ramen, karage bowl, and takoyaki.  Everything was cooked just right with great flavor profiles.  Prices were very reasonable!  Will definitely go back if in the SF area.
author: Evelyn C.

description: One of the best ramen places, if not the best, that I had ever tried. Great portion, reasonable price and delicious flavors. Mahalo for the hospitality and the great food!
author: Ha N.

description: Very long wait (about an hour). But totally worth it! Broth is super delicious and not too salty! They also had the most adorable bowls for the ramen. Could have gone without the hostess pushing my friend and me out of the door telling us to wait outside. Regardless, amazing ramen place.
author: Marla M.

description: My husband is Japanese and obsessed with ramen... Marufuku is the best ramen we've had in SF. ALL the dishes are great, not just the ramen. Well worth the wait if there is a line, you won't regret it!
author: Laura F.

description: Be prepared to wait at least 40 minutes for the best ramen ever!  A lot of people wait but the service is so good that you don't have to wait for very long.  The interior is very mod and super cute.  The ramen is so good with rich, delicious broth and thin noodles.  My favorite thing on the menu is the Chicken Paitan DX which is simply amazing.  I'm not a huge fan of chicken ramen but this one is amaze! I also usually don't get corn, but somehow it's one of the best things about it.  The side of chicken that comes with it is huge and so super tasty.  I can't rave enough about how good it is.  I even like the bowl that it comes in which helps the ramen stay consistently hot while you eat it. Can't find anything bad to say about this place.
author: Pepper Ann H.

description: medium spicy chicken paitan was really good, worth the 30 minute wait
author: Vivian C.

description:
i really love ramen, and i had high hopes for this place...

we ordered 3 different flavors of ramen and i cannot really say any of them was impressive. The noodles were not that great, and the broth lacks flavor also. Definitely nothing like the ramen in Japan.

The appetizers were alright though.

Overall, given the long line, and the price, I don't think I'd be going back.
author: Danielle A.

description: First time here and did not disappoint.  Got the chicken and pork ramen and it knocked it out of the park.  Also got the fried chicken app, which was one of the best I have had in the city.  Highly recommend.
author: Jonathan W.

description: I tried the chicken paitan, it was very good. we also got the chicken paitan deluxe; that came with a giant grilled chicken piece. we didn't expect that. there was a lot of food.
author: Nakul J.

description: Would never go there again. They have horrible customer service.. they need new workers. When I went there they completely kept ignoring me and walking passed me without any say. As working in a fast paced restaurant and you see someone standing there they should at least say "I will be with you shortly" or something. They made it seem like I was just invisible..I am Japanese and as in working in the heart of Japan town as some of them are Japanese they should at least have some respect but they don't. As they just opened up not to long ago either. They should at least be a bit friendly, woo as a team, and acknowledge their customers and smile but they don't.. I do not recommend this place to anyone
author: Marissa M.

description: I love this new place in the Bay Area! We went there at 11 am and started to form a line. We were able to get s table with no problem. The ramen are great and my son loves it too!
author: Woopie D.

description: One of the best ramen places that I've tried. Get the DX. Best braised lord I've ever had in my life. So good that I got sad when I finished it
author: Rachel S.

description: Soooo good! I had the chicken ramen spicy and the broth was so rich which surprised me. It's reminiscent of the ramen places in LA very modern decor and delicious :) Definitely will be a go to for ramen.
author: Carissa S.

description: How I missed the authentic ramen from Japan. This place definitely satisfies my craving for a bowl of rich broth, moist pork belly, and chewy noodle with a whole soft-boiled egg as extra point. It makes my mouth watery by thinking of it. The one I had is Hakata Tonkotsu btw. Will definitely try the others next time I go there.
author: Kimmy F.

description: Awesome new restaurant - great ramen, quick service and no wait for a table until the rest of the neighborhood catches on to this new hot spot.
author: Steve G.

description: The ramen is so good.  The broth is flavorful and delicious.  The noodles were different than what I usually have at other ramen places but really yummy!!!
author: September G.

description: Tasty ramen, but not the best I've had. Simple, but nice dinner with my wife. I would come back. Well done chashu however. Yummy, fast, cheap and easy!
author: Ron M.

description: AMAZING ramen in town!! You can taste the real Japanese food here! The broth of ramen is super tasty and loved some of the side menus as well:) I will definitely come back here when I'm in the city!!!
author: Shino K.

description: It was very good. I strolled by here with my bf looking for a lunch spot to eat and there was no line. I suggested this place since I remembered on the weekend of the cherry blossom festival there was a line and it was new. My bf just came back from Japan so he wasn't expecting much (he's lived there too). He said it was good and this is the standard in Japan. I, too be honest, do not like ramen because I don't like creamy foods and ramen is very heavy and fatty for me. However, the broth here was not too heavy or fatty. It was not overly salty as well unlike most ramen places in the bay. The noodles were the right stiffness and the soup was excellent. Especially the chicken ramen. It had a nicer flavor than the traditional pork tonkatsu ramen. The bowl size was a little smaller than regular ramen places so definitely order a size up. Even if your the type of person to eat small portions like me.
author: Hong V.

description: the soup isn't salty and surprising memorable.  there was a wait but the food was worth the wait.  will be definitely coming back here when i'm in sf japan town.
author: Min T.
